Title: Data Solutions, Business Analyst
Description:
Description




The Data & Process Solutions team within SSGA Investment Operations is seeking highly motivated, innovative Business Analysts, Assistant Vice President. This role will partner with senior Data & Process Solutions staff to execute our Data Modernization Strategy. The individual will contribute analysis on our core reference data Golden Source Systems including Product, Client and Account/Fund Masters. The analysts will also participate in daily support of the current platforms including liaising with end users to resolve production issues. Additionally, the analysts will participate in the development of enhancements to the current platforms and any future versions of our platforms including analysis, requirements documentation, testing and rollout execution.




Job Responsibilities




Participate in data management initiatives across the firm through process discovery and collaboration
Interpret end users communication to troubleshoot production issues and requirements for future enhancements
Clearly document processes and requirements
Develop and execute test scripts in partnership with our quality assurance team
Communicating with partners to ensure key parties are aware of any issues, changes or initiatives.
Develop and maintain a strong network within the firm and industry in order to stay up to date on industry trends and emerging technologies
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the organization




Additional Requirements




Strong understanding of data management concepts, principles and practices
Prior financial services or asset management experience
Ability to understand data models, data taxonomy, and a deep appreciation of data flow
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Strong written and oral communication skills
Strong presentation and interpersonal skills
Prior business operations role with data focus. Experienced in managing/monitoring data platforms with data driven objectives
Understanding of how data supports corporate strategy, is used within business processes and how to quantify its impact to business




Desired Qualifications




Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree
Agile experience and knowledge of Jira
Knowledge of Data Management applications such as Informatica, Collibra, Manta
Capabilities with Tableau and/or Alteryx




Salary Range




$80,000 - $132,500 Annual




The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Job ID: R-728976

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing & Communications
Description:
When you join the growing BILH team, you're not just taking a job, you’re making a difference in people’s lives.




Job Type:




Regular




Scheduled Hours:




40




Work Shift:




Day (United States of America)




The Data Analyst, Marketing & Communications role will be focused on analyzing, verifying, tracking and reporting on marketing and communication activities and exploring channel and activity trends and opportunities via data. In addition, they will conduct multichannel evaluation including reporting, analytics and multivariate testing. Delivers analytical expertise and marketing experience, concepts, knowledge, and skills to support initiatives and improve channel performance. Coordinates efforts across various functional groups.




Job Description:




Essential Duties & Responsibilities including but not limited to:




Analyzes, implements, and maintains marketing activities across sites and ensures goal setting and tracking.
Analyzes marketing and communications business insights to deliver on improved customer site experiences and business growth.
Designs, creates, and distributes regular analytics dashboards and reports, as well as meaningful KPIs at all levels, including executive summaries and detailed channel performance reports.
Incorporates offline data points as it relates, enhances or contributes to the reports, KPI’s and analyses.
Supports, coordinates, and collaborates to design custom reports to measure and analyze campaign effectiveness to support cross-channel marketing efforts.
Evaluates campaign activity strategy, create ads and keyword list and execute, set up tracking, perform A/B testing and explore new technology to ensure optimized campaign performance.
Operates under general guidance and work assignments are varied and require interpretation and independent decisions on course of action.
Supports the organization’s migration to an enterprise-wide CRM platform.
Day-to-day management, configuration and optimization of database for marketing and communication campaigns.
Leverage the value of the CRM database application and look for opportunities to realize a return on investment (ROI) by creating automated, multi-touch, targeted customer lifecycle digital marketing and communication programs.
Design A/B and multivariate test strategies to understand consumer insights and better identify guest behaviors and brand engagement.
Responsible for formulating, gathering, evaluating and aggregating results and building / designing actionable dashboards for stakeholders.
Perform other duties as assigned.




Minimum Qualifications:




Education: Bachelor's Degree required, or equivalent combination of education and related experience.




Licensure, Certification & Registration:




Experience:




1-3 Years Of Relevant Experience, Required.




Skills, Knowledge & Abilities:




Undertanding of methods of data storage, data cleaning and preparation for reports
Experience with analysis, exploration and determining data patterns to identify business improvements
Knowledge in statistical methods
The ability to create dashboards, reports and data visualizations
Requires excellent writing, editing and proofreading skills.
Must be able to handle sensitive and confidential information, be creative and be an overall team player.
Ability to organize time and manage diverse activities, to work successfully under pressure, and to handle competing priorities with minimal supervision.




FLSA Status:




Exempt




As a health care organization, we have a responsibility to do everything in our power to care for and protect our patients, our colleagues and our communities. Beth Israel Lahey Health requires that all staff be vaccinated against influenza (flu) and COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Learn more about this requirement.




More than 35,000 people working together. Nurses, doctors, technicians, therapists, researchers, teachers and more, making a difference in patients' lives. Your skill and compassion can make us even stronger.




Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Business Data Analyst, Planning and Analysis
Description:
Job Description




The Financial Services Department (F$D) is looking for a motivated individual to join the Planning and Analysis group. The Planning and Analysis group maintains, redefines, develops, and prepares meaningful financial reports, dashboards, and metrics in support of the Laboratory and MIT campus’ budgeting and forecasting needs. The group identifies and implements financial planning and reporting processes, systems, and reporting tools to facilitate management decision making.




The Business Data Analyst, Planning and Analysis will enhance the analysis capability of the Finance organization, while reporting to and working with the Senior Financial Manager. Responsibilities include working with executives and other business leaders to identify opportunities for improvement and collaborating with team members to collect and analyze data. The Business Data Analyst will structure large data sets to find usable information and convey insights using graphs, infographics and data visualization tools. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions.




Duties and Responsibilites




Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in complex data using statistical techniques and other analytical strategies
Develop and maintain data collection systems and databases, to acquire and utilize data from primary or secondary data sources
Work with v on data-driven strategies that improve business processes and decision-making
Deliver insights on potential areas of growth, optimization, and improvements
Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions
Convey recommendations and findings through creation and delivery of presentations and ongoing reports
Problem solve and drive positive, forward-moving change within an organization




Requirements




5-10 years proven work experience as a Business Data Analyst, preferably in a Finance Organization/ Research Environment
Technical experience with dimensional data modelling, specifically with relational models (STAR Schema is a plus), transactional models and database design development
Experience with data visualization tools (Microsoft Power BI, SAP Analytics Cloud etc.). Previous experience in creating and maintaining dashboards is a plus, but not required.
Experience with programming language, preferably SQL and Python for ETL
Ability to translate and present technical concepts and information to non-technical audience including Executive and Senior management.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing, analyzing, discussing and presenting findings
Excellent customer service in both verbal and written communication skills
Able to work independently, as well as collaboratively in both intradepartmental and interdepartmental capacities
Ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance
Proficient in MS Office (primarily Excel, Power Query, Teams, Sharepoint, Word, PowerPoint) Experience with SAP S/4 is a plus
Bachelor’s Degree in relevant fields, for example: Business, Finance, Mathematics, Economics etc…




For Benefits Information, click http://hrweb.mit.edu/benefits




The selected candidate will be subject to a pre-employment background investigation and must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret level DoD security clearance.




To safeguard our health and well-being, MIT Lincoln Laboratory requires COVID-19 vaccination for all employees. Individuals may request exemption from the vaccine requirement for medical or religious reasons.




MIT Lincoln Laboratory is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, or genetic information; U.S. citizenship is required.

Title: Analytics Associate
Description:
Our digital solutions team is more than a traditional IT organization. We are a team of passionate, collaborative, agile, inventive, customer-centric, results-oriented problem solvers. We are intellectually curious, love advancements in technology and seek to adapt technologies to drive us forward. We anticipate the needs of our customers and business partners and deliver reliable, customer-centric technology services.

What you’ll be doing:

Skilled in project management, with experience juggling multiple projects and delivering media campaigns from launch to completion
Manage and own key team documents to facilitate team organization ie. media program budget trackers, flowcharts, creative specs, reporting calendar, spend/revenue tracker, promotional calendar, etc. and take every opportunity to refine, optimize processes to work smarter and more efficiently
Opportunity to shadow/participate in ‘new business’ pitches to expand vendors (‘clients’) for the vendor media program
Provide clear and complete direction to cross-functional members and teams to design and kick-off the planning process
Work with Advertising Operations team to ensure media activation across multiple channels (offsite & onsite)
Comfortable with leading calls i.e., agency statuses, reporting/data read-outs, etc.
Support development of media campaigns alongside Media Manager (briefs, strategy development, vendor selection, budget management, etc.) to incorporate direction from all key stakeholders & deliver success on campaign KPIs.
Contribute and support agency partners to develop campaign reports/findings; ability to interpret and analyze data to optimize campaigns and develop an understanding of what the data means for the business/vendor, in conjunction with data analyst & media manager support
Promote cross functional collaboration within internal teams i.e., merchandising, marketing, media, inventory, promotional, etc. as well as a cross functional spirit between agencies
Manage all campaign details for assigned vendor campaigns, will include being day to day contact for vendor partners and multiple media agencies.

What you bring to the table:

You are someone with a growth mindset who truly thrives in a fast-paced environment, is naturally curious and stays current on the MarTech/AdTech ecosystem, digital marketing, and retail media landscape. We can’t wait for you to join our growing business!

Qualifications :

2-5 years of advertising/media or account management experience serving clients, agency experience preferred.
e-commerce, experience in a retail media network or with retail brands is a plus.
Knowledge and experience supporting digital media strategies including the planning, execution and measurement. Ideal candidates can communicate the business value of digital media and how it contributes to the ability to drive Supplier sales.
Candidates who would be successful in this role have strong process and organizational skills, work well in a face-paced team setting, and familiar with multiple digital media channels.
Must be relationship driven - building credible and trusting relationships in a dynamic environment with a broad range of colleagues, executive stakeholders & business partners (internal + external).
Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects in parallel with unique deliverables and timelines.

Title: Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Would you like to be part of a team that is committed to its data driven journey? From test-driving the latest technologies to creating innovative solutions that will enable us to deliver valuable enhancements to Liberty Mutual employees across the globe. Liberty Mutual is constantly innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind for our customers, brokers and agents worldwide. As an analyst at Liberty Mutual, you’ll apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a start-up—and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100 company.

About The Job

As a data analyst within Digital Customer Experience, you will support the planning and execution of processes and technology used to support the onboarding of P&C Claims data from new Helmsman third party administration (TPA) takeover customers. This Includes the analysis, execution and quality of data transformation/production loads, and the modernization of the technology to support all aspects of the claim takeover process, as well as the data/information needs of internal/external stakeholders. The data analyst works directly with implementation managers, Internal stakeholders and data transformation vendors to deliver required data services on schedule and accurately.

This is a range posting and the description is posted as a Grade 16, Sr Data Analyst However, candidates will be considered for Grade 14 Data Analyst job family. The actual internal level/grade for this role will depend on the candidate’s overall experience and skill level.

Responsibilities

Participates in the evaluation of business requirements.
Transforms client requests into data deliverables to include data models, data mappings and data transformation rules.
Contributes to the development of project plans for data deliverables with strict adherence to production commit dates. Depicts moderately complex to complex ideas, issues and data designs to varied audiences.
Contributes to the development of project plans and supports development team throughout project lifecycle including during test phase researches test issues and data content, and assists with moderately complex problem resolution.
Participates in the creation and implementation of new standards and procedures.
Investigates components of new tools and techniques.
Performs related duties as assigned or requested.
Bachelor's Degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent technical expertise.
General knowledge in the following areas; IT concepts, strategies and methodologies, IT architectures and data standards, and general knowledge of a business function(s) and of business operations. Extensive knowledge of data design and tools required.
Proficiency in SQL and DBMS languages and tools; knowledgeable in new and emerging technologies. Good negotiation and communication skills.
Strong working knowledge of Excel, Informatica and other BI Tools for data transformation, validation and testing. Experience interrogation, validating and testing large data sets.
Experience/familiarity working with P&C Claims data preferred.

Would you like to be part of a team that is committed to its data driven journey? From test-driving the latest technologies to creating innovative solutions that will enable us to deliver valuable enhancements to Liberty Mutual employees across the globe. Liberty Mutual is constantly innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind for our customers, brokers and agents worldwide. As an analyst at Liberty Mutual, you’ll apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a start-up—and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100 company.

About The Job

As a data analyst within Digital Customer Experience, you will support the planning and execution of processes and technology used to support the onboarding of P&C Claims data from new Helmsman third party administration (TPA) takeover customers. This Includes the analysis, execution and quality of data transformation/production loads, and the modernization of the technology to support all aspects of the claim takeover process, as well as the data/information needs of internal/external stakeholders. The data analyst works directly with implementation managers, Internal stakeholders and data transformation vendors to deliver required data services on schedule and accurately.

This is a range posting and the description is posted as a Grade 16, Sr Data Analyst However, candidates will be considered for Grade 14 Data Analyst job family. The actual internal level/grade for this role will depend on the candidate’s overall experience and skill level.

Responsibilities
  • Participates in the evaluation of business requirements.
  • Transforms client requests into data deliverables to include data models, data mappings and data transformation rules.
  • Contributes to the development of project plans for data deliverables with strict adherence to production commit dates. Depicts moderately complex to complex ideas, issues and data designs to varied audiences.
  • Contributes to the development of project plans and supports development team throughout project lifecycle including during test phase researches test issues and data content, and assists with moderately complex problem resolution.
  • Participates in the creation and implementation of new standards and procedures.
  • Investigates components of new tools and techniques.
  • Performs related duties as assigned or requested.
  • Bachelor's Degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent technical expertise.
  • General knowledge in the following areas; IT concepts, strategies and methodologies, IT architectures and data standards, and general knowledge of a business function(s) and of business operations. Extensive knowledge of data design and tools required.
  • Proficiency in SQL and DBMS languages and tools; knowledgeable in new and emerging technologies. Good negotiation and communication skills.
  • Strong working knowledge of Excel, Informatica and other BI Tools for data transformation, validation and testing. Experience interrogation, validating and testing large data sets.
  • Experience/familiarity working with P&C Claims data preferred.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
Data Modeler

Reports to the Director of BI




Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence of Enterprise Data and Solutions of Information Technology, the Data Modeler is a key member of the Business Intelligence team responsible for the design of data model solutions that reduce data redundancy, streamline the movement of data, ensure data security and privacy standards, and improve overall institutional data management. The Data Modeler will be accountable for analyzing and translating business needs into long-term, sustainable data models across various data subject areas including Enrollment Management, Academic Affairs, Campus Life, Finance, and Human Resources by transforming various applications data sources into a centralized data platform. Excellent data query and data analytical ability with strong academic and college business knowledge are essential.




ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

Develop plan for business intelligence initiatives, recommend innovative technologies, methods, and industry-leading data modeling tools and best practices, design and maintenance of a system to warehouse data and information, including structured and unstructured data sets. Organize and transform data into comprehensible data models.
Map data from new sources to the central data model to support the creation of new or extension of existing reports/dashboards and perform data validation. Provide requirements and execute data extraction, transformation, and load procedures.
Support Argos and Tableau platforms through building data pipelines to facilitate the growth of dashboards and incorporate new and diversified data sources.
Manages all technical aspects of our business intelligence environment, including data transformation and governance, performance monitoring and identification and support of analytics tools. Conduct regular architecture, security, data management, permissions reviews to enable proper data access/management to sources.
Use complex data analysis and query, data science and data modeling techniques to develop reports and data analytics solutions. This includes engineering solutions in the form of business dashboards, reports and data visualizations integrating with internal and external public data sources like College Board or IPEDS. Provide statistical analysis of data, predict trends on business and academic performance, use data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns.
Actively organize data literacy, report and dashboard training to key business users. Focus on storytelling to solve practical business issues and evolve data analytics for department engagement.
Partner with academic units and business departments such as Institutional Research, Enrollment Management, Registrar, Finance, HR, Financial Aid and Institutional Advancement to define and analyze data needs, gather reports or data requirements, perform data mapping to create BI solutions to solve business issues. This often involves conducting complex root cause analysis to troubleshoot data discrepancies, work with end users to correct business processes, and systematically cleanse inaccurate data sets.
Identify, collect and maintain data sets to effectively support the publishing and performance of relevant business area metrics and KPIs including Enrollment Management, IR, IA, Academic Affairs, Finance, HR, IT and MTP.
Effectively work and collaborate with PMO on BI projects, ensure deliverables are completed on time, and objectives are met.
Manage tables and data views within Oracle database, SQL Server, PostgreSQL and synchronize with data models using appropriate ETL tools. Keep current on the latest technologies, develop proof-of-concept data model prototypes to advance the BI program. Commit to professional development by fostering a climate of team learning, cross-training and knowledge base building.
Handle complex data issues with minimal supervision, while escalating critical issues to management using sound judgment. Enforce data quality, knowledge retention, and process consistency through the curation and expansion of the institutional data dictionary/catalog.
Communicate effectively with internal team and external business users through written, verbal and visual storytelling. Develop detailed technical specifications, data mapping and data flow documentations for major data analytics projects.
Perform other duties as assigned.




QUALIFICATIONS – Qualifications are deemed required or preferred and represent what is needed to effectively perform job.

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business or a similar degree, combined work experience and education as equivalent
10 years’ combined experience as data modeler, business intelligence analyst or advanced report writer
6 years’ experience in database systems management. Hands on experience in data model/data warehouse design. Solid understanding of dimension/fact table structure and data aggregation.
5 years of experience in ETL tools and procedures
Programming language(s) for ETL and data pipelining
3 years of Tableau or other dashboard development experience
Higher Education experience preferred
Experience working with Ellucian Banner, Slate, Canvas or Workday preferred
Experience with HelioCampus preferred




KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES – May be representative, but not all-inclusive, of those knowledge, skills, and abilities commonly associated with the job.

Demonstrated organization, creativity, and agile problem-solving approach to resolve problems of diverse scope and complexity within deadlines.
Excellent organizational, creativity, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to multi-task and manage time effectively.
Active participation in organization level activities and events related to learning, training, special projects etc.
Experience ingesting, organizing, and representing data within a data model in formats that are easy to use, understand and meet business objectives.
Expertise in defining and managing relational data, dimensional data, unstructured data, and master data to effectively translate and communicate data to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Can develop end-to-end solutions from constructing the data set to visualizing information in a tool like Tableau or Argos reports and dashboards.
Demonstrates best practices to use modern layouts, typography and interaction design.
Excellent knowledge on data modeling, data extraction and data transformation using SQL, PostgreSql, Oracle or ETL tools.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and ability to deliver messages and ideas effectively for different audiences.
Experienced with data mapping, business process analysis, criteria and data flow documentation in written or visual format.
Excellent presentation and storyboarding skills.
Experience working with data models or data warehouses.
Capable of working on problems of diverse scope and complexity, is resourceful in developing solutions encompassing challenges to deliver solutions before the deadlines.
Following standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data to obtain trustworthy results.
Is a fast learner and able to apply new and emerging technologies to the existing BI product portfolio to achieve meaningful business outcomes through applying complex data analysis, data science and the data modeling techniques, from descriptive and diagnostic analytics to more advanced predictive modeling.
Ability to keep updated on the latest technologies with technology training and professional development.
Self-motivated, responsible and detail oriented.
Ability to work independently and with a team.
Strong SQL query, PL/SQL and Oracle relational databases skills
Strong Excel skill and efficient use of visual tools
Ability to optimize performance of data models
Experience working with data stewards and data governance
Knowledge of SDLC and project management best practices
Familiarity with AWS Redshift or Snowflake preferred
Python or other scripting or data integration technologies preferred

Title: Associate Master Data Analyst
Description:
Join a team of more than 30,000 team members, comprised of our Club Support Center and over 230 clubs and 7 distribution centers. We’re committed to delivering value and convenience to our Members, helping them save every day on everything they need for their families and homes. BJ’s Wholesale Club offers a collaborative, team environment where all team members can learn, grow and be themselves.




The Benefits Of Working At BJ’s




BJ’s pays weekly
Generous time off programs to support busy lifestyles*
Vacation, Personal, Holiday, Sick, Bereavement Leave, Jury Duty
Benefit plans for your changing needs*
Three medical plans**, Health Reimbursement Account (HRA), Health Savings Account (HSA), two dental plans, flexible spending
eligibility requirements vary by position
medical plans vary by location




Responsible for interpreting, analyzing and implementing requests from the business for new and/or updated SAP Master Data. Prepare the Master Data load files and/or manually input the changes directly into SAP. Controls changes to master data to support the modification to existing products and phase out of products from forecasting, purchasing, production, sales and storage functions. Troubleshoot concerns highlighted by the business units supported and analyze/complete service requests to drive profit growth. Responsible for the on-going review and maintenance of the Master Data Ad-hoc assignments related to item data integrity. Develop expertise related to the underlying SAP data model and design. Adhere to processes and procedures for the development and setup of SAP master data. Provide SAP master data support for Merchandising and Supply Chain end users.




Requirements




Bachelor’s degree in related discipline (Business Administration or Information Management) and/or demonstrated capability to perform job responsibilities through previous experience
2-4 years of Retail experience preferred
Enterprise Data Management experience is preferred
SAP or similar ERP system experience is a plus
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite; Beginner level Excel skills required

Title: Sr. Specialist, Data Analyst
Description:
The Role:

The strategic operations team consists of the Project Management Office (PMO) and Operational Excellence activities that support the commercial and clinical end to end operations to ensure consistent and scalable processes as Moderna grows in complexity and breath. The Data Analyst will be focusing on supporting the various teams across the business by providing metrics, analytics, visual boards, and reporting. This role will be accountable for supporting new systems, metrics, and reporting, that will guide best practices, operating models, and structure across the business.

The role will require someone with manufacturing background who is a hands-on individual contributor that will build relationships at all levels and areas of the organization to understand the metrics needed. He/she should expect to implement and support new practices that maximize business value and efficiencies. To be successful, you must possess strong skills in data gathering, analysis, and visualization and work collaboratively in a highly cross-functional environment across commercial and clinical GMP Operations, Supply Chain, Finance, HR, Quality, and other support areas. The role is based in Moderna’s Technology Center campus in Norwood, MA. This role is open to a hybrid option of some days remote and some days onsite during the week.

Here’s What You’ll Do:

Partner with cross-functional teams across GMP operations such as Quality, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, MS&T, HR, and other areas to define and / or fulfill data reporting requirements on a daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual basis. Provide data for site metrics, presentations, and other forms of communication. Support projects and business needs by providing expertise to the teams on data gathering/analysis.

Qualifications:

Experience in a data analyst or equivalent role
Experience in data analysis software (i.e., Tableau, Spotfire)
Experience in data clean up and mapping across multiple systems
Experience in data querying in SAP, Veeva, OSI PI or other similar applications
Strong Microsoft Office capabilities (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Ability to query and refine data into aggregated results
Experience with mapping of requirements from data warehouse to customer
Previous experience with executing a project related to establishing new KPI or redefining reported KPI to meet business/quality requirements
Strong structured problem-solving skills
Advanced ability with Microsoft Excel (e.g., pivot reporting, advanced charting, VBA & macros)
Advanced ability with statistical methods (e.g., statistical process control)
Contribute to innovative approaches related to data reporting, availability, and transparency based on best-practice dashboards, metrics, and other relevant reporting mechanisms


Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:

Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, data management/analytics, or engineering preferred OR an equivalent combination of education/certification and work experience. (Minimum 5 years’ experience)
Relevant work experience supporting data analysis and trending, preferably in a biotech/Pharma/medical device environment.
Proven results-orientation with strong influencing, problem solving, and negotiation skills that will drive accountability. Ability to build relationships and influence individuals across all levels in the organization.
Ability to work quickly, assimilate key data, recognize key variables, analyze data, provide key insights, and make quality judgements.
Excellent interpersonal, organizational, written, and verbal presentation skills along with ability to work collaboratively and build rapport across a matrixed environment.


Moderna is pleased to provide you and your family with a comprehensive and innovative suite of benefits, including:

Highly competitive and inclusive medical, dental and vision coverage options
Flexible Spending Accounts for medical expenses and dependent care expenses
Lifestyle Spending Account funds to help you engage in personal enrichment and self-care activities
Family care benefits, including subsidized back-up care options and on-demand tutoring
Free premium access to fitness, nutrition, and mindfulness classes
Exclusive preferred pricing on Peloton fitness equipment
Adoption and family-planning benefits
Dedicated care coordination support for our LGBTQ+ community
Generous paid time off, including:
Vacation, sick time and holidays
Volunteer time to participate within your community
Discretionary year-end shutdown
Paid sabbatical after 5 years; every 3 years thereafter
Generous Paid Leave offerings, including 18 weeks of 100% paid parental leave for all new parents
401k match and Financial Planning tools
Moderna-paid Life, LTD and STD insurance coverages, as well as voluntary benefit options
Complimentary concierge service including home services research, travel booking, and entertainment requests
Free parking or subsidized commuter passes
Location-specific perks and extras!


Candidates should be aware that Moderna currently maintains a policy requiring all US-based employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and receive a booster shot once eligible. Newly hired employees must be vaccinated and boosted prior to their employment start date. Moderna is an equal opportunity employer and will provide a reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated or receive a booster where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under federal, state, and local law.

About Moderna

In over 10 years since its inception, Moderna has transformed from a research-stage company advancing programs in the field of messenger RNA (mRNA), to an enterprise with a diverse clinical portfolio of vaccines and therapeutics across seven modalities, a broad intellectual property portfolio in areas including mRNA and lipid nanoparticle formulation, and an integrated manufacturing plant that allows for rapid clinical and commercial production at scale. Moderna maintains alliances with a broad range of domestic and overseas government and commercial collaborators, which has allowed for the pursuit of both groundbreaking science and rapid scaling of manufacturing. Most recently, Moderna's capabilities have come together to allow the authorized use and approval of one of the earliest and most effective vaccines against the COVID-19 pandemic.

Moderna's mRNA platform builds on continuous advances in basic and applied mRNA science, delivery technology and manufacturing, and has allowed the development of therapeutics and vaccines for infectious diseases, immuno-oncology, rare diseases, cardiovascular diseases and autoimmune diseases. Moderna has been named a top biopharmaceutical employer by Science for the past seven years. To learn more, visit www.modernatx.com.

Moderna is a smoke-free, alcohol-free and drug-free work environment.

Moderna is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person’s race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation or any characteristic protected under applicable law. Moderna will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

  • Moderna-paid Life, LTD and STD insurance coverages, as well as voluntary benefit options
  • Complimentary concierge service including home services research, travel booking, and entertainment requests
  • Free parking or subsidized commuter passes
  • Location-specific perks and extras!

Candidates should be aware that Moderna currently maintains a policy requiring all US-based employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and receive a booster shot once eligible. Newly hired employees must be vaccinated and boosted prior to their employment start date. Moderna is an equal opportunity employer and will provide a reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated or receive a booster where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under federal, state, and local law.

About Moderna

In over 10 years since its inception, Moderna has transformed from a research-stage company advancing programs in the field of messenger RNA (mRNA), to an enterprise with a diverse clinical portfolio of vaccines and therapeutics across seven modalities, a broad intellectual property portfolio in areas including mRNA and lipid nanoparticle formulation, and an integrated manufacturing plant that allows for rapid clinical and commercial production at scale. Moderna maintains alliances with a broad range of domestic and overseas government and commercial collaborators, which has allowed for the pursuit of both groundbreaking science and rapid scaling of manufacturing. Most recently, Moderna's capabilities have come together to allow the authorized use and approval of one of the earliest and most effective vaccines against the COVID-19 pandemic.

Moderna's mRNA platform builds on continuous advances in basic and applied mRNA science, delivery technology and manufacturing, and has allowed the development of therapeutics and vaccines for infectious diseases, immuno-oncology, rare diseases, cardiovascular diseases and autoimmune diseases. Moderna has been named a top biopharmaceutical employer by Science for the past seven years. To learn more, visit www.modernatx.com.

Moderna is a smoke-free, alcohol-free and drug-free work environment.

Moderna is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person’s race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation or any characteristic protected under applicable law. Moderna will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
Position Summary:

The Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) Team within the Fiscal Department of the client is looking for Data Reporting Analyst with at least four years of experience to support multiple project-based initiatives in support, SQL development, data analysis, financial model creation, financial analysis and reporting as well as the implementation of various Commonwealth systems. The position requires a balance of technical knowledge of infrastructure, deployments along with strong communication, reporting, analysis, project and task management. 

 

Responsibilities:

Creates data models, reports and assessments
Identifies and solves project issues
Drafts evaluations; presentations
Creates strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning and project risk assessment
Focuses on data integrity (past validation efforts, very large data sets)
Manages complex projects from design and development to production
Reviews requirements and updates plan project lifecycle deployment
Reviews resources and updates schedule for project implementation
Plans and schedules project deliverables, goals, milestones
Designs and maintain technical and project documentation
Designs and updates relational databases, SQL, financial applications and governance documents
Identifies and solves project issues
Applies financial/accounting principles and best practices
Works with end users to gather and document requirements

Qualifications:

Strong Financial Report Writing (SQL), Access DB, PowerBI, Tableau
Strong Analytical/Problem solving skills
Knowledge of cloud data servers and warehouse, PSQL, Amazon Redshift
Knowledge of data visualization, programming, API’s, data pipelines
Strong critical thinking and data management skills
Strong professional communication (written, presentation and verbal) skills
Strong interpersonal skills and professionalism
Proficiency in the following MS Project, MS Office
Understanding of Accounting/Finance Principles (Government background preferred) 
Experience creating efficiencies using software (time/cost savings as a direct result of independent work)
PMP (Project Management Professional) Certification or equivalent preferred.
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Analytics, Data, Technology, Management, Finance, Accounting or related field
Minimum 3 years of project management or IT Management experience
Minimum 4 years’ experience coordinating and/supporting IT business processes
Former local, state, federal government experience preferred

Other

·       Employment is contingent upon passage of a criminal record check.

 

 

Best Wishes!!

Title: Data and Analytics Consultant
Description:
Consultant

We are looking for Consultants with a strong background building modern data & analytics solutions. You must have a solid understanding of cloud data platforms and the data & analytics ecosystem, with hands-on experience across data engineering, data science and data visualization.

You will be part of a highly collaborative and growing team of data and platform experts, who are solving today’s most complex challenges leveraging modern data and analytics technologies. There is never a “typical day” at CTI, that’s why people love to work here and we have the highest employee retention rates in the industry!

Responsibilities include:

· Contribute to the delivery of modern data & analytics solutions for Global 2000 customers

· Develop data integration pipelines/ETL/ELT, BI dashboards & reports, data science algorithms, CI/CD deployment pipelines, APIs

At a minimum, we’re looking for:

4+ years of experience and progressive responsibility in data & analytics and modern data platforms

2+ years of deep experience building cloud data solutions (Azure or AWS)

Hands-on experience and specialization in various data and analytics disciplines including some of the following (data engineering, ETL/ELT, ML/AI, streaming, API integration and development, data/dev ops, data science, data virtualization)

· Proficient in SQL and/or Python

· Strong communication skills

· 3+ years project-based consulting experience

· Nice-to-haves include expertise in leading data and analytics technology stacks, such as Azure (ADF, Functions, Event Hub/Grid, Streaming, Synapse), AWS (Kinesis, Firehouse, Glue) Snowflake, DBT, Databricks, Informatica, DBT, Denodo, Tableau, Qlik, Power BI

· Limited regional travel to client locations as needed

· Authorization to work in the U.S., without the requirement for an employment visa or sponsorship

Title: Regulatory Data Analyst
Description:
Company





Federal Reserve Bank of Boston




Working at the Federal Reserve Bank positions you at the center of the financial world with a unique perspective on national and international markets and economies. You will work in an environment with a diverse group of experienced professionals to foster and support the safety, soundness, and vitality of our economic and financial systems. It is a challenge that demands the skills of a financial service professional and the intelligence of an academic—all combined with a passion for public service.




This job is eligible for a hybrid schedule with some on-site work expected




Regulatory Data Analyst




The Federal Reserve Bank of Boston has an opening for a Regulatory Data Analyst to join our Statistics Unit. Reporting to the team Supervisors, you will focus on data quality assurance and analysis of regulatory financial data received from depository and financial institutions.




Overview of Team/ Function:




The Statistics Unit at the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston is structured under the Supervision, Regulation, and Credit Department. We collect and analyze financial data submitted to the Federal Reserve Bank by a variety of institutions, to ensure that the reported data are "reasonable" and fit for their intended use of supporting monetary policy and financial stability efforts. Data processed by our unit are also used to develop surveillance models, which our examiners and analysts use to determine the financial condition of banking institutions.




Depending on the banking, or supervisory experience level, the ideal candidate will be eligible to be placed in any one of a range of positions within the Business Analyst job family, including Business Analyst or Senior Business Analyst I.




Responsibilities:




Provide financial and business analyses that highlight data issues, and present contextual information that supports the reasonableness of the reported data.
Recognize, identify, and document data anomalies, trends, and cause-effect relationships to ensure data are "reasonable" and fit for their intended use of supporting monetary policy and financial stability efforts.
Effectively communicate with multiple stakeholders (internal and external) about needed corrective actions related to data quality.
Summarize multiple sources of information concerning data collections and relationships to produce well-supported and influential analyses and inquiries.
Build effective working relationships with reporting firms' financial management teams.
Work with local and national colleagues to support data analyses and regulatory reporting projects.
Contribute to local and national programs that support the strategic direction of the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston and the System.
Follow macroeconomic trends and identify potential impact on firms' regulatory reporting.
Research potential changes to key accounting rules, laws, regulations, and supervisory policies, and evaluate their relevance to, and impact on, institutions’ regulatory reporting.
Advance and support diversity and inclusion efforts and encourage diverse perspectives and approaches.




Qualifications:




Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related discipline or equivalent.
4+ years of relevant regulatory reporting or closely related banking industry experience.
Detailed financial statement analysis.
Working knowledge of the Call Report and the FR Y-9C.
Strong critical thinking skills, including, assessing information, proposing a solution, and implementing a decision.
Deliver communications that convey technical topics in simple and concise terms.
Experience connecting with all levels of an organization.
Effective time management skills.




Our total rewards program offers benefits that are the best fit for you at every stage of your career:




Comprehensive healthcare options (Medical, Dental, and Vision)
401K match, and a fully funded pension plan
Paid vacation and holidays; flexible work environment, healthy workflow
Generously subsidized public transportation
Annual tuition reimbursement
Professional development programs, training, and conferences
And more…




The Federal Reserve Bank is committed to a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace and to provide equal employment opportunities to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, or military service.




This position requires access to confidential supervisory information and/or FOMC information, which is limited to "Protected Individuals" as defined in the U.S. federal immigration law. Protected Individuals include, but are not limited to, U.S. citizens, U.S. nationals, and U.S. permanent residents who either are not yet eligible to apply for naturalization or who have applied for naturalization within the requisite timeframe. Candidates who are not U.S. citizens or U.S. permanent residents may be eligible for the information access required for this position and sponsorship for a work visa, and subsequently for permanent residence, if they sign a declaration of intent to become a U.S. citizen and meet other eligibility requirements.




All employees assigned to this position will be subject to FBI fingerprint/ criminal background and Patriot Act/ Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) watch list checks at least once every five years. All candidates must undergo an enhanced background check and comply with all applicable information handling rules.




The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work required of this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities or skills associated with this position or the personnel so classified. While this job description is intended to be an accurate reflection of this position, management reserves the right to revise this or any job description at its discretion at any time.




Full Time / Part Time




Full time




Regular / Temporary




Regular




Job Exempt (Yes / No)




Yes




Job Category




Work Shift




First (United States of America)




The Federal Reserve Banks believe that diversity and inclusion among our employees is critical to our success as an organization, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. The Federal Reserve Banks are committed to equal employment opportunity for employees and job applicants in compliance with applicable law and to an environment where employees are valued for their differences.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Description

We are looking for a Lead, Data Analyst to join the team. This individual will play a key role in helping to leverage data to drive operational, business, and patient safety related decisions. If you’re seeking an opportunity that will provide a track towards a management/leadership opportunity, this is the role for you. This role reports directly to the Head of Advanced Analytics.

Responsibilities
Timely triage operational and project tasks, communicate with leaders of business units on deliverables and timelines and seek guidance from direct manager, Head of Advanced Analytics when needed
Mentor junior analysts on the team and guide priority setting and research & analytics methodologies
Develop and maintain effective relationships across CRICO departments and with external members & clients
Partner with CRICO internal colleagues (Patient Safety, CRICO Candello, Claims, Underwriting, Finance), business users (CRICO’s member institutions and non-member clients) to understand business problems, define requirements, develop analytics methods & plan, and execute against them to ensure timely and quality delivery of results and insights in serving CRICO, CRICO’s members and Candello clients
Generate analyses ideas and methodology proposals
Gather context and discuss requirements for analyses
Follow policies relating to privacy and security, and obtain necessary signoffs
Design queries, gather data, and create reports and graphics in response to regular and ad hoc requests
Synthesize and interpret data/results to make appropriate conclusions and relevant insights
Validate results to ensure accuracy before presenting them to the requester
Present findings to internal and external stakeholders when needed
Serve as a sounding board for peers and customers needing guidance in data analytics or methodology inquires
Identify, explore, communicate, and resolve issues surrounding data quality and analytic processes
Develop, maintain, and document knowledge in customer support, risk management, patient safety and loss prevention activities, insurance operations, and reflect understanding back via analytical work
Partners with the Analytics team, the IS Department, or other relevant resources to develop report templates and optimize data structures and analytic tools either through regular maintenance or ad hoc project when needed
Perform other related duties and ad hoc projects as required


Requirements

Bachelor’s degree required, with 3-5 year’s relevant experience in analytics, Business Intelligence development, Operations, or Information Systems
Experience in mentoring or managing junior staff or interest in growing into a managerial role
Knowledge and skills in visualization software and dashboard development tools (such as Power BI, Tableau) is required
Knowledge of relational databases and familiarity with Structured Query Language (SQL) is required
Experience in healthcare, insurance industry, or health policy is preferred
Project management skill/experience a plus
As of September 15th, 2021, as a condition of employment, all CRICO employees are required to be vaccinated, and must produce proof of vaccination

Title: Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
Description

We are looking for a certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Data Analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design, as well as developing analysis and reporting capabilities. You will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

What you get to do every day

Design business analysis and data recording systems for use throughout the department
Help various departments, including marketing and sales, reach their goals through analysis
Monitor data to identify changes in financial and business trends
Create business reports that provide insight into key data points
Maintain databases and perform updates as necessary for accuracy
Accurately analyze and collect data for various types of business reports
Analyze data reports regularly, identifying and resolving any mistakes
Communicate the results of data analysis in written and verbal form to managers

Requirements

Detail oriented with a tendency to pay close attention to small details that could impact results
Skilled in time management and prioritization to meet project deadlines
Ability to use data tools to create pivot tables, graphs and charts
One to three years of experience as a financial or business analyst
Strong analytical skills that allow for the development of data-driven reports
General knowledge of business operations, objectives, strategies, process and information flow
Skilled in object-oriented programming and other data analysis programs
Superb critical thinking skills to make decisions and solve business problems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively relate data to coworkers

Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®

Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.

Description

We are looking for a certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Data Analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design, as well as developing analysis and reporting capabilities. You will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

What you get to do every day

Title: Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Reporting Analyst

Location: Boston, MA

Duration: 9 Months (possible extension)

Hours per Week: 37.5 (not to exceed 7.5 per day)

Position Summary

TheTeam within the Department is looking for Data Reporting Analyst with at least 4 years of experience to support multiple project-based initiatives in support, SQL development, data analysis, financial model creation, financial analysis and reporting as well as the implementation of various Commonwealth systems.
The position requires a balance of technical knowledge of infrastructure, deployments along with strong communication, reporting, analysis, project and task management.
Responsibilities:

Creates data models, reports and assessments
Identifies and solves project issues
Drafts evaluations; presentations
Creates strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning and project risk assessment
Focuses on data integrity (past validation efforts, very large data sets)
Manages complex projects from design and development to production
Reviews requirements and updates plan project lifecycle deployment
Reviews resources and updates schedule for project implementation
Plans and schedules project deliverables, goals, milestones
Designs and maintain technical and project documentation
Designs and updates relational databases, SQL, financial applications and governance documents
Identifies and solves project issues
Applies financial/accounting principles and best practices
Works with end users to gather and document requirements

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree or higher in Analytics, Data, Technology, Management, Finance, Accounting or related field
Minimum 3 years of project management or IT Management experience
Minimum 4 years experience coordinating and/supporting IT business processes
Strong Financial Report Writing (SQL), Access DB, PowerBI, Tableau
Strong Analytical/Problem solving skills
Knowledge of cloud data servers and warehouse, PSQL, Amazon Redshift
Knowledge of data visualization, programming, API's, data pipelines
Strong critical thinking and data management skills
Strong professional communication (written, presentation and verbal) skills
Strong interpersonal skills and professionalism
Proficiency in the following MS Project, MS Office
Understanding of Accounting/Finance Principles (Government background preferred)
Experience creating efficiencies using software (time/cost savings as a direct result of independent work)
PMP (Project Management Professional) Certification or equivalent preferred.
Former local, state, federal government experience preferred

Other

Employment is contingent upon passage of a criminal record check.
The selected candidate(s) must provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination to the Trial Court's Human Resources Department prior to their start date or agree to submit to weekly testing as a condition of employment.

Title: Health Care Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are




Point32Health is a leading health and wellbeing organization, delivering an ever-better personalized health care experience to everyone in our communities. At Point32Health, we are building on the quality, nonprofit heritage of our founding organizations, Tufts Health Plan and Harvard Pilgrim Health Care, where we leverage our experience and expertise to help people find their version of healthier living through a broad range of health plans and tools that make navigating health and wellbeing easier.




We enjoy the important work we do every day in service to our members, partners, colleagues and communities.




Job Summary




Facilitate all processes related to maintenance of Commercial Pricing and Forecasting team data and internal and external reporting needs. The analyst will work closely with leaders on the team, as well as IT and Finance.




An understanding of the health insurance industry, a working knowledge of industry code sets (e.g., diagnoses, procedures, paces of service, etc.), proficiency in relational databases, data warehouses, SAS or related query language, Excel, as well as strong communication and interpersonal skills are required.




Key Responsibilities/Duties – What You Will Be Doing
Maintain team data sets
run monthly process to update membership, claims, and premium data
check this data against other sources and investigate variances
Regulatory Reporting
run queries of data warehouses to support regulatory and other reporting
independently check these results
present preliminary reports to team leaders
Support other reporting and ad hoc analyses

Qualifications – What You Need To Perform The Job

QUALIFICATIONS – what you need to perform the job

Education, Certification And Licensure

College degree required

EXPERIENCE (minimum Years Required)

3+ year’s experience

Skill Requirements

Demonstrated experience in analytic work
Proficiency in the use of personal computers, relational databases, statistical packages, spreadsheet and/or database applications
Well-developed verbal and written skills
Able to facilitate planning and review sessions
Developing presentation skills, presents mostly within department and to project teams
Able to operate in a matrix environment
Able to implement Actuarial department standards and processes.
Must be able to work cooperatively as a team member.Regular interface with various levels of staff and management is required as well.

WORKING CONDITIONS AND ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS (include special requirements, e.g., lifting, travel):

Must be able to work under normal office conditions and work from home as required.
Work may require simultaneous use of a telephone/headset and PC/keyboard and sitting for extended durations.
May be required to work additional hours beyond standard work schedule.

Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Point32Health is committed to making diversity, equity, and inclusion part of everything we do—from product design to the workforce driving that innovation. Our DEI strategy is deeply connected to our core values and will evolve as the changing nature of work shifts. Programming, events, and an inclusion infrastructure play a role in how we spread cultural awareness, train people leaders on engaging with their teams and provide parameters on how to recruit and retain talented and dynamic talent. We welcome all applicants and qualified individuals, who will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

COVID Policy

Please note: As of January 18, 2022, all employees — including remote employees — must be fully vaccinated. This position will require the successful candidate to show proof of full vaccination against COVID-19. Point32Health is an equal opportunity employer, and will consider reasonable accommodation to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated consistent with federal, state, and local law.

Title: Analyst, Data Tools & Platforms
Description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.

Job Description

The Platforms & Data capability provides subject matter expertise and support on centralized platforms and data sources used by brand teams and marketing operation to help improve efficiency in the tactical execution of marketing programs and materials development.

The Marketing Operations & Program Management (MOPM) Team provides subject matter expertise in the processes and platforms Takeda's marketing teams use to put compliant print and digital materials in front of patients and into the hands of HCPs and Field Teams. MOPM also helps bring transparency into agency and brand teams' operational performance by using platform data for reporting and insight generation. Through its efforts, MOPM helps improve efficiency in execution and enable marketing's decision making around the operational metrics that matter most to the business.

How You Will Contribute

POSITION TARGET OUTCOMES/ OBJECTIVES:

Ensure the commercial platforms and technologies used across Takeda's brand and marketing teams are fully integrated and standardized; perform y release-management activity associated with these platforms as defined by management
Partner with stakeholders across the business to ensure that desired KPIs are documented, and integrated into reporting platforms
Implement projects to develop capabilities of commercial platforms such as electronic approval system, and promotional material ordering portal


Accountable Areas Of Focus & Oversight

Note: ""Span of focus"" indicates areas that fall under the responsibility of this role. Depending on team priorities and resourcing levels, not all activities associated with span of focus will be prioritized in any given calendar year.
Platforms & System Execution. Implement projects related to all Commercial Operations platform. Span of focus includes:
Serve as point of contact for platform support across all commercial brand marketing teams
Manage build the, implementation and maintenance of any commercial platforms used for US Promotional Materials or other key marketing program assets e.g., Veeva, Content Management System (CMS), promotional materials ordering
Provide ongoing operational support for functionality and use
Oversee all release-management associated with these platforms. Ensure effective user uptake of new releases and system upgrades, developing all necessary project plans, training, and stakeholder communication plans.
Promote integration of existing Commercial platforms with other technologies as needed.
Integration of Marketing Operations Data: Execute projects related to Marketing Operations data. Span of focus includes:
Serve as subject matter expert on data model with regards to Marketing Operations platforms including electronic approval system, events management system and grant management system
Partner with IT and Commercial Operations stakeholders to implement best practices on the management, storage of data within the framework of Takeda's enterprise data management model
Partner with IT, external vendors and Commercial Stakeholders on extract, transform and load (ETL) project work related to Marketing Operations data
Perform testing, validation work to ensure integrity of commercial data across Marketing Operations platforms
Marketing Operations Analytics & Insights. Manage development/ maintenance of data visualization tools to share marketing operations KPIs (i.e. promotional materials and fulfillment etc.) Span of focus includes:
Execute development, and validation of business/system processes
Digital marketing support for digital asset management, approved email, and closed loop marketing.
Develops and utilizes clear metrics that define optimal levels of functionality, sustainability and compliance to verify deliverable quality. Identifies root causes of platform success/failure and provides recommendations to improve outcome.
Work closely with manager to develop training and distribution plan for metrics across the organization.

Additional Role Expectations

Serve as an important business partner by establishing and maintaining strategic, collaborative working relationships and understanding across Marketing Operations' team
Proactively recommends improvements to improve current processes and reduce cycle times within platforms.
Collaborate with commercial and brand teams to lead, organize, and facilitate process improvements to manage digital marketing materials and digital excellence at Takeda
Be the main business partner with IT, Commercial Operations by establishing collaborative working relationships with regards to data management best practices


Required

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree
3+ years of experience in operations, IT, or data analytics, preferably in the healthcare industry
Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, PPT


Desired

Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment, manage several projects simultaneously, meet deadlines, and communicate potential conflicts to management
Strong project manager skills: proactive, highly organized, excellent at multi-tasking, comfortable under pressure, and able to work effectively as a team member.
Ability to keep current on new production innovations and vendor capabilities and bring forward new advances and potential methods and approaches to effectively market our products
Knowledge and understanding of Software Development Life Cycle
Results-oriented with focus on creating measurable value for brand teams
Experience with Takeda ecosystem, able to navigate across BUs and departments
Prior experience with dashboard reporting tools such as Qlik or Tableau


What Takeda Can Offer You

((What can the person in this role gain from being in it))
((Include a line about any unique development opportunities within your team or function))
Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, Dental, and Vision
Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan
Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings
Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days
Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions
Family Planning Support
Flexible Work Paths
Tuition reimbursement


More About Us

At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.

Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.

Absent an approved religious or medical reason, all US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, as a condition of employment.

EEO Statement

Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.

Locations

Lexington, MA

Worker Type

Employee

Worker Sub-Type

Regular

Time Type

Full time

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Our client is a well known multi asset fund in downtown Boston that offers a range of investment solutions across global equity, emerging markets, and fixed income asset classes. The firm is now on the search for a Senior to Lead level Data Engineer for one of their highest growing business groups.




Background

4+ Years in a Data Engineer/Software Engineer role
Ability to design, develop, and maintain ETL Pipelines in a Python and AWS environment
Familiarity with data platforms such as Spark, MongoDB, Parquet, PostgreSQL, DynamoDB and Redis.
4+ years in a public cloud environment (Ideally AWS)




Day to Day

Be a senior asset in a major AWS cloud migration
Design, develop, and deploy ETL Pipelines
Participate in the design review of advancements in the investment decision systems

Title: Data Analyst/Integration Spec
Description:
When you join the growing BILH team, you're not just taking a job, you’re making a difference in people’s lives.




Job Type:




Regular




Scheduled Hours:




40




Work Shift:




Day (United States of America)




Data Analyst/Integration Spec




Job Description:




Job Summary: The Data Analyst and Integration Specialist is the primary liaison for all data feeds related to research data sharing (NIH Data Sharing, Research Data Shares, etc.). This role helps to understand and initiate data integration, normalizes data into the central share tracking database via data loads, troubleshoots interruptions in data feeds, suggests and/or creates reporting around research shared data, and proposes creative solutions when establishing new data feeds or identifying new data inputs. Under the direction of the Director, the individual helps to support key technology initiatives that strengthen and promote the goals of the research data sharing at BIDMC and Beth Israel Lahey Health System.




Essential Responsibilities:




Liaise with BILH IS resources to set up secure, system-consistent, and reliable data transfer protocols with all resources involved in research data sharing.
Work with the Research Data Share team to translate business needs into data specifications.
Independently identify data needs and ensure data integrity. Synthesize data from multiple sources. Create data tracking models to evaluate the potential impact of proposed initiatives and make recommendations based on data findings.
Support reporting efforts related to the state's regulatory bodies, including but not limited to the NIH/DHHS.
Present the data sharing program in written, visual, and oral presentations to various audiences throughout the system.
Effectively prioritize projects to complete work within established guidelines and timeframe.
Build and maintain strong working relationships with Information Systems, Research Operations, Research Faculty, and other key partners.
Familiar with importing/exporting large volumes of data and can create and execute imports using tools such as Microsoft SSIS and DTS.
Create simple web forms to capture Data Sharing requests, updates, and help tickets.
Design, develop, optimize enterprise-level reporting, and use data analytic tools.




Required Qualifications:




Bachelor's Degree Required. Master's Degree Preferred.




5-8 years related work experience required.




Advanced skills with Microsoft applications which may include Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint or Access and other web-based applications. May produce complex documents, perform analysis and maintain databases.




Competencies:




Decision Making: Ability to make decisions that are guided by general instructions and practices requiring some interpretation. May make recommendations for solving problems of moderate complexity and importance.




Problem Solving: Ability to address problems that are varied, requiring analysis or interpretation of the situation using direct observation, knowledge and skills based on general precedents.




Independence of Action: Ability to set goals and determines how to accomplish defined results with some guidelines. Manager/Director provides broad guidance and overall direction.




Written Communications: Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in written English with internal and external customers.




Oral Communications: Ability to comprehend and converse in English to communicate effectively with medical center staff, patients, families and external customers.




Knowledge: Ability to demonstrate full working knowledge of standard concepts, practices, procedures and policies with the ability to use them in varied situations.




Team Work: Ability to work collaboratively in small teams to improve the operations of immediate work group by offering ideas, identifying issues, and respecting team members.




Customer Service: Ability to provide a high level of customer service to patients, visitors, staff and external customers in a professional, service-oriented, respectful manner using skills in active listening and problem solving. Ability to remain calm in stressful situations.




Physical Nature of the Job:




Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally in carrying, lifting, pushing, pulling objects. Sitting most of the time, with walking and standing required only occasionally




FLSA Status:




Non-Exempt




As a health care organization, we have a responsibility to do everything in our power to care for and protect our patients, our colleagues and our communities. Beth Israel Lahey Health requires that all staff be vaccinated against influenza (flu) and COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Learn more about this requirement.




More than 35,000 people working together. Nurses, doctors, technicians, therapists, researchers, teachers and more, making a difference in patients' lives. Your skill and compassion can make us even stronger.




Equal Opportunity Employer: VETRANS/DISABILITY/GENDER IDENTITY/SEXUAL ORIENTATION.
