Title: Cloud Support Engineer
Description:
The database market is massive (IDC estimates it to be $121B+ by 2025!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. At MongoDB, we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.

Building on the rapid success and adoption of MongoDB, we are delivering applications and services that make it much easier to manage and scale database deployments. These next-generation systems are a growing list and currently include products such as Atlas, Cloud Manager and Compass to name a few.

Cloud Support Engineers are a key part of our elite Technical Services organization that supports MongoDB customers worldwide, with teams in locations including New York, Austin, Palo Alto, Sydney, Delhi, Dublin and Tel Aviv.

Our engineers can tell you how MongoDB’s Technical Services Team is Solving Complex Technical Challenges or what life in Cloud Support is like. If you’re passionate about the opportunity to get comfortable working with the cloud every single day and be part of a team that works at the frontier of SaaS services and distributed database systems, this is the role for you.

Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career

Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, focused on innovation and speed
Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused
Work with talented people around the globe
Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community


This role can be based out of Vancouver or Toronto.

Job Description

As a Cloud Support Engineer, you’ll be advising customers on strategies and documented practices for making best use of our cloud products. This will require you to translate technical concepts and patterns into generalist’s terms for our customers, helping them understand, install, and use those applications effectively. You’ll also troubleshoot application problems and be an advocate for our users’ needs, collaborating with the MongoDB product management and development teams on their behalf.

You will utilize your exceptional analytical skills and customer service to ensure that MongoDB users are successful with our suite of MongoDB application-layer products. We’re looking for individuals who want to dig into the details of how “big data” and “web-scale” systems are successfully assembled and operated every day by organizations of every size and flavor.

Responsibilities

As a Cloud Support Engineer, you will:
Support our strategic customers, focus on day-to-day resolution and proactively drive progress.
Work closely with your team and our customers to identify, characterize, solve & recover from problems raised to the Technical Support team.
Resolve technical issues through diligent research, reproduction, and troubleshooting, log and server analysis using industry standard as well as bespoke in house developed tools
Build standard methodologies for technical troubleshooting across different technologies, and craft Knowledge Articles that contribute to our self-serve support portal
Review and test new features before they are publicly available.
Proactively identify improvement to business processes and policies to solve problems and get things done.
Be an advocate for customers’ needs.
Gather feedback from customers and redirect it to engineering, product, sales and marketing teams to improve our products.
Act as focal point and technical subject-matter-expert for assigned customers and their application deployments in Atlas.

What are we looking for

We consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self taught, curious, and multi-faceted. Our ideal associate candidate should also have:

Prior working experience in one of the three Cloud Providers (AWS, GCP or Azure)
Advanced experience with Operating System and Networking Core concepts
Solid fundamentals in Linux, Networking, and Diagnostics
Familiarity with the Linux command line and monitoring tools
Fundamental understanding one or more of the following database: MongoDB, ElasticSearch, MySQL, Postgres, DynamoDB, MS SQL Server
Working knowledge in a few of the following topics: IAM, Federated Authentication, SSO, SAML, Encryption, Security, APIs, Disaster Recovery and Backup.
Experience with basic platforms/softwares such as JIRA, Confluence and Github
A B.Tech / B.S. or equivalent work experience; if you don’t have a Computer Science degree, but think you can do the job, apply anyway!
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Patience, empathy and a genuine desire to help people
Ability to think on your feet, remain calm under pressure, and solve problems in real-time


Good to have

Certifications - RHCE, Cloud Provider Certifications
Previous Support Experience


To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.

MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and makes all hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: MDM Developer - Oracle EDQ
Description:
Description

Principal Solution Engineer I - Oracle EDQ

Syneos Health is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization purpose-built to accelerate customer success. We lead with a product development mindset, seamlessly connecting our capabilities to add high-value insights to speed therapies to patients and provide practical value to help our customers achieve their objectives.

Every day we perform better because of how we work together, as one team, each the best at what we do. We bring many talented experts together across a wide range of business-critical services that support our business. Every role within Corporate is vital to furthering our vision of Shortening the Distance from Lab to Life®.

Discover what our 30,000 employees, across 110 countries already know:

WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE

Why Syneos Health

#SyneosHealthLife means we’re committed to our Total Self-culture – where everyone can authentically be themselves. Our Total Self-culture is what unites us globally, and we know every person’s unique contributions make a difference.
We believe our success is a direct result of the people who are driving it – you! We value your dedication to caring for our customers and patients, so we want to focus on taking care of you. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits program encompassing your total health - physical, mental, and financial.
We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong.

Job Summary

Interacts with the management team in coordination and collaboration with the enterprise data management office. These activities include the development of processes and operations within the enterprise data management office.

Job Responsibilities

Participates in business and technology planning activities.
Actively participates in ongoing development and evolution of MDM
Partners with business, application, data, and technology clients to integrate information and applications to leverage Master Data Management services solutions’
Create data mappings and integrations between source systems and master data solutions
Create necessary documentation including system specification, test plans, architecture diagrams and other documentation needed for GXP validation.

Qualifications

BS/BA degree in computer science or related field
Minimum of 3 years of experience with Reltio Master Data Management or other MDM technologies
Experience in Data Quality and data profiling solutions with Oracle EDQ or similar data quality products.
Experience with Finance and ERP solutions preferably Oracle Cloud ERP/HCM)
Comprehensive experience in this data engineering with strong analytical skills and the ability to combine data from different sources.
Extensive experience in SQL working in multiple DBMS systems or Big Data Platforms with large volumes of data.
Knowledge of cloud hosted applications and technologies a plus.
The ability to handle multiple tasks to meet deadlines in a high stress environment.
Outstanding organizational, communication, presentation, documentation, analytical, Project Management and interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to lead offshore development resources.
Experience in a Contract Research Organization or Pharmaceutical/Biotechnology company is a plus
Proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio.

Get to know Syneos Health

Over the past 5 years, we have worked with 94% of all Novel FDA Approved Drugs, 95% of EMA Authorized Products and over 200 Studies across 73,000 Sites and 675,000+ Trial patients.

No matter what your role is, you’ll take the initiative and challenge the status quo with us in a highly competitive and ever-changing environment. Learn more about Syneos Health.

Additional Information

Tasks, duties, and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally, required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates, including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive, in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, including the provision of reasonable accommodations, when appropriate, to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.

Title: Solution Engineer
Description:
About GAINS:



GAINS is a leading provider of cloud Supply Chain solutions based in the Chicago neighborhood of Wicker Park. As part of the Francisco Partners portfolio of specialized companies, we are rapidly growing and expanding our global teams to drive innovation, deliver customer value, and accelerate market leadership.



Supply chain volatility has made it difficult for businesses to plan and keep their customer promises. GAINS helps companies address these challenges with innovative solutions leveraging proven AI and ML techniques. Our team of industry and technology experts rapidly delivers transformational value resulting in sustainable and measurable ROI-based impact for our global customers. If you are a technology enthusiast who wants to make an impact, then GAINS is for you.



Solution Engineer



GAINS is looking for a highly skilled Solution Engineer (SE) with the ambition to achieve quality results. SEs work closely with the sales teams to design creative solutions and deliver high-impact workshops and demos to various audiences. The ideal candidate will be comfortable withtailoring the GAINS solution and delivering high-impact demos in a fast-paced working environment.



The SE is expected to understand and synthesize GAINS’ platform capabilities from technical, functional, and business perspectives. SEs gather business requirements, assist in developing winning sales strategies and deliver compelling workshops and demos designed to communicate how GAINS will address customer pain points and opportunities using our platform and technology.







Responsibilities:



Partner with Sales to drive revenue growth by serving as the key GAINS domain expert to decision-makers and key influencers.
Understand the customer’s business objectives, and match GAINS’ solutions to achieve those objectives and technical requirements.
Build and develop client relationships by participating in customer sales callsand working on customer challenges.
Answer business and technical questions; deliver custom demonstrations, and articulate value propositions.
Be a GAINS application thought leader.
Provide customer feedback to internal stakeholders.
Approach all deals with a customer-first mentality.
Partner with Account Executives to complete RFPs.
Work cross-functionally with different organizations such as Sales, Product, Marketing, Professional Services and Legal.
Be the “Voice of the Prospect” by collecting feedback from potential customers and delivering to the Product team.
Keep up to date on competitive solutions, products, and services

Requirements:



Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Industrial Engineering, or Supply Chain Management.
5-8 years of experience in a pre-sales position or equivalent within the supply chain management software industry.
Relevant experience and domain expertise in one of more of the 4 key industries served (Distribution, Manufacturing, Retail & MRO).
Adaptability and strong initiative are required for success in this role.
Experience delivering product demonstrations to C-level Executives.
Ability to uncover business challenges and objectives and develop a documented, tailored solution to tackle any challenge.

At GAINS, we recognize that diversity and inclusion make our teams stronger.We are committed to equal employment opportunity and welcome everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, domestic partner status, veteran status or medical condition.We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: ROR (Ruby on Rails) Engineer
Description:
InVita Healthcare Technologies is looking for a skilled Ruby on Rails engineer to join our team. This person will be responsible for developing and maintaining web applications using Ruby on Rails. He/she/they will be able to drive the programming of well-constructed, testable code, while work closely with our team of engineers, designers, and project managers to deliver high-quality software solutions.




Responsibilities:




Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code.
Integrate data storage solutions and third-party APIs.
Identify and fix bottlenecks and bugs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
Participate in code reviews and maintain code quality standards.
Continuously improve the development process and contribute to the team's knowledge base.




Requirements:




Strong proficiency in Ruby on Rails, with at least 4 years of professional experience.
Proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and SQL.
Experience with software development best practices, such as Agile, TDD, and continuous integration.
Familiarity with front-end frameworks such as React or AngularJS is a plus.
Understanding of server-side rendering and front-end performance optimization
Knowledge of version control systems such as Git.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Proven track record of delivering quality work on time.
Solid communication and collaboration skills to work with a range of colleagues from product specialists and end-users to UX designers and other engineers.
Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field is preferred.




About [InVita Healthcare Technologies]:




[InVita] is a [SaaS] organization dedicated to [saving, protecting and improving lives].




[InVita] benefits include [ health care, paid time off, 401K matching and professional development].

Title: Devops Engineer
Description:
Omitron Inc. is searching for a DevOps Engineer with practical DevOps experience and scripting expertise to support software development programs. The DevOps Engineer will design, implement, test, deploy, support and improve upon continuous integration pipelines and internal tools, and champion new technologies and industry standard toolsets in a fast-paced agile environment. A successful candidate for this position will be working as a member of evolving teams and must be familiar with shared ownership and flexible dynamic teams. DevOps Engineer will work closely with technical leadership, users, and other aerospace personnel to support growth in DevOps Engineering expertise, as well as championing DevOps practices.



Essential Functions:
The DevOps Engineer participates in an agile process team with multiple smaller flexible development teams that combine mature software practices and technology-supported development infrastructure. The DevOps Engineer will execute a full lifecycle agile workflow including daily SCRUMs, story grooming and bidding, and sprint execution. The DevOps Engineer will work with teams to implement new capabilities and mature existing capabilities using key enabling technologies and frameworks. DevOps Engineer will provide technical and methodological guidance in DevOps practices to the multiple independent teams, encouraging user engagement, shared ownership, and cross-cutting development across multiple smaller teams.



Experience Needed: 3-7 years working in a cloud infrastructure environment as a Cloud Engineer, DevSecOps, or Software Engineer



(Preferred) Qualifications:



Experience writing infrastructure as code with Terraform or CloudFormation scripts
Experience with using Ansible to configure, provision and deploy virtual machines
Experience with application, security, and infrastructure monitoring using tools like Prometheus, Loki, and Grafana
Experience with creating service, system, and infrastructure health checks
Familiar with Software development and coding skills in one or more of the following: C#, Python, Javascript, and MatLab
Familiar with networking principles and operation, network and cloud security
Familiar with Databases, storage, and data scaling paradigms

(Required) Qualifications



Strong experience with architecting and designing cloud platform solutions
Strong experience with designing, planning, and leading new projects to completion
Strong communication skills with an emphasis on coordinating plans and schedules with a team of engineers
Strong skills in cloud computing, preferably AWS, but GCP and Azure are also welcome
Strong Linux(Ubuntu)systems skills, good knowledge of Linux command line tools and scripting
Strong skills in documenting complex system design diagrams
Experience and familiarity with REST API's, containerization, and microservices architecture
Experience debugging production problems and working with developers to navigate complex technology stacks
Experience working with version control systems, CI/CD pipelines, and code scanning tools
Experience with Agile and Scrum paradigms for development and iteration









Show more Show less
HTML:
Omitron Inc. is searching for a DevOps Engineer with practical DevOps experience and scripting expertise to support software development programs. The DevOps Engineer will design, implement, test, deploy, support and improve upon continuous integration pipelines and internal tools, and champion new technologies and industry standard toolsets in a fast-paced agile environment. A successful candidate for this position will be working as a member of evolving teams and must be familiar with shared ownership and flexible dynamic teams. DevOps Engineer will work closely with technical leadership, users, and other aerospace personnel to support growth in DevOps Engineering expertise, as well as championing DevOps practices.

Essential Functions:
The DevOps Engineer participates in an agile process team with multiple smaller flexible development teams that combine mature software practices and technology-supported development infrastructure. The DevOps Engineer will execute a full lifecycle agile workflow including daily SCRUMs, story grooming and bidding, and sprint execution. The DevOps Engineer will work with teams to implement new capabilities and mature existing capabilities using key enabling technologies and frameworks. DevOps Engineer will provide technical and methodological guidance in DevOps practices to the multiple independent teams, encouraging user engagement, shared ownership, and cross-cutting development across multiple smaller teams.

Experience Needed: 3-7 years working in a cloud infrastructure environment as a Cloud Engineer, DevSecOps, or Software Engineer

(Preferred) Qualifications:

  • Experience writing infrastructure as code with Terraform or CloudFormation scripts
  • Experience with using Ansible to configure, provision and deploy virtual machines
  • Experience with application, security, and infrastructure monitoring using tools like Prometheus, Loki, and Grafana
  • Experience with creating service, system, and infrastructure health checks
  • Familiar with Software development and coding skills in one or more of the following: C#, Python, Javascript, and MatLab
  • Familiar with networking principles and operation, network and cloud security
  • Familiar with Databases, storage, and data scaling paradigms

(Required) Qualifications

  • Strong experience with architecting and designing cloud platform solutions
  • Strong experience with designing, planning, and leading new projects to completion
  • Strong communication skills with an emphasis on coordinating plans and schedules with a team of engineers
  • Strong skills in cloud computing, preferably AWS, but GCP and Azure are also welcome
  • Strong Linux(Ubuntu)systems skills, good knowledge of Linux command line tools and scripting
  • Strong skills in documenting complex system design diagrams
  • Experience and familiarity with REST API's, containerization, and microservices architecture
  • Experience debugging production problems and working with developers to navigate complex technology stacks
  • Experience working with version control systems, CI/CD pipelines, and code scanning tools
  • Experience with Agile and Scrum paradigms for development and iteration

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description:
Summary:




Full lifecycle development experience, an expert developer with knowledge of systems engineering standards and processes, and demonstrated industry experience. Assigned tasks are technically challenging, achievable, time-boxed and under the direction of technical leadership. Duties include analyzing, developing, debugging, testing, configuring, and deploying software solutions in an agile, cloud based, and continuous development environment. Effective interpersonal and communication skills are required to perform well as a member of a rapid paced, cross-functional team environment.




Responsibilities and Requirements:




Proficiency in JavaScript and Typescript in both the frontend and backend
Strong background in PHP
Strong experience with NodeJS and Angular
Experience with both NoSQL and SQL databases (Mongo, PostgreSQL)
Development life cycle knowledge with version control and pull requests (Git)
Ability to take a lead role in architecting and designing systems
Experience working closely with Product Managers and Stakeholders
Strong process management skills, managing and tracking issues
Excellent communication skills across a range of technical knowledge levels
B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
6+ Years Internet development industry experience
Communicate effectively with all internal departments including, DPMs, BAs, QA testers, and clients. This includes both verbal and written communication
Serve as a mentor to Jr. and Mid level developers
Special projects as needed
Provide technical support for software applications as needed
Proactively research and continuously seek to learn new technologies
Debug code for existing programs based on immediate need and trouble shoot system bugs and issues

Title: Senior Software Developer - Remote
Description:
The best CMMS for healthcare maintenance professionals.




Senior Software Developer




At FSI, you’ll join a team of passionate professionals dedicated to empowering efficient and safe hospital operations. FSI supports over 400 million ft 2 of hospital space every year to run transformative, intelligent hospital maintenance operations. FSI is the most comprehensive computerized maintenance management software (CMMS) provider for healthcare, and we’re proud to serve over 800 hospitals with some of the largest networks in the country -- including the Yale New Haven, SSM Health UNC Health, and beyond. We work directly with our customers to build customized modern technology that fit their complex needs.




In 2020, FSI received significant investments to grow and expand on the foundation established since the company began in 2002. We believe our most exciting chapter is just beginning, and we’re looking for talent that wants to make an impact. If you’re looking for a fast-paced, innovative community with a team focused on collaboration and empowerment through technology, we encourage you to get in touch.




For more information about us go to




FSI is looking for an experienced full-stack .NET/Angular software developer. We are interested in smart, motivated individuals who range in experience from 5 to 7+ years.




Duties:




Provide technical leadership to product development teams.
Develop, document, and test software components for new SaaS products and product enhancements
Participate in a collaborative environment to review application requirements and create designs for new components and features
Troubleshoot and fix bugs




Experience And Skills Required




Extensive knowledge and experience in full-stack .NET application development
Proficient in current web application development tools, patterns, frameworks, and techniques
Extensive knowledge and experience with web applications frameworks such as Angular, React, Redux, or similar
Experience developing JavaScript, CSS, HTML web applications/SPA (Single Page Applications)
Angular experience a big plus
Extensive knowledge and experience with C# development
Comfortable with .NET Core and ASP.NET Web API
Experience with Entity Framework and SQL
Proficient in RESTful API development (Swagger and Open API docs knowledge is a plus)
Experience with concurrent development source control (Git) and continuous integration (Azure DevOps)
Experience with design and architectural patterns including DDD, CQRS, and event-driven architecture.
Experience with utilizing Azure services including App Services, Azure SQL, Service Bus, Azure Storage.




General Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree (B.S.) in Computer Science or related field
Experience interfacing with RDBMS' including the ability to create basic objects such as tables, views, and stored procedures as well as a good basic grasp of SQL
Experience developing Software as a Service (SaaS) applications with a good understanding of cloud application architecture and distributed systems (Cloud Native knowledge is a plus)
Demonstrated experience with best SDLC best practices: coding standards, reviews, code management, build processes, and testing
Great team player who collaborates with multiple teams to develop complex software applications
Experience following an Agile methodology
Comfortable working in a distributed work environment (work remotely from home)




We are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive environment and to encourage these values in everyone on our team. We provide an environment of mutual respect where opportunities are available without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We believe that diversity and inclusion for people from all walks of life is key to our success as a company.

Title: Engineer, Fullstack (Developer Experience AMERS)
Description:
Hi there!




We're looking for a Developer Experience Engineer (DXE) to join the team at Zapier. We’re on a mission to make everyone more productive at work. Zapier has helped millions of people build businesses through the power of automation.




As a Developer Experience Engineer, you will work to make it fast and easy for Zapier teams to deliver customer value, improve the lives of our engineers, and have more joy in their day-to-day work.




The Developer Experience (DX) team is new to Zapier - you have the opportunity to join on the ground floor, shape the team charter and have direct input into the roadmap.




If you’re interested in advancing your career at a fast-growing, profitable, impact-driven company, then read on…




Our Commitment to Applicants




Culture and Values at Zapier




Zapier Guide to Remote Work




Zapier Code of Conduct




Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier




Zapier is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.




Even though our job description may seem like we're looking for a specific candidate, the role inevitably ends up tailored to the person who applies and joins. Regardless of how well you feel you fit our description, we encourage you to apply if you meet the criteria below.




About You




You can build scalable web software. You’ve worked across the stack, and although you may know more about front-end development, backend web services, or cloud infrastructure, you can dive into any part of the stack and make an impact. Zapier is built on Python, Django, NextJS, Node.js, and AWS.




You are an optimizer, always seeking ways to eliminate waste and toil. You use metrics to understand where there are inefficiencies and take action to improve them. You seek out manual and repetitive processes and automate them.




You care about the developer experience. You care just as much about how we design, build and release software as you do about what customer experiences we deliver. You have previously set up and managed your team's local development environment and CI/CD pipeline.




You are an expert at knowledge sharing. You quickly share knowledge with your team when you learn something new. You write accessible technical documentation and create video content to help level up your peers. You have a track record of teaching and mentoring others.




You prefer to find (open source) or buy solutions vs. building. You know that many problems have been tackled before and seek to learn, leverage and licence from others.




You value software quality. You understand that being functionally complete is just part of delivering high-quality software — addressing maintainability, security, reliability, efficiency, and scalability are at the forefront of how you build software. You lean on automation whenever possible.




You have a systems-oriented mindset. You're inquisitive. You build a deep understanding of problems and are good at spotting patterns. You understand how to design and implement end-to-end systems.




You value our values. At Zapier, our values are at the heart of how we work together and how we think about our customers. As a remote-first company, our values help develop trust and ensure we collaborate effectively to democratize automation. You recognize how our values can empower meaningful work, you thrive in a collaborative setting, you are eager to continue growing, and you’re excited to be part of the team.




Things You Might Do




That Said, Here Are Some Things You'll Probably Do




Zapier is a fast-growing, remote-first company. You'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization.




Engage with engineers directly and use metrics to understand pain points in the developer journey and implement various solutions including patterns, tooling and guidance to help address these.
Teach and share knowledge by creating how-to guides, articles, videos and technical documentation.
Improve GitLab CI/CD pipelines to reduce lead time for changes and increase reliability.
Evolve our internal developer platform (IDP) capabilities, such as how we use feature toggles for experimentation and feature rollout
Drive improvements to engineering onboarding, helping new folks get up and running faster and easier.
You actively contribute to the team roadmap — you help write, refine and prioritize a backlog of actionable deliverables.
As a part of Zapier's all-hands philosophy , help customers via support to ensure they have the best experience possible.
Zapier Compensation Guiding Principles




Here’s How We Define Our Compensation Principles




We believe all Zapiens should be rewarded competitively and equitably, using practices that are simple and transparent. This philosophy ensures we’re able to find, grow, and retain exceptional people from a broad range of backgrounds.




Competitive: Zapier pays well among the technology sector.
Equitable: Consistent pay practices; competency-based pay.
Simple: Pay is well understood, and pay practices are built for scale.
Transparent: Zapiens know how pay works, including how their pay is determined.




The Pay Ranges For This Role Are




United States: 114,400-150,100 USD




Canada: 114,400-150,100 CAD




A Candidate's compensation package is finalized once the interview process is concluded and accounts for experience, competencies (job knowledge, skills and abilities) and internal equity.




For more information on Zapier’s Total Rewards please click here .




How to Apply




At Zapier, we believe that diverse perspectives and experiences make us better, which is why we have a non-standard application process designed to promote inclusion and equity. We are looking for the best fit for each of our roles, regardless of the type of education or companies in your background, so we encourage you to apply even if your skills and experiences don’t exactly match the job description. All we ask is that you answer a few in-depth questions in our application that would typically be asked at the start of an interview process. This helps speed things up by letting us get to know you and your skillset a bit better right out of the gate. Please be sure to answer each question; the resume and CV fields are optional.




After you apply, you are going to hear back from us—even if we don’t see an immediate fit with our team. In fact, throughout the process, we strive to never go more than seven days without letting you know the status of your application. We know we’ll make mistakes from time to time, so if you ever have questions about where you stand or about the process, just ask your recruiter!




Zapier is an equal opportunity employer and we're excited to work with talented and empathetic people of all identities. Zapier does not discriminate based on someone's identity in any aspect of hiring or employment as required by law and in line with our commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity. protected by local law. Our code of conduct provides a beacon for the kind of company we strive to be, and we celebrate our differences because those differences are what allow us to make a product that serves a global user base.




Zapier is committed to inclusion. As part of this commitment, Zapier welcomes applications from individuals with disabilities and will work to provide reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodations are needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact jobs@zapier.com.




Even though we’re an all-remote company, we still need to be thoughtful about where we have Zapiens working. Check out this resource for a list of countries where we currently cannot have Zapiens permanently working.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Data Analyst / Insight Analyst / SQL Data Analyst / Analytics Executive


Widen The Net is a partner recruitment agency to Snapchat and we are hiring for their contract positions. Snapchat, world top 5 social media platform with 7000+ employees globally, 1000+ adverts display per day, 370M daily active users and revenue of $4 billion.


Office based in central London, 4 days on site/1 day working from home. Initially 12 months full time contract and possible to become permanent afterwards, contract is inside IR35.


Snap is looking for a Data Analyst to join their London Ad and business team where you will work closely with sales, account managers and clients to provide in-depth insight analysis and drive advertising performance, business revenue and growth:


-Build dashboards, reports and insight analysis using SQL, Big Query, Tableau, Looker and Google Data Studio to optimize advertiser performance, product development and SME business growth;

-Create data tools for the central Europe region;

-Build and automate processes that can be scaled out for stakeholders and cross functional teams;

-Work with Account Managers to provide real time analysis for campaigns and impact client and business success by providing analysis and recommendations;

-Carry out quantitative data research


Requirements:

-Must have strong SQL experience;

-Experience in creating data tool and automation that can be scaled out;

-Experience in R or Python is a big plus;

-Any working knowledge in advertising or performance or media or sales analysis is a big plus

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Wise is a company that specializes in solving airport business problems and delivering projects from solution design to end user training. We have seen rapid growth in the last four years due to our team's energy, agility, and commitment to doing the right thing.

Our Analytics team helps clients make decisions from their data and our goal is to become experts in the business questions that we help to answer. Instead of relying on endless reporting, we work closely with customers to advise and educate them on targeted data solutions. We work with a variety of tooling and invest time in learning whatever technology is needed.

We are thrilled to be expanding our team and are on the lookout for a talented junior data analyst to join us! As a junior data analyst, you'll have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects and make a real difference. You'll be responsible for analysing data, uncovering insights, and helping drive business decisions.

Responsibilities

Wrangling data from various sources into usable and accessible formats.
Analysing and understanding processes using the data they generate
Reporting on findings in an engaging and understandable way.
Collaborating with the team to prototype tools for analysis of airport processes.


Requirements

Familiarity with SQL and experience querying databases.
Experience in visualising data.
Strong analytical skills and ability to gain insight from complex datasets.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Familiarity with at least one analytical programming language (R, Python, MATLAB etc.)
An interest in logistics and systems for physically moving people or things.
Bonus: experience with unstructured data storage, airport or material handling environment, or a degree in a numerical subject.


Benefits

Access to company pension scheme
Long term sick salary insurance
Free car parking
Laptop
Mobile phone allowance
Christmas Bonus
Access to our on-site spinning and fitness studio

  • Mobile phone allowance
  • Christmas Bonus
  • Access to our on-site spinning and fitness studio

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

Medialab’s proprietary marketing intelligence proposition, Apollo, enables data-driven success through the centralised collection of data, the formation of information as our single source of truth and the exposing of insights for decision making. This is made possible through the capabilities provided by our foundation, Apollo Platform. A dedicated project team is responsible for the population of our platform which entails the strategic designing of data feeds, onboarding of data for our clients and delivery of business intelligence use cases.




We are at an exciting stage in our journey and are looking for a proactive self-starter who is passionate about data, detail-oriented and a clear communicator, to join the team and play a significant role in the delivery of our next chapter.




Responsibilities

The responsibilities of the role are as follows:

Analysing business requirements through building relationships with stakeholders and communicating effectively and analysing existing systems
Analysing existing and new data sources to understand their purpose, features and limitations
Become an expert in Apollo Platform’s domain model and design high quality data feeds
Onboard data feeds and monitor their success before handing over to our support function
Translate business requirements to technical data transformation requirements for our engineering team - technical contributions welcome
Deliver dashboards on top of our output data model that are fit for purpose
Perform data QA checks and comparisons to ensure data integrity
Communicate with stakeholders to ensure they are aware of progress and have their expectations managed
Ensure that all your work is carried out to a high standard and that your colleagues are aware of the status of tasks




Skills & Experience

You will need the following must-have skills:

Data literacy - apt at manipulating data for quick answers. Spreadsheet software (excel/google sheets) is second nature for you
Ability to deliver data visualisations on top of a data model based on a business requirement (e.g. experience with Tableau, PowerBI, Looker or similar)
Ability to extract requirements from stakeholders / analysing existing systems, effectively
Ability to conduct data QA and perform comparisons to ensure data integrity
Ability to pick up new technologies fast
Ability to work at pace in a dynamic environment and manage your time effectively
Ability to work autonomously and be accountable for your commitments
Ability to collaborate effectively with a team




The following experience will help you stand out:

Experience with interrogating data via SQL
Experience with the marketing/advertising domain
Experience within a media planning/activation environment
Experience within an agile environment




Behaviours

The below behaviours will be important in enabling you to thrive in the role:

Curious - you constantly seek how to do things better - you receive feedback well and look to apply it to your daily work.
Passionate - you care about your craft, you are hungry to learn more and you enjoy a challenge.
Ownership - you take your responsibilities seriously and you make it your mission to deliver - blockers are to be overcome.
Diligence - you know that technology and data are complex and a thorough approach is needed to ensure quality and integrity.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies. Kantar’s 25,000 people based in more than 100 countries help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow. Nobody knows people better than Kantar. We provide insight and inspiration to help our clients, our people and society to create and flourish in an extraordinary world.




Our media colleagues are expert in understanding the changing media landscape. This includes audience measurement, consumer targeting and in-depth intelligence into paid, owned and earned media. Their global coverage and local expertise enable clients to better understand media audiences and their relationships with brands to optimise investment.




Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: London, Westgate

Salary: Competitive

Full time/Permanent




Role Description

Kantar is the leader in providing digital TV audience and advertising measurement tools and intelligence. With a proven track record in audience research services across 50+ countries, Kantar is at the forefront of technological developments in audience measurement in the media industry, working with broadcasters and advertisers, media agencies and industry committees.




The Data Science team provides research and technical expertise, support, oversight, and methodological development to our global operating services.




Within the team the data analyst supports other data scientists and developers with necessary data queries and runs periodic Quality Control analyses on live services. Critical thinking, analytical mind and clear communication are crucial as the data queries and checks should be mostly initiated and designed by the data analyst to facilitate the modelling workflow, and then communicated to the rest of the team.




Job Role Requirements

Strong understanding of numerical and data analytical skills
Data investigation for quality and completeness of model input data
Able to spot anomalies and gain conclusions
Quality control of modelling outcome data – generic models and client specific applications
Support with client’s liaison on technical issues
Represent the business at industry events

Role Requirements

Intermediate level of programming with Python (preferable), or other programming languages (e.g., R, MATLAB)
Strong communication capabilities (peers and, occasionally, clients)
Capability of taking initiative, working independently, driving results
Attention to details and accuracy
Critical thinking

Education and experience

Bachelor’s degree in highly numerate discipline
Excellent understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts




At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.




We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.




We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and wellbeing is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.




At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity; therefore, we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.




Privacy and Legal Statement




PRIVACY DISCLOSURE: Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by The Kantar Group Limited (“Kantar”). Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is necessary for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager(s) and for consideration for potential future opportunities by Kantar and its affiliate Kantar group companies. For full details of our privacy policy please visit www.kantar.com

Title: Data Analyst - Marketing
Description:
We strongly encourage people of colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. Bumble is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone to our team. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.




In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).




Data Analyst / Data Scientist - Marketing (Growth / Product / CRM)




How do we improve our growth marketing or product marketing performance? How do we improve engagement through in-app push notifications, promotions or outbound email? How do we optimise product features?




We’re looking for curious Senior Data Analysts who are buzzing 🐝 to solve impactful questions (such as the ones above) for our product and growth marketing teams.




What’s in it for you?




You’ll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as manipulating complex datasets, optimising the way we allocate multi-million 💰💰💰 marketing budgets across more than 100 markets, helping us create products that solve the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships 💛 and helping keep all members happy 😃 and safe.




You’ll be involved with all of our apps (Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz, BumbleBizz and BumbleBFF), with access to the most diverse, varied, clean and complex data set in the technology world right now (10’s of billions of data points per day!!).




You’ll collaborate closely with several teams including Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers and Scientists, Data Engineers, Product Managers, Analysts, People Recommendations etc and all levels of seniority, so will have exposure to all of the team.




Sounds great, right?? 👏




But, we’d be selling ourselves short if we didn’t mention our amazing benefits package too 😍, which includes:




A totally inclusive, equitable, comfortable and safe space for all employees 🙏
Unlimited Paid Time Off (not including two company-wide week’s off) ⛱
Focus Fridays
26 weeks full paid parental leave 👶
Annual Bonus
Equity Scheme
Private Medical Insurance 🏥
Private Dental Insurance 👄
Subsidised and discounted gym membership 🏋
Learning and development budget 🎒
Free breakfast and lunch (cooked by our superb onsite catering team), First-Friday takeaway vouchers (choice of Deliveroo, Just Eat or Uber Eats) and an amazing selection of snacks and drinks 🥘🍲
Merchandise Allowance 👚
Premium App Access 🐝




What we look for in a Data Analyst / Data Scientist




We want to step away from the multitude of similar, monotonous JD’s 😴… so we’ll say we are looking for experienced Data Analysts and you’ll need all the typical skills you’d expect (SQL, Python, CRM, Growth Marketing, Product Marketing, Email, predictive modelling, answering problems that others struggle with etc) but more interestingly we’d love to hear from anyone that can help us answer the following…




Growth Marketing / Product Marketing




Working as a thought partner to CRM, Growth and Product Marketing teams, understanding how to effectively communicate with users to optimise for desired outcomes
Measuring success of marketing campaigns and set up self serve capabilities
Optimising the way we communicate with our user base (through promo-cards, video chats, push notifications)
Understanding when it’s appropriate to set up experiments (e.g.A/B Testing) and making sure they are set up correctly




Sounds like something of interest?




Great! We’d love to hear from you and can’t wait to chat with you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

The primary objective of this role is to support and expand the newly formed Client Intelligence team with analysis, scripting and reporting on a variety of subjects. This includes client/prospect profiling, sales lifecycle, client journey mapping, market/competitor research. This will assist in developing company strategies around growth, client engagement and the wider market landscape.

The role will offer applicants to learn in a fast paced and dynamic environment and to quickly take on more responsibility to further develop skills. The successful applicant will learn the needs of client intelligence team and the wider growth department as well as the procedures, KPIs and models used. With this knowledge and fresh perspective you will be expected to provide insights and process improvements to deliver on the team’s objectives.. Therefore, proactive and ambitious candidates are required.

Successful candidates will have access to a wealth of knowledge from more senior team members and from key stakeholders on other teams in the company. This will include learning about financial markets, modelling techniques, sales/marketing strategies and interaction with senior stakeholders including C-suite and board level.

Responsibilities:

Provide insights and intelligence for use across the company to inform direction on business decisions
Create strategies and proposals from the insights generated through data analysis
Ensure accuracy and optimisation of our internal tooling and client intelligence software (including Hubspot and internal databases), particularly with regards to the accuracy of the sales pipeline and customer/prospect information.
Collate, clean and visualise data from several internal tools, and external sources, to produce/present reports for key stakeholders (internal and external)
Build, manage and update new workflows and dashboards to provide insights on clients, prospects, and wider market data
Build statistical tools that analyse TH client/prospect behaviour, trends and requirements
Perform market research on prospective client, competitor and regulatory data to inform new strategies across company


Requirements

Essential Skills/Competencies

1-2 years’ experience in similar role
Proficient in either Python, Excel/VBA, SQL or any object-oriented language
Fast learner and keen for grow opportunities
Outstanding presentation, communication and interpersonal skills
Proactive, resilient and keen to voice suggestions for team/company strategies
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to work under pressure and exercise clear judgement
BSc degree in STEMor another related field (data science would be preferential)
Knowledge of financial markets would be beneficial


Benefits

Why should you apply?

Ambition: Extremely fast-growing company with an uncapped potential, offering every colleague a broad range of experience and plenty of opportunities for internal movement, as well as rapid career progression. Vibrant company culture full of uniquely talented and friendly colleagues with regular social perks to build camaraderie.

Flexibility: 25 days holiday + bank holidays, informal dress code, generous maternity/parental leave policies. We also offer a flexible working policy (up to 2 days a week remote).

Reward: Highly competitive compensation plus annual discretionary bonus and discretionary EMI scheme (company share option scheme).

Support: Annual personal training budget, private healthcare, company pension plan, death in service coverage, cycle to work scheme & tech scheme.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Overview







Handelsbanken plc (the Bank) is an important and continuously expanding part of Handelsbanken with over 165 branches countrywide, an established Head Office functional structure and Handelsbanken Wealth and Asset Management.

UKR is the independent risk control function within the Bank and acts as the second line of defence (2LOD) and provide independent oversight and control across the Bank’s principle risks i.e. credit, financial and operational risk.




The prudential risk and quantitative risk analysis team (UKRQ) is responsible for the prudential regulation, the coordination of the yearly ICAAP, stress test framework and stress test modelling execution across ICAAP, ILAAP and RRP, IRB implementation project, model support and quantitative risk analytics across all risk classes. The breadth of the deliverables and the fact that processes, modelling- and analytical capabilities are continuously being developed and improved demands a flexible and collaborative approach from team members to ensure solid team performance in cooperation with the business.

The Risk models and data team within UKRQ is responsible for data analysis and development and maintenance of stress testing and Pillar 2A models.




The successful applicant will be part of a rapidly developing team and will support the build out of data analysis capabilities and be actively involved in supporting and improving regular management information reporting.

For the right candidate there is big potential for growth both within the data analysis area as well as getting involed in model development.






















Key Responsibilities







Responsibilities include, but are not limited to;

Run regular production of MI and ad-hoc requests for data analysis;
Support the development of robust data analysis for both ad-hoc and regular management reporting;
Support the development of efficient management information (MI) production;
Support the execution of prudential and model development activities.
Support the build out of a robust data governance and quality process with the risk function;
Operates in line with the Bank's Risk Management framework (including sub-frameworks) and relevant risk and compliance policies and procedures, ensuring appropriate and timely escalation of any concerns to their line manager.













Role Requirements:







The successful applicant should:

must have a suitable level of relevant experience working with data analysis within financial services;
be degree educated or equivalent, preferably in a STEM subject;
have a basic knowledge of SAS and SQL and be eager to develop further
be able to efficiently plan and communicate their work to all stakeholders
be comfortable working with various MS Excel features such as formulas and pivot tables
have a good understanding of risk/financial terminology and be interested in developing this knowledge further
be proactive and able to act on their own initiative;
deliver high quality outcomes and have excellent attention to detail;
be willing to learn and to work in an organised yet flexible and collaborative manner













Compliance with the 5 Conduct Rules







Act with integrity;
Act with due skill, care and diligence;
Be open and co-operative with the FCA, PRA and other regulators;
Pay due regard to the interests of customers and treat them fairly;
Observe proper standards of market conduct.







Core Values




Is business-oriented and focuses on the customer.
Takes a long-term approach.
Has the courage to make decisions.
Is innovative and proactive.
Takes responsibility for their own development.
Has high ethical and moral standards.
Likes good administrative order.
Collaborates with others to achieve joint goals.
Contributes to the development of operations and colleagues.










Competencies




General Competencies

Actively Builds Relationships
Embraces Change and Technology
Acts According to Handelsbanken's culture
Creates Business Value
Role Specific Regulations
Risk Management, Governance and Controls
Credit**
Business Development**
Show more Show less

  • Act with integrity;
  • Act with due skill, care and diligence;
  • Be open and co-operative with the FCA, PRA and other regulators;
  • Pay due regard to the interests of customers and treat them fairly;
  • Observe proper standards of market conduct.



Core Values


  • Is business-oriented and focuses on the customer.
  • Takes a long-term approach.
  • Has the courage to make decisions.
  • Is innovative and proactive.
  • Takes responsibility for their own development.
  • Has high ethical and moral standards.
  • Likes good administrative order.
  • Collaborates with others to achieve joint goals.
  • Contributes to the development of operations and colleagues.




Competencies


General Competencies

  • Actively Builds Relationships
  • Embraces Change and Technology
  • Acts According to Handelsbanken's culture
  • Creates Business Value
  • Role Specific Regulations
  • Risk Management, Governance and Controls
  • Credit**
  • Business Development**

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Introduction




Are you looking for a new challenge as a Data Analyst? Want to influence what the BBC will look like in the future?




If the answer to those questions is ‘YES’....this might be the perfect role for you.




The BBC offers some of the UKs most popular linear and online services – with more than 30m of the UK population accessing us online each week across BBC iPlayer, BBC Sounds, BBC News & BBC Sport.




We are recruiting for a multi-skilled Data Analyst to join our Central Analytics team. In this varied role, you will work on exciting projects across the whole BBC Online portfolio to provide performance data and uncover customer insights that empower decision-making at the BBC. Working alongside an experienced team of analysts, you’ll play a key part in promoting analytics best practice and creating tools to encourage the use of data among stakeholders. The position sits in the Chief Customer Officer Group with a close relationship to stakeholders in other disciplines including areas like Research, Content and Marketing.




The role is offered as an 12-month contract. Upon completion, we’ll encourage you to apply for permanent positions in our division.




We will hold interviews for shortlisted candidates from w/c 27 th March 2023.




Role Responsibility




Delivering analysis and insights on usage of the BBC services and content to inform decision-making
Working collaboratively in cross-discipline project groups to improve the BBC’s data capabilities and develop new solutions
Creating and maintaining dashboards to empower stakeholders to self-serve with data
Building data automation processes and pipelines that bring 3rd party datasets into our systems
Providing technical expertise and acting as a first point of contact for analytics queries from non-data oriented colleagues
Developing your own analytics skills and keeping up to date with the latest industry developments




Are you the right candidate?




Degree in a STEM subject or equivalent experience
Some previous experience working in the data analytics field (e.g. previous role as a Data Associate)
Ability to use data to generate insights and recommendations
Understanding of and a willingness to learn one or more programming languages such as SQL, R or Python
Good written and verbal communication skills
Pro-active attitude with a problem solving mindset
Team-player able to juggle multiple projects simultaneously




Desirable




Interest in and knowledge of the BBC services
Experience of using digital analytics data e.g. Google Analytics, Piano (AT Internet), Adobe Analytics or similar
Understanding of media analytics, data measurement methodologies and industry standards including online and offline channels




Package Description




Band: C




Contract type:12 Month FTC




Location: London - NBH




We’re happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application . There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.




Excellent career progression – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
Benefits - We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.




About The BBC




We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.




Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.




We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC – whether that’s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.




We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.




To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here




Attached documents




BBC Values
JD

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

As Data Analyst with PowerBi Reporting experience, you’ll deliver data/analytical solutions across the complex Heathrow environment. Building strong relationships with other business areas to understand business needs, you’ll develop and deliver data/analytics projects to improve efficiency, quality, service and value. Working with historical data and future forecasts, you’ll use agile principles to manage tasks, analytical requirements, and the build of reporting tools/models. You’ll combine datasets to provide enriched visualisations and analytical solutions.

Your role will involve:

Delivering analytical solutions and Business Intelligence tools such as reports and dashboards
Designing metrics, simplify data querying and visualise insights, maintain data updates
Timely project delivery from inception to deployment, ensuring effective integration of solutions into the operation
Combining datasets to drive meaningful outputs including ad-hoc deep dive analytics and qualitative & quantitative analysis


These skills are essential:

Experience with PowerBi Reporting/DAX is essential. As is experience in Data Visualisation.
Comfortable and confident with data and highly analytical.
Proven track record of delivery using formal analytics tools and techniques
Critical to this role is the ability to problem solve, motivation to make a big impact on our business through simplicity and an ability to work to tight deadlines.
Experience in programming languages (R or Python) and Excel


Ideally, you'll also have:

Expertise in Data Wrangling, Machine learning and Data Mining.
Performance reporting, KPI definition, and balanced scorecards
Experience in or desire to learn data modelling, DAX, M Language
Understanding of the complex airport operation with an appreciation for its interdependencies
A numerical degree is desirable


About Us

Heathrow brings the world closer together. Our airport facilitates the global travel and trade that keeps the economy moving. It’s a place like no other – a city within a city – where colleagues connect around a common goal, giving our passengers the best airport service in the world.

There is a world of opportunity at Heathrow. You’ll reach your full potential within our inclusive and supportive culture, whilst helping us to deliver our ambitious plans. Not only are we growing to welcome millions more passengers each year, we’re also transforming our industry. Sustainability is at the heart of Heathrow and we’re leading global efforts on decarbonisation, so that aviation continues to be a force for good in our world.

Taking the journey with us means living our values. Doing the right thing. Keeping everyone safe. Working together. Treating everyone with respect. Giving excellent service. Improving every day. Our ever-changing airport runs on teamwork and creativity. A career at Heathrow is welcoming, diverse, challenging, exciting, and rewarding.

Join Heathrow and grow your career in an airport that matters to millions.

Our rewards

We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits, along with performance-based annual bonuses, our longer-term Share in Success Bonus plans, generous annual leave allowances and market-leading pensions. With family friendly policies, access to private health insurance and a wide range of wellbeing tools, we’ll support you to be at your best inside and outside work. And we’ll provide learning and development opportunities to help you reach your full potential.

Working Location

Our agile approach offers the opportunity to combine home working with meetings, events and training at the airport. All roles involve some on-site working each week, so you’ll need to be based in the UK and within a commutable distance to Heathrow.

Sustainable Travel to work

Heathrow’s Sustainable Travel Guide sets out easy and sustainable travel options that everyone can access.

Equal Opportunities As an equal opportunities employer, we encourage applications from all. We believe that diverse talent makes us stronger – not least because we welcome passengers from all corners of the globe, every single day. Heathrow is an accessible place to work. With four diversity networks, we champion inclusivity and celebrate individuality.

Organization

At Heathrow, we’re passionate about making every journey better. That means ensuring we meet the changing needs of the passengers, colleagues and partners who use our airport. Our Solutions team encompasses project management, process improvement, business change, technology, cyber defence and procurement. It brings together the people with the skills to deliver diverse, prestigious and often large-scale projects from start to finish.

You’ll be part of a team that is shaping our airport, and the experience of countless passengers. It’s a collaborative environment, where you can rely on the support of the experts you’ll be working with every day. Whether working on the technology at the bedrock of our organisation, the commercial agreements that our operation relies on, or the infrastructure that we’re transforming every day, you’ll be taking on projects you can take pride in and feel passionate about. It’s an exciting place to be because the scale of what we do is vast. Every day will test your skills and give you the opportunity to make your mark.

Join Solutions and be an incredibly important part of our recovery, as we ramp up and welcome passengers back to the airport.

Join Solutions and be an incredibly important part of our recovery, as we ramp up and welcome passengers back to the airport.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Permanent

Location: Central London

Salary - Up to 50K




The client

A think-tank who are committed to creating poverty indexes to help governments create policies.




Your responsibilities

• Accountable for specific data, including the quality of the raw data underpinning them, and how they contribute to growth

• Draw out key findings from the Indexes and augment with research sourced from policy journals, newspapers, academic papers etc, creating insight that will help drive change.

• Conduct robust analysis using tools such as Python (pandas) to derive new insights into the trends and patterns and drivers of prosperity. (Python experience is advantageous but not necessary).

• In light of findings, assemble conclusions, including via oral presentations and in written format, ensuring that the outputs are effectively communicated to non-




Your experience

Experience of processing large varieties of data in a standard way, ideally from multiple sources, using data tools to support in this work




Experience of using data tools (i.e., Python, SQL, STATA, SPSS) would be an advantage




Competent with manipulating and using data, and comfortable with the application of numerical concepts (e.g., regressions)




A demonstrable interest in data analysis and public policy, social and economic affairs, preferably with some experience in producing and communicating high quality analysis




What’s next?




If you believe you have the desired skills and experience, please follow the link to apply and attach a copy of your latest CV. If successful, a Consultant will be in touch to discuss in more detail.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Permanent

Location: Central London

Salary - Up to 45K




Are you a passionate Data Analyst looking for the next significant step in your career? Do you have experience working with survey/research data?




The client

Working on important and impactful public policy challenges, such as improving girls' access to education to transforming citizen experience of public services.




You







You will work across several different project teams to understand and scope the potential for linking survey data to other data sources.







Your responsibilities







Contributing to the development of statistical analysis, data analytics and data visualisation
Collaborating with the other data teams within to help the development of the data analytics capability
Identifying opportunities to link and utilise other data sources with survey data to add context and depth to analytical findings
Exploring new ways of visualising data and analysis using visualisation tools
Assisting in the end-to-end quality assurance of data outputs when needed
Training, coaching and supervising junior members of the team in data analytics and data visualisation
Ensuring best practice is followed through maintaining comprehensive documentation and being involved in project reviews to identify and embed learning for future projects







Your experience







Strong interest in data analytics and data visualisation
Knowledge and experience of statistical and analytical methods and techniques
Knowledge of current data protection legislation to ensure that all outputs are fully compliant with all GDPR requirements.
Experience using R/Python or SQL and ideally SPSS
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong organisational skills with the ability to work across multiple projects
Be able to work to tight deadlines and work at pace when required







What’s next?




If you believe you have the desired skills and experience, please follow the link to apply and attach a copy of your latest CV. If successful, a Consultant will be in touch to discuss in more detail.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SALARY RANGE

Competitive £40,000 to £50,000 per year + benefits depending on:

Location
Years of experience - 3 years employment minimum
Technical skills match
Additional compensation includes Performance Bonus + Pension Scheme + Private Healthcare




LOCATION

U.K. outside Greater London: Remote + 1 day in the office per month
Portugal: Full remote
London: Hybrid, 2 days in the office
Other country: Unavailable




ABOUT THE ROLE




POSITION SUMMARY

As a Data Analyst at Online Filings, you will provide data driven insights and recommendations to management with the goal of improving our products, driving sales growth, spotting market opportunities and assist in our development strategy.

You will apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, experimentation and data mining to develop scaled insights solutions to drive business performance and accelerate product success.




RESPONSABILITY

Evaluate, define, monitor and advise on Business, Finance, Marketing and Product KPIs and metrics along with different teams
Conduct in-depth investigations leveraging large and complex data sets
Perform data analysis and create insightful dashboards, memos & presentations that summarise the data
Create and maintain data documentation both for an internal, technical audience and for partner user teams
Responsible for managing data requests from business stakeholders
Conduct in-depth investigations/audit as required, leveraging large and complex data sets




MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering, Maths, Statistics, Economics, or other STEM/quantitative field
3+ years experience doing quantitative analysis
3+ years of SQL experience
3+ Experience working with Business Insights and data visualisation tools like Tableau,
Experience with scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R)
Expertise with spreadsheet-based tools like Excel
Strong communicator: experience using data for storytelling and presenting complex research findings to both technical and non-technical audiences




PREFERRED QUALIFICATION

Masters or Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field
Experience using Mongo DB, Robo3T
4+ years of experience in a highly analytical environment (e.g. management consulting, corporate analytics, strategy and operations, or other roles requiring a blend of analytical, strategic, and cross-functional work)
Strong analytical skills and an ability to synthesize information across a broad ecosystem to diagnose problems and devise solutions
Comfortable with ambiguity; able to thrive with minimal oversight and process, while keeping leadership informed on progress against deadlines
Willing to work in a SaaS start up environment




ABOUT ONLINE FILINGS

We are disrupting the way SMEs and entrepreneurs manage their business admin to give them more clarity, more free time, and less hassle. Our innovative software as a service platform (SaaS) was created to help people with no experience venture into the world of entrepreneurship. We build technologies that take care of the boring stuff, so entrepreneurs can focus on building great products and services.

Join us and discover remote-friendly, dynamic roles that make a difference for over 100,000+ small businesses in the UK.




COMPANY BENEFITS

Receive a powerful computer to work from your home
Annual pay-rise + bonus opportunities - pay reviews annually, with high increase potential, using a fair, objective and consistent formula
Employee stock options scheme (in development)
10% Time to dedicate towards learning
20 statutory days + 5 bonus days + bank holidays
3% employer pension contribution
Cycle to work scheme
Health insurance




COMPANY VALUES

Productivity
Craftsmanship
Teamwork
Diversity
Customer focused

Online Filings is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment irrespective of race, gender, sex, religion, nationality, age or disability.
