Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst.



London/Hybrid.



6-Month Contract.



£400 - £500/day (Inside IR35).







Responsibilites:



Investigate and analyze data and process flows to understand the availability, meaning, and suitability of data for trade booking controls.
Define requirements for proposed data remediation efforts in order to meet regulatory commitments and business objectives.
Build prototypes and support control teams in resolving existing issues and delivering new controls.
Conduct testing to ensure that delivered functionality meets business requirements.
Plan and execute seamless go-live of releases.
Collaborate effectively with Sales/Trading, Technology, Operations, and other functions.
Work within target timeframes in order to meet deliverable and task deadlines.





Requirements:



2 years relevant industry controls experience in Markets in-business management, operational risk, middle office, product control, internal audit, or other relevant control function.
Excellent knowledge of trade flow, lifecycle, and controls in 1 or more product lines.
Excellent data analysis and process definition skills.
Knowledge of PowerBI, Tableau, Excel/VBA & SQL.
Knowledge of Rates/FX Asset Classes would be beneficial.









McGregor Boyall is an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on any grounds.

Title: Data and Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Are you curious about shopper behaviour and have a passion for using insights to make a difference?

This role will play a critical part in the shift to a more comprehensive set of data sources and a focus towards data-driven insights that drive business performance & engagement across all our audiences.


Core Responsibilities




Proactively identify data-driven opportunities for improvement in the LEGO.com shopper experience, sharing actionable insights across team and in relevant forums to trigger action and site optimisation.
Alongside the Business intelligence team, interrogating the data sources within the Big Data Platform using SQL, R or another coding language to build insight, reports and dashboards that empower decision-making within the broader team.
Build and maintain key shared dashboards within Adobe Analytics and act as the admin owner for both the dashboards and the Adobe Analytic platform.
Develop sophisticated site performance dashboards for site optimisation launches, using owned and 3rd Party data sources.
Support maintenance and updates of shopper segmentation models and ensure high standards of data governance.



Do you have what it takes?




Experience of working in an insights and analytics environment (using tools such as Tableau dashboards, SQL-based databases and/or R/Python).
Exposure to working in a Retail Loyalty/Memberships/Subscription environment is advantageous.
Experience in SQL is a must.
Experience working with big data platforms.
Working knowledge of personalisation, loyalty programs and customer value.
Ability to put together clear and concise actionable insights from multiple data sources to answer business questions.



Play your part in our team succeeding

How we use data in LEGO Retail is changing, as a fully integrated data ecosystem is brought to life across all areas of the business! This role (your role) will play a key part in defining and delivering how we utilise this data to support the continued growth of LEGO Retail as an ever-increasingly important component of the LEGO Group.

This is a role with a Global remit, based in the UK.

Join the global LEGO® team

What’s in it for you? Here are some of what to expect

Family Care Leave – We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellness – We want you to be your best self, so you’ll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are based

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached, you’ll be rewarded through our global bonus scheme.

Your workplace – Our offices will be your primary workplace with flexibility to work from home during your working week. Your People Leader will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model, role eligibility and frequency with you.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong!

The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of e.g. race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

What’s in it for you?

Here Are Some Of What To Expect




Family Care Leave – We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.
Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.
Wellness – We want you to be your best self, so you'll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are based.
Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.
Bonus – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.
Your workplace – When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. The hiring team will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model 'Best of Both', role eligibility and frequency with you during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wilkinson Partners are very pleased to have partnered with a leading specialist Investment and Lending business who specialise in both commercial and residential property. The firm are actively looking to make a strategic hire for a Data Analyst to join their platform and report directly into the firm's CFO and Technology Director.




This hire forms part of their impressive growth plans as they look to build on their current success and continue building out their data capabilities. A compelling opportunity for a Data professional who is looking to join an entrepreneurial business and add real value in their next role.




Key experience required:




2-3 years experience as a Data professional
Proficient in SQL and PowerBI - other technologies are advantageous and will be considered
Excellent data visualisation skills, be able to tell a story with the data insights
Strong understanding of Finance, being numerically minded with an investigative mindset
Executive presence - confidence in working with senior stakeholders across each aspect of the business




For an informal chat to discuss how this role could be the next step for your career, please either apply or reach out directly to Tom Jackson on the details below:




tomjackson@wilkinsonpartners.com

020 3687 0432

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Working for a non-profit organization, that changes the lives of others daily. An organization that has an outstanding reputation for caring for its employees as much as they do for the communities they support.

This organization has a new position, a Data insight Lead. This role will play a pivotal part in leading a thorough and forensic approach to data with collaboration and insights. This role will give insights and play a fundamental part in giving a narrative to our external customers on how the organization use the funding in many varied forms.

You will have responsibility for data analysis, and you will be the voice for the group of companies to ensure consistency, and accuracy of the company’s data which highlights the work being done.

Skills required.

Degree or adequate experience in data analysis, Statistics insights
UK candidate with the right to work indefinitely
Experienced in leading a group / Project team in analytical findings.
Proven experience in data insights
Previous experience in collaboration with external sources on collecting data.
Experience in working to service-level agreements.
Engage with stakeholders and colleagues to ensure delivery.
Confident in data ready to share and to support business activities.
Strong use of Technology to create a better way of working for internal and external teams.

This role is a great opportunity for the right individual who wants to make a difference in their day-to-day role. This will enable the visualization of data to reach millions and generate continued support and growth for this renowned organisation.

You will be rewarded with the role that you play and the flexibility they have as a company. Great flexibility and benefits.

Please send a CV for consideration in regard to this opening.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Reference #




264662BR




Job Type




Full Time




Your role




Are you an analytical thinker and data-driven problem-solver? Do you know how to gather and translate business requirements, working with large risk datasets and own these solutions through to implementation? Would you like to work in a truly collaborative environment to find effective and efficient solutions to the reporting needs of our risk business?




We are looking for a Data Analyst like you to:





capture and translate the risk reporting requirements we need to meet regulatory and business change initiatives
work with key stakeholders such as IT, data owners, risk reporting officers & associates plus our business sponsors to create high quality reports and dashboards
provide innovative, robust solutions which contain clear insight and highlights reflecting the status and/or changes in our risk
create the sub-tasks needed to deliver these reporting solutions, allocate the tasks to the appropriate teams and then track to completion
support our business to embed these solutions into live and ensure that we are achieving the full business value from these reports and dashboards
drive standardization, automation and continuous improvements of data collection, analysis, and reporting processes





Your team





you will be working as part of a global team responsible for providing reporting analysis to our business colleagues
you’ll be part of the newly created Agile pods and have the opportunity to play a critical role in enabling the high-paced Agile transformation
our team is part of the wider Group Risk Control organization and is an agent of change for our Risk Control colleagues. We are a diverse team of specialists with different backgrounds and we enjoy finding and implementing first-rate solutions for our business





Your expertise





degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Technology or equivalent
ideally 5 years of experience working in a similar role within the banking industry, preferably in credit and/or market risk
proven experience using Business Intelligence and reporting software and data visualization (e.g. Power BI, MicroStrategy, Tableau)
technical skills are an advantage, including Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Experience with SQL, Python or similar languages
confident communicator able to convey information and ideas clearly, good at building relationships across geographically distributed teams
strong customer focus and passion to enable data-driven decision-making and improvements
effective time management and ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously
attention to detail along with structured organization and planning skills





About Us




UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.




With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?




Join us




At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.




From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?




Disclaimer / Policy Statements




UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: London – Hybrid

Salary: £32,000 - £50,000 (Depending on Experience) + Bonus




The Green Recruitment Company are excited to be working with one of the most exciting Sustainable Energy Suppliers in the UK, who are determined to play a significant role in the energy transition by supporting businesses across Commercial, Industrial, & EV Charging markets.




The scale-up doubled their headcount last year following significant investment and are looking to continue in this stead through 2023 – focusing on their analytics function. Boasting excellent career progression and training programmes, successful candidates would have the opportunity to gain exposure to a range of emerging energy concepts (Flex, PPAs, EV Charging, & Renewables) within an exciting & collaborative modern work environment.




As part of this continuous growth, our client is actively searching for a Data Analyst, who will be involved in transforming raw data into valuable market reports, insights, & models – directly improving commercial value & internal processes and efficiency.




Responsibilities Include:

Understand key issues energy suppliers face and suggest opportunities to improve.
Analysing and organising raw data from multiple sources to identify key trends.
Organise meetings with senior leadership outlining key findings and recommendations.
Guarantee reports & findings are accurate and presented in a clear, concise manner.
Solve problems through a number of computer science, modelling, & analytical methods.
Mine & analyse date to produce relevant reports.
Key in, evaluate, & update non-commodity price elements.
Develop & share industry insights & market reports.
Creating, improving, & maintaining new products and channels
Data entry & ad-hoc tasks as required.




Job Requirements:

Strong experience surrounding Python, SQL, R, or VBA.
Working experience in an analytical position.
Experience within relevant industry (Electricity, Gas, Energy, Cleantech).
Strong MS Office & computer skills.
Holds a STEM or numerically focused degree.
Ability to work with large data sets.
Understanding of CRM systems.




Desirables:

Attention to detail.
Strong communicator.
Critical problem solver.
Team player, with initiative to go above and beyond.
Fast learner and ambitious personality.
Start-up/scale-up experience highly valued.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are KHWS, an insight-driven, brand activation agency based in the City of London close to Blackfriars Bridge. We are a bright and hardworking group of professionals working as a tight knit team, covering strategy, creative, customer experience and digital delivery.




About the role







We need a Data Analyst to support our digital platforms and marketing campaigns. You’ll be an analytical thinker with experience working in a marketing agency. You will be supporting the client service team on all things data and analytics.







You will be responsible for recommendations on platform and campaign tracking, data collection & manipulation and the creation of analytical reports. You will be comfortable explaining and presenting these reports to internal teams, and clients if required.







You will have solid experience working with Google Analytics (GA4), dashboard applications (e.g. Looker/GDS) and excellent Excel skills. Experience working with Google BigQuery, R and SQL would be advantageous.




You will be working in a team of three, reporting into a Senior Insights Analyst. You will need to be confident in your abilities and able to work independently. You will have a strong desire to learn and professionally grow in this ever changing and expanding agency function.




You will also gain exposure to our proprietary behavioural insight part of our business.







Experience & Skills




· Must have at least 2+ years of Data Analyst experience within a marketing agency

· Experience building out reports based on GA4 data

· Experience creating and maintaining Looker/GDS (or similar) dashboards

· Experience working with various data sets (ecommerce, paid media, social)

· Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills

· Data sourcing, cleaning, & modelling sourcing data from a variety of databases & third-party sources e.g. web, social, paid ad, CRM, etc

· Google BigQuery beneficial

· R & SQL experience beneficial

· Experience working with statistical programming languages and interfaces beneficial







Our culture and benefits




We have an inclusive and collaborative culture where we’re all encouraged to shine. Beyond offering you the chance to develop your career in an independent agency, we have great benefits including.







· Hybrid working environment (3 days in the office/ 2 days from home)

· 25 days hols, plus 3 extra days at Xmas (plus bank holidays)

· Pension

· Continuous learning and development, workshops, and events throughout the year

· Discounted gym membership via MyGym Discounts.

· Travel loans

· Sabbatical scheme after 5 years’ service

· Cycle to Work scheme

· Workplace Nursery Scheme

· Healthcare cash plan

· Access to Bippit, an all-in-one financial wellbeing platform, which includes unlimited 1:1 coaching from a finance professional.

· Dog friendly office

· Recognition awards, much-loved socials, plus various other treats throughout the month to keep us all smiling







Has this role got your name all over it?




If it has, we’d like to hear from you. Simply send over your CV and we’ll be in touch.




Lastly, we want you to be clear on how we safeguard and use any personal information you give to us. If you’re interested, have a look at the privacy statement found on our website.

HTML:
We are KHWS, an insight-driven, brand activation agency based in the City of London close to Blackfriars Bridge. We are a bright and hardworking group of professionals working as a tight knit team, covering strategy, creative, customer experience and digital delivery.


About the role



We need a Data Analyst to support our digital platforms and marketing campaigns. You’ll be an analytical thinker with experience working in a marketing agency. You will be supporting the client service team on all things data and analytics.



You will be responsible for recommendations on platform and campaign tracking, data collection & manipulation and the creation of analytical reports. You will be comfortable explaining and presenting these reports to internal teams, and clients if required.



You will have solid experience working with Google Analytics (GA4), dashboard applications (e.g. Looker/GDS) and excellent Excel skills. Experience working with Google BigQuery, R and SQL would be advantageous.


You will be working in a team of three, reporting into a Senior Insights Analyst. You will need to be confident in your abilities and able to work independently. You will have a strong desire to learn and professionally grow in this ever changing and expanding agency function.


You will also gain exposure to our proprietary behavioural insight part of our business.



Experience & Skills


· Must have at least 2+ years of Data Analyst experience within a marketing agency

· Experience building out reports based on GA4 data

· Experience creating and maintaining Looker/GDS (or similar) dashboards

· Experience working with various data sets (ecommerce, paid media, social)

· Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills

· Data sourcing, cleaning, & modelling sourcing data from a variety of databases & third-party sources e.g. web, social, paid ad, CRM, etc

· Google BigQuery beneficial

· R & SQL experience beneficial

· Experience working with statistical programming languages and interfaces beneficial



Our culture and benefits


We have an inclusive and collaborative culture where we’re all encouraged to shine. Beyond offering you the chance to develop your career in an independent agency, we have great benefits including.



· Hybrid working environment (3 days in the office/ 2 days from home)

· 25 days hols, plus 3 extra days at Xmas (plus bank holidays)

· Pension

· Continuous learning and development, workshops, and events throughout the year

· Discounted gym membership via MyGym Discounts.

· Travel loans

· Sabbatical scheme after 5 years’ service

· Cycle to Work scheme

· Workplace Nursery Scheme

· Healthcare cash plan

· Access to Bippit, an all-in-one financial wellbeing platform, which includes unlimited 1:1 coaching from a finance professional.

· Dog friendly office

· Recognition awards, much-loved socials, plus various other treats throughout the month to keep us all smiling



Has this role got your name all over it?


If it has, we’d like to hear from you. Simply send over your CV and we’ll be in touch.


Lastly, we want you to be clear on how we safeguard and use any personal information you give to us. If you’re interested, have a look at the privacy statement found on our website.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: 1 Bishopsgate, London EC2N (Hybrid working)

Who we are:

Apollo is an independent specialist (re)insurer launched in 2009 to provide high quality products and services to clients, brokers, and capital partners at Lloyd’s. The Apollo name recognised the success of one of its founding investors Neil Armstrong, who in 1969 was the first person to land on the moon. Along with Jim Hays, Neil saw the opportunity to build a differentiated service provider at Lloyd’s.

Today, Apollo is a team of more than 200 colleagues, servicing clients, partners and brokers from across the globe through its unique augmented underwriting approach.

“We attract and retain the highest quality talent by developing a team atmosphere where opportunity exists for our employees and partners.” David Ibeson, Group CEO

Your Role:

To support us on our collective journey to success we are seeking a Data Analyst to join our expanding ibott 1971 Syndicate.

Reporting to the ibott Senior Data Scientist and working closely with the ibott Actuaries and Underwriters, the Data Analyst will drive forward the data capabilities of the ibott SPA 1971.

What you’ll do:

Maximise value of data collected from clients and external data to improve understanding of risk
Responsibility for the development of accurate, relevant and timely MI to provide insight about and to clients.
Develop and maintain the ibott master data databases
Review of existing data structure and suggestions for best set up going forward
Research technologies, data sources & methodologies & invest time to embed these in regular processes to keep ibott innovative
Reconciliation of data sources
Assist the Ibott actuaries and underwriters in pricing risks and analysing performance of clients either on aipre-bind basis or as part of post-bind review.
Work with ibott clients to build and implement data capture solutions which can operate at scale
Source and analyse external data to allow for better insights at greater granularities
Knowledge sharing with the BI team, and the wider business


What we are looking for:

Some experience of another coding language: SQL (or similar), Python, R, VBA
Familiarity with data visualisation tools: Power BI or equivalent
Educated to degree level in a mathematical subject or 2+ years relevant data analytics work experience
Experience in data analytics with the ability to analyse and synthesise information from large volumes of data
Highly proficient user of Excel
Ability to communicate complex information in simple terms
Demonstrable problem solving and creative skills with great attention to detail
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Curious with a committed to self-development and a passion about challenging the status quo
Experience in the insurance industry and the the Lloyd’s Market would be preferred but not essential


What you will get in return:

As well as your salary, this role offers a discretionary bonus plus a broad range of benefits, including Non-Contributory Pension, Private Medical & Travel Insurance.

Our Commitment to Inclusion:

Apollo is a growing and diverse team of empowered and passionate experts who focus on bringing innovation, data driven decision making and collaboration to every relationship and every risk. To meet the needs of a demanding global insurance market, we need a diverse workforce that truly understands the international communities we serve.

That is why we're focused on developing diverse talent at every level; inclusion and diversity means more to us than just chasing a target and we are committed to supporting and celebrating difference. Our people are at the heart of our business which is why we value the diversity of thought and talent of every member of our team.

We offer a range of support and run a programme of events and training that recognise the challenges and opportunities relating to diversity.

Hybrid & flexible working:

At Apollo Hybrid & Flexible working is fully embraced. We understand that no one colleague is the same and that each of us has our own responsibilities and roles outside of our working life, meaning we actively support and empower employees to manage this within our flexible working guidelines.

Reasonable Adjustments:

We want everyone to have equal access to our recruitment and selection processes so if you require any adjustments or assistance, please get in touch with us via careers@apollounderwriting.com.

Thank you!

To find out more about our values, ESG strategy and commitment to inclusion please click on the 'Life at Apollo Pack’ link at the bottom of our careers page https://apollounderwriting.com/careers/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
West London (SW13)

Contract: Full time (Mon-Fri)

Salary: Competitive

Hybrid working (3 days in the office)

Our expanding group of award-winning brands has been established for over 30 years and consists of multiple e-commerce platforms. Our vision is to provide the best service to customers during key events in their life. We believe that their shopping experience as they navigate those big, once in a lifetime milestones, should be exciting, positive and special; we help them make memories.

We started as the home of wedding gift lists - but now The Cambium Group encompasses so much more, supporting customers through life’s milestones every step of the way. Through our flagship brands The Wedding Shop, The Wedding Present Company and Prezola, we help engaged couples build their dream gift lists with an obsessive focus on gold star customer service at every touch point: from our luxury showrooms to our cutting edge tech platforms. Powered up by our long-term investors Phoenix Asset Management, and with a focus on innovation and digital marketing, we’ve now applied these values to new markets too, bringing one of the UK’s leading wedding planning platforms, Rock My Wedding, to the group, along with lifestyle shopping destination The Homeware Outlet. Our newest venture, LittleList, is set to revolutionise the baby gifting market in 2023.

A key ingredient of our success is our close-knit and fun company culture: we’re extremely proud of the 170 (and counting!) talented Cambium team-mates. With family very much at the heart of how our brands function, it’s important that our team feels like one too. Please read our 11 Principles, by clicking HERE, and see whether they align with your own values because an essential part of the role is in the continual embedding, reinforcing and living of those principles.

We are looking for a passionate Data Analyst who can explore our raw information and data to find patterns, valuable insights and solutions to guide our business decisions and improvements. This role will involve assimilating data from various sources to produce meaningful business insights, working with our Group Financial Controller on our business intelligence database as well as working with different stakeholders on our reporting capabilities and analysis. We are looking for a critical thinker with excellent problem solving skills and a passion for analysis and statistics. This role will work closely with many different stakeholders including our Marketing, Customer Care, Finance and Development teams so you will need to be an excellent communicator who can understand their data needs and provide solutions that are presented in an appropriate format.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities:

Unify and normalize data from various sources across our different platforms in our data warehouse to provide one view and allow comparison and understanding between our different brands and produce meaningful business insights.
Responsible for analysing data and communicating insights that help to drive strategic decision making across the business.
Create and manage alerts for various departments to highlight things from the data like customer issues, potential fraud etc.
Provide forecasting data and models for business performance, targets and to help make business decisions on new features or initiatives.
Work with different stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and then create, maintain and troubleshoot these reports.
Develop, implement and maintain databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Present information using appropriate data visualization techniques.
Work with our Business Intelligence database to ensure it has the necessary data and reports needed.
Manage users & permissions.


Relevant Skills and Experience:

Proven experience as a Data & Analytics Manager or in a similar role.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages and databases including SQL (PostGRES and MySQL).
Strong knowledge of statistics and experience using Excel and Google Sheets for analyzing datasets.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience translating business questions into clearly defined data requirements.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Analytical mind and business acumen.
Experience working with multiple data sources and combining datasets to generate new insights. Experience using tools to sync data (e.g. Stitch, Kloudio or Zapier) and of a Data warehouse would be desirable.
Experience with Power BI is essential.
Experience with Data Studio would be desirable.
Experience managing a Business Intelligence database.
Experience in Google Analytics would be beneficial.
Curious and enthusiastic problem solver who enjoys learning new things.
Good at prioritizing.


Benefits

23 days paid holiday per year (plus Bank Holidays) 
Annual Bonus Scheme
Cycle2Work
Discount Scheme (over 500 Brands) – brands include The White Company, LSA, Nkuku, Le Creuset, Oka, Denby, Garden Trading Company, Neom, Emma Bridgewater, Weber, Soho Home, Blush & Blue and more (discounts of up to 75% off RRP for selected brands).
Discounted Private Healthcare
A beautiful, dog friendly office with a brilliant team, regular socials and flexible working option
Show more Show less

  • Experience managing a Business Intelligence database.
  • Experience in Google Analytics would be beneficial.
  • Curious and enthusiastic problem solver who enjoys learning new things.
  • Good at prioritizing.

  • 23 days paid holiday per year (plus Bank Holidays) 
  • Annual Bonus Scheme
  • Cycle2Work
  • Discount Scheme (over 500 Brands) – brands include The White Company, LSA, Nkuku, Le Creuset, Oka, Denby, Garden Trading Company, Neom, Emma Bridgewater, Weber, Soho Home, Blush & Blue and more (discounts of up to 75% off RRP for selected brands).
  • Discounted Private Healthcare
  • A beautiful, dog friendly office with a brilliant team, regular socials and flexible working option

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

Job Description

About the role

Verisk Maplecroft’s datasets are the core of the company’s offering and your numeracy skills, attention to detail, commercial awareness and project management skills will ensure that the datasets are delivered on time to clients with the highest level of accuracy. You will be creative and draw on your domain knowledge to develop new datasets and write analytical content for data clients. As someone with strong quantitative skills, you will support colleagues in the wider Research and Consulting teams with client work and support the Sales team in helping clients to understand and use the company’s data. You will be based in Bath, Edinburgh or London and report to the Head of Country Risk Data.

About The Day-to-day Responsibilities Of The Role

Support updates to the company’s thematic datasets.
Improving these datasets by listening to client feedback, finding new data sources, and implementing new scoring methodologies.
Managing a project plan to ensure timely delivery of updates.
Supporting colleagues and clients with questions on these datasets in collaboration with the wider Analytics team.
Writing occasional data-rich insights to show the value of the data.
Using your quantitative skills to help colleagues in Consulting deliver projects on time, on budget, that meet the clients’ needs.

Qualifications

Degree level (or equivalent) qualification in a subject with a quantitative element (required)
Advanced Excel skills (required)
1+ years of work experience in a quantitative role (required)
Excellent organisational skills and ability to work in a team (required)
Domain knowledge (post graduate degree or equivalent experience) in one of the following human rights, politics, environmental or climate science, economics, or commodities (preferred)

Additional Information

In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.

For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.

Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.

Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.

Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other
Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes
Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

http://www.verisk.com/careers.html

Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

http://www.verisk.com/careers.html

Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

£53,000

Fully remote (with 1/2 days in a London office each quarter)

Please note: we do not offer sponsorship.




Extremely excited to be partnered with a non-profit organisation that found a gap in the market and is now leading in their industry. Our client is going through an exciting time, with transformations, greenfield projects, and a great roadmap for what is to come.

I am looking for a proactive Data and Insights Analyst to join a highly prestigious and industry-leading consumer goods brand. This role will be part of the Insights & Analytics team and will play a crucial part in drawing insights to drive informed decisions across the business and deliver a better understanding of the customer base.

Advanced knowledge of Excel
Proven experience using analytical software packages such as KNIME, Alteryx, SAS, Qlik, Salesforce (Tableau)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
NGS Data Analyst




London




Permanent




£ Competitive




Role profile:




SRG are partnering with a unique game-changer in the field of semiconductor technology combined with biochemical methodologies, to develop a novel approach to next generation sequencing (NGS). This role will see you support the platform development team through analysis of NGS data throughout the R&D lifecycle.




Key role requirements:




Analysis of a range of data sets generated by teams in R&D, including processing of the raw electronic signals generated by the NGS platform
Development of new data visualisation techniques to support the activity in the laboratory
Working closely with the lab teams to maintain dialogue relating to the data results which inform experimental design
Monitoring signal processing algorithms to suggest methods for improvement
Support and offer subject matter expertise to assist with the design and implementation of high-throughput automated primary DNA sequencing signal analysis software (eg base calls, phasing, mapped reads, signal to noise, quality etc)
Working to maintain an accurate and efficient Quality Management System, fulfilling all relevant documentation commensurate with ISO 13485 quality standard




Person specification:

Masters or PhD in a relevant field such as Applied Mathematics, Biomedical Engineering, Chemistry, Physics, Bioinformatics, or related
Very proficient in Python, SciPy, NumPy, Pandas. Experienced with a range of programming packages including R, SQL and Matlab
Proven demonstrated background working with raw signal processing, data analysis and data visualisation
Experience working with NGS technology
Sound genomics understanding including statistical methods associated with this space
Development, optimisation and implementation of NGS primary analysis algorithms
Strong mathematical ability, able to find innovative and elegant solutions with a strong team ethos and comfortable in a multidisciplinary environment




If this represents you and your next step then please apply through the link or contact me for further information: bec.johnston@srgtalent.com / 01223 607858




#NGS #nextgenerationsequencing #datascience #dataanalyst #london #moleculardiagnostics

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT HANDELSBANKEN:




Handelsbanken is a local relationship bank built on timeless and sustainable values. The Bank specialises in providing personalised banking services to both businesses and individuals, as well as wealth and investment management services through its UK subsidiary Handelsbanken Wealth & Asset Management. Handelsbanken operates a decentralised way of working, with a strong local presence due to a nationwide branch network and a long-term approach to customer relations. Each Handelsbanken branch operates as a small business enabling it to make decisions at a local level and provide a service that is bespoke, with the focus always being on the needs of each individual customer. Throughout the organisation, individuals enjoy wide-ranging responsibility, and the scope to pursue a unique career, within a culture of openness, equality and professionalism.




ROLE: Data Analyst

LOCATION: London

REMUNERATION: Competitive + Benefits







ROLE OVERVIEW:




Data Analyst is a key role in our journey to becoming a data driven organisation

Working within the UK Data Management function, the role holder is responsible for analysis, solution design and recommendations, implementation related to the Bank’s approach to data management policies. This includes contributing to the design, documentation and implementation of the data governance framework, policies, and related standards related to data management, EUDA management and Master Data management; supporting the establishment of the Bank’s operating model for data ownership and the Bank’s data governance committee structures.

The role reports directly to the Head of Data Management, and is part of a small team of data analysts responsible for embedding best practice data governance and quality practices across the Bank whilst also helping support the wider change initiatives across the organisation.







ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:




Position's primary focus will be:

Perform data analysis, to identify, collect and migrate data to and from a range of systems, to manipulate and link different data sets for the purpose of summarising and presenting data and recommendations in the most appropriate format for stakeholders
Document data models at physical, logical and conceptual levels to support Bank-wide IT and analytics issue identification and development.
Analyse, document and resolve issues identified from data mapping and data conversions and manage the stakeholder engagement to resolve with both Business and IT SMEs.
Data quality management from initial analysis through to solution design and implementation.
Identifying areas for data improvement, explore feasible options, analyse the effects of data change and define success measures
Requirements gathering skills to elicit, analyse and validate stakeholder requirements, business requirements and solution requirements (functional and non-functional). To document the requirements in the form of user stories supported with acceptance criteria and to have the ability to elicit requirements ensuring both vertical and horizontal traceability.
Understanding any business and policy constraints that need to be considered, and assess the implications
Partner with IT and business to design and implement data quality solutions that adhere to banks data principles and governance framework
Support and influence the definition of clear goals to improve data collaboration, data quality, and reduce data architecture complexity and information security risks
Be passionate about data quality and continuously strive to promote data quality through the development of system and process controls
Analysing and assessing risks and impacts of solution options, performing cost-benefit analysis and collaborating with a variety of stakeholders to achieve an investment decision.







DEVELOPMENT POTENTIAL:




There will be ample scope for the successful applicant to develop their banking knowledge within both the Individual and Corporate markets, as well as their general Bank knowledge within the local branch environment. The branch has a diverse customer base and the successful candidate will engage with customers and professionals at all levels. We are committed to personal development, with this role providing the opportunity to develop soft skills and technical acumen with vast opportunities for growth and long-term career development. Appropriate training and support will be provided.




SKILLS, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:




Experience embedding data quality and governance processes and standards in a regulated environment, you may have held data quality owner responsibility in an organisation or led the development of best practice or have been a Business Analyst working to deliver a large change project, partnering with business and technology within a Financial Services environment
Familiar with data maturity assessments and ability to lead conversation with IT on data lineage, taxonomies, catalogue and metadata management
Understanding of information management practices including information lifecycle management, data modelling, master data management and carrying out data audits and requirements gathering
Experience of leading data quality initiatives that have provided tangible efficiencies and/or business value
Experience of data quality management, master data management and reference data management
Working knowledge of statutory frameworks such as CCPA, GDPR, BCBS and Data Protection Act
Experience of leading projects and leading/influencing a diverse stakeholder group, including senior stakeholders
Ability to create positive relationships and communicate with a range of stakeholders
Methodical with strong attention to detail, accuracy and efficiency are key
Analytical approach to work; varying ways to problem solve (e.g. data analysis, MI), root-cause analysis etc.
Be able to work autonomously and as part of a wider team
(Optional) Practical experience and an understanding of both Agile and Waterfall ways of working
(Optional) Experience in modelling business processes, preferably BPMN or other industry modelling standards
(Optional) Experience using a variety of software tools such as JIRA, Confluence, MS Visio etc.




Role Qualification:

Demonstrate proficiency using Excel and SQL experience to source, analyse, normalise and process data for quality validations
Experience using data visualisation tools to present complex analysis is essential e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview
Experience of working on data conversions that required data mapping and complex transformations is essential
Experience working in data quality, data governance or data management or experience working as a Business Analyst within a Financial Services environment
Strong presentation skills both written and oral, experienced in presenting complex data concepts to a business audience i.e. running workshops and formal data governance meetings
Knowledge and understanding of master data elements and processes, understanding of static versus transactional data challenges
Experience and/or knowledge of data quality and lineage tools: Ad Initio, Collibra, Informatica, IBM MDM etc.
Experience creating and using data models and data definitions
Experience of resolving data quality issues and data governance in the financial services industry
Experience of data modelling is ideal







You must comply with 5 Conduct rules i.e.




Act with integrity;
Act with due skill, care and diligence;
Be open and co-operative with the FCA, PRA and other regulators;
Pay due regard to the interests of customers and treat them fairly;
Observe proper standards of market conduct.




Handelsbanken Group are deeply committed to embedding good equality and diversity practice into all of our activities so that we are an inclusive, welcoming and inspiring place to work, regardless of age, disability, pregnancy and/or parental status, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender reassignment or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Description




If you’re at home managing complex datasets and AI systems, your intelligence could help drive our digital revolution.




Our Data Analysts are trusted to work closely with a wide range of clients on exciting projects with real-world purpose and impact.




In 2022, CGI was voted a ‘Best Workplace in Tech’ by Great Place to Work™ and was named one of the ‘World’s Best Employers’ by Forbes magazine. We offer a competitive salary, excellent pension, private healthcare, plus a share scheme (3.5% + 3.5% matching) which makes you a member not just an employee.




We are committed to inclusivity, building a genuinely diverse community of tech talent and inspiring everyone to pursue careers in our sector. Join us and you’ll be part of an open, friendly community of experts. We’ll train and support you in taking your career wherever you want it to go.




Your future duties and responsibilities




You’ll join a collaborative team working on activities pertaining to application retirement for one of our financial services clients. You will need to understand the data model ‘as is’ and be able to design/identify the optimal target model for archiving the date - or - mapping the data to the target/replacement application. The role also involves managing other activities of a technical nature in the context of application retirement, leveraging project Management experience and discipline. There is a large volume of data sets to be analysed.




Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role




Demonstrable Data Analysis skills
SQL skills on large data sets
Good technical knowledge of the Unix OS/Environment
Experience within Banking & Financial Services sector




Insights you can act on




While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.




When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees “members” because they are CGI shareholders and owners, and, as owners, we enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today—one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.




At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where everyone belongs, and we collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal opportunity employer, we empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.




Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI—where your ideas and actions make a difference.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Technical Data Analyst – T-SQL, SSIS, Data Warehouse, Insurance, AWS, London - £75,000




A well-respected Insurance Syndicate operating out of Lloyd’s of London is currently searching for a Technical Data Analyst to join their Digital Transformation team in the City.




The business works globally in the Specialty & Reinsurance market and this role will have you working on delivering global strategic data solutions that will serve as an important pillar in the company’s decision-making process.




You will be working on designing, building and supporting data warehouses and will involve you working on ETL processes and ensuring end-to-end data pathways that meet business requirements. You will primarily be using T-SQL, SSIS & Excel within this role.




To be successful in this role you will require the following:




Experience working with T-SQL & SSIS for data warehousing purposes.
Prior experience designing, building and supporting Data Warehouses.
Experience of working on a fully hosted cloud environment, preferably AWS.




It will be nice if you have the following:




Worked within and Insurance setting, but Financial Services at a minimum.
Any experience with Genius / IRIS / Salesforce / Rulebook




This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to join their Digital Transformation team to work on an important pillar of the company’s strategic vision.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.

ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.

ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UK’s leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketplaces Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on marketplace performance; supporting the commercial and product teams to run experiments and improve UX and monetisation and supporting the marketplaces leadership team in developing the overall strategy.

What you will be doing:

Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
Work closely with our commercial team to help them understand the performance of each of our partners
Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve the marketplace and user experience
Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals


Skills We'd Love You To Have

You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload and that of your team
Previous managerial experience is highly desirable, but not essential
You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
Strong quantitative and numerical skills


Why ClearScore?

ClearScore is the UK's #1 credit score and report app. We are also present in South Africa, Australia and Canada, with more than 18 million users globally and growing fast. Someone joins ClearScore every 20 seconds. We have established relationships with over 50 of the main lenders in the U.K., and have been a trusted tool for customers to manage their credit and make better financial decisions.

Since October 2016 we have helped 1.8 million users take out a new credit card or loan. We are user-centric at our core and we believe in leveraging technology to enable positive financial choices. We are design-led and data-driven and we embed these behaviours in everything we do.

Our company culture is a fundamental part of all we have achieved. We believe in hiring smart, driven, passionate and diverse people who are keen on having a real impact in our organisation. We trust you to manage your own time so we offer flexible work and no fixed desk hours. We don't micromanage and we believe in measuring outcomes rather than effort. We have an inclusive culture where all, regardless of seniority, are encouraged to contribute with their ideas, look after their wellbeing and actively seek opportunities for career growth.

If you feel like this could be the place for you, apply and our Talent team will be happy to share more.

Benefits:

25 paid holidays and a “duvet day” on your birthday
Private health and dental cover
GP office visits
Life assurance scheme
Up to 6% matched pension
Brown bags with guest speakers
Access to Perkbox
Dog-friendly office
Daily breakfast and free snacks
Free sports and social clubs
Generous training allowance
Fast progression
Leadership-led training
Regular well-being events
In-house psychotherapist
Financial coach to help you plan and achieve your goals
Physical and mental health support through BUPA
No clock-watching culture
Generous maternity and paternity plans
Culture and inclusion representatives
Transparent pay structure and a career growth plan


Inclusion Policy

We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You will need to develop close relationships with data leads within each of the distributors and be a key part of the recently formed Data Working Group, jointly chaired by the data leads at Arts Council England and The National Lottery Community Fund.

You will have a UK-wide remit and a proactive approach to engaging with data teams across each of the community, arts, sports and heritage portfolios though the data working group.

Hours: Full time, 37 Hours per week. Flexible working considered

Location: Expectation to travel to London, minimum once a week. Hybrid working

For successful candidates based in London, you will be asked to complete national security vetting clearance so that you can access our Marsham Street Office. This involves passing a disclosure and barring check and Counter Terrorism Check.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
2X OUTSIDE IR35 CONTRACT ROLES AVAILABLE

Data Analyst – 12 months – rate open to negotiation – City of London (hybrid)




You will be expected to build an excellent knowledge of the companies data analytics tools along with a deep understanding of the supporting data structures.

The position involves understanding current data offerings and data sources, involving developing reports and dashboards, responding to urgent production issues and assisting other teams. Also, involvement in identifying improvements and planning their implementation; these could range from simple evolutionary improvements to existing processes and tools to the adoption of a whole new stack.

You will work closely with / guide, internal and external teams on best practice around providing data insights, dashboards, governance and provenance.




Experience Required:

· Experience of processes around the inspection, cleansing, transforming and modelling of data to derive useful, high value business insights.

· You will have experience of programming using SQL to manage data in a relational database environment along with knowledge of how to manipulate, process and extract data from disparate data resources.

· Experience of using BI Tools such as Yellowfin, Tableau, Quicksight will be crucial along with an ability to elicit requirements from stakeholders across the business.

Data Analyst – this role will be about getting unused data and building dashboards for a project, all about collecting data from insurers from policies that are in force, building dashboards for a client and for internal/external people. Also to look at the client data stuff from a Product point of view – as in what more can we do with it and could it be a product in its own right? Needs someone experienced and smart – someone used to dealing with visual tooling i.e. Yellowfin, experienced in building self service capability, building interactive dashboards, reports. SQL. AWS, Redshift – all would be helpful.










2 X OUTSIDE IR35 CONTRACT ROLES AVAILABLE

Data Engineer – 12 months – rate open to negotiation – City of London (hybrid)




You will be expected to build an excellent knowledge of the companies products with a deep understanding of how we build and deploy our applications/ETLs.

The position involves understanding the current data stack and data pipelines. This will involve supporting their day-to-day execution, responding to urgent production issues and assisting other teams. It will also require involvement in identifying improvements and planning their implementation. These could range from simple evolutionary improvements to existing processes and tools to the adoption of a whole new stack.

You will work closely with / guide, data scientists, software developers and data analysts on best practice around data prep, storage, transformation, governance and provenance.




Experience Required:

· An understanding of complex data transformation pipelines, processes and their orchestration.

· You should have experience of designing, building, and maintaining high-quality ETL/ELT software components to assemble large, complex data sets to meet functional / non-functional requirements.

· You will have knowledge of best practices around data technologies in the cloud combined with an ability to propose and assess solutions to design problems, including identifying and evaluating new technologies and third party components.

· Experience of using technologies to deliver solutions using AWS, Kubernetes, and Terraform would be a benefit.

Data Engineer – This is a project role again. From a Data Engineering perspective, this is a greenfield project where we are considering a whole new approach. It’s critical to find this skillset – someone who can build self-service data engineering type platform. The stack to do this is currently an unknown and we want to find someone to come in and help us build the business case for what the stack is/should be. Business case is already there – this is about designing the architecture and thinking about “what is the right way to do it?”. We get mixed quality data from insurers so are looking for someone to help us select the right product where it would be easier to take in the data and to get it into a single consistent format where it is automated as much as possible. - AWS, ETL, Kubernetes

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled data discovery and exploration specialist to join our team. The candidate will be responsible for identifying and sourcing data sources to provide insights and recommendations that help drive business decisions in the digital media domain. The ideal candidate will have a passion for data discovery and exploration, with experience in working with digital media data sources and tools.




Responsibilities:

Conduct data exploration and discovery activities to identify new insights and trends related to digital media operations and performance.
Use statistical analysis and data modelling techniques to identify trends and insights in large and complex digital media data sets.
Develop and maintain documentation related to data analysis methodologies, data dictionaries, and data lineage for digital media data sources.
Create and maintain data pipelines, ETL scripts and SQL queries to extract, transform, and load digital media data from various sources.
Collaborate with digital media stakeholders and IT team members to ensure digital media data accuracy, consistency, and integrity.
Stay up to date with digital media industry trends, new tools, and technologies that can help enhance digital media data analysis and interpretation.
Experience working in an agile development environment, using methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban, to deliver projects on time and to specification.
Proven track record of working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including developers, project managers, and business stakeholders, to ensure successful project outcomes.
Knowledge of agile development practices, including user stories, sprint planning, backlog grooming, and sprint reviews.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in data exploration and discovery in the digital media domain and marketing analytics, preferably in a business intelligence or analytics environment.
Expertise in data exploration and discovery techniques, including data visualization, statistical analysis, and data modelling.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Experience with digital media data sources, ETL, data pipeline development and maintenance.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.




FLEXIBLE WORKING

We are committed to supporting and helping Annalectuals have a great work/life balance and a positive attitude to well-being. As part of this we have a flexible and hybrid working model as a core part of how we operate.




We believe flexible & hybrid working can increases individual motivation, improves performance and productivity, and reduces stress as well as helping manage wellbeing generally. We will work with you to implement the best flexible working solution for you without compromising team performance and client delivery.




DIVERSITY

At Annalect, we are focused on equality and believe deeply in diversity & inclusion of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different.




We welcome remarkable people from a broad range of backgrounds who bring their diverse attitudes, opinions, and beliefs into a culture where you are treated with respect and can be comfortable at work just being you. Embracing our differences results in a stimulating and inspiring environment will lead to everyone viewing the world, our work and each other with fresh eyes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About 173




We are a modern analytics agency that helps companies of all stages unlock growth potentials with data. We help clients establish their analytics function or transfer to modern analytics technologies and provide guidance on how to gain maximum value from data. Our founding team previously built and scaled analytics at Bumble, a unicorn dating app.




Our three key DNAs are Speed, Agility and Best Practices. We achieve this by working closely with founders and their core teams, continuously testing new tools and adding features on SAYN (our own open source framework), and have loads of fun doing it!




We are looking for a highly energetic Data Analyst that is, like the rest of us, a perfect blend of business focus and technical expertise, powered by a growth mindset. You will work on an exciting range of projects, try out a variety of tools, and have a direct impact on our clients’ growth.




What You Will Do

This is a great opportunity for anyone keen to build a broad knowledge of analytics and its immediate impact on growth. You will be working with some of the most inspirational and energetic teams on a wide range of projects. Please see below a list of the tasks that will be expected on the role:




Advise clients on the most optimal ways to leverage their data and impact growth.
Collaborate with the rest of the team in order to ensure smooth delivery of projects.
Design and implement data models in order to ensure quick and efficient data manipulation.
Implement data testing in order to ensure high integrity of the data pipelines.
Setup automated extraction pipelines or write custom extractors and productionise them with the support of our data engineering team.
Collaborate with the data engineering team during the deployment and maintenance of data architectures.
Deliver automated dashboards using various visualisation tools.
Ad-hoc analyses on a wide range of topics in order to provide actionable insights for our clients.
Develop data science models including but not limited to LTV and retention prediction, user segmentation and growth forecasting.




Don’t worry if some of the above looks unfamiliar yet. You will be supported by some of the sharpest minds in analytics. If you are confident in 50% of them, we will help you grow into the other 50%!




Who You Are

You are excited at the prospect of working in a fast-paced environment and are keen to learn new technologies. Below is the set of skills we are looking for. Although we will expect you to be able to contribute from day 1, don’t worry if you are missing some, our team will mentor and help you get there!




Experience & Education:

1-2 years experience in an analytics role.
A degree / master’s level education, ideally within a quantitative discipline, e.g. Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Economics, etc.




Strategic Skills:

Business-focused and ability to produce actionable insights.
Organised, collaborative and ability to deliver projects in a timely fashion.
Effective communication skills, both written and oral.
Technical Skills:
Good SQL skills.
Knowledge in another programming language such as Python or R or a keen desire to develop programming skills.
Good statistical understanding.




Other Skills:

Strong ability and desire to learn.
Fluency in any of the European languages is a plus.




Why Work With Us

A focused yet friendly and fun working environment. We organise monthly drinks with the whole team.
Constant learning opportunities on the job while being supported by top-tier talents in the industry.
Working with and having a direct impact on the growth of some of the most innovative startups of our day.
Hybrid work setup. We all gather 2 days per month in our office in central London, remaining days are done either remotely or in our office depending on your preference.
Competitive salary.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Cititec has partnered exclusively with the UK's Top Global Market Leaders who are looking for a Data Analyst on a MINIMUM 6-month contract.




Key Responsibilities:




Lead initiatives to engage with the business units across the whole company to collect and consolidate business-related data requirements
Analyze and evaluate the current business processes and identify areas of improvement with the help of data
Work collaboratively with data stewards, data engineers, and BI/Reporting Leads for fulfilling business requirements ranging from data science, AI, ML, data quality, data management, business intelligence and reporting.




Key Skills Needed:




Strong SQL experience
Power BI is preferred but any other relevant technology will be considered
Experience in data storytelling, using data to help improve the business by communicating with various different business units.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Yakuto, one of Miniclip's most successful brands, are excited to be hiring for a new Junior Data Analyst to work out of our fantastic London studio!




This is an exciting challenge for an ambitious industry professional looking to support the growth of our studio’s data and insight culture. As a data analyst, you’ll leverage game data to offer insight and recommendations on how we drive player engagement and keep improving performance. We expect you to be a major contributor to the growth strategy of our games.




Our ideal candidate is someone who can influence business decisions through data-driven recommendations. You consider yourself to be passionate about games, fun to work with and you take ownership of your responsibilities. You are always driving for innovation and championing good analytical practices and data-led decisions




What will you be doing for Yakuto @ Miniclip?




Your Primary Responsibilities Will Include




Conducting analyses on all aspects of the game’s lifecycle to support decision making.
Building and maintain dashboards with the key indicators of the game’s health and performance.
Analysing A/B tests and provide recommendations on how to improve performance
Gathering insights on player behaviour.
Supporting maintenance of the data-chain and data sources and assure their reliability.
Being a data ambassador, promoting a data-driven culture.
Drive forward Analytics and Data Science processes and business adoption




What are we looking for?




2+ years of experience on a Data Science or Analytics role (if it's in the mobile industry, even better!).
Proficient in a domain specific language such as R or Python.
Capability to write complex SQL queries.
Very good data visualisation skills. Familiarity with a dashboarding tool like Tableau or Domo is a plus.
Good statistical knowledge, preferably with hands-on experience in hypothesis testing and time series analysis.
Working understanding of ETL processes and how to leverage data from different sources.
Ability to communicate complex concepts and analysis to business users across all levels of the organization.
Excellent communication skills




About Yakuto @ Miniclip




Part of the Miniclip group, Yakuto is based in Central London walking distance from several main line and underground stations, in an open plan and airy studio.




In the studio, you will find a relaxed and easy-going environment and have access to free drinks, fruit, games consoles and pool table. As part of Yakuto’s ‘COVID Secure’ measures, the office has since reopened with increased distancing between desks, daily professional cleaning and other measures to ensure team safety. The working week operates as follows Monday, Wednesday in the office with flexible hours to help avoid peak-time travel; Tuesday and Thursday are home working days intended to be distraction free to focus on problem solving. http//www.yaku.to/about
Show more Show less
