Job Description


Yakuto, one of Miniclip's most successful brands, are excited to be hiring for a new Junior Data Analyst to work out of our fantastic London studio!


This is an exciting challenge for an ambitious industry professional looking to support the growth of our studio’s data and insight culture. As a data analyst, you’ll leverage game data to offer insight and recommendations on how we drive player engagement and keep improving performance. We expect you to be a major contributor to the growth strategy of our games.


Our ideal candidate is someone who can influence business decisions through data-driven recommendations. You consider yourself to be passionate about games, fun to work with and you take ownership of your responsibilities. You are always driving for innovation and championing good analytical practices and data-led decisions


What will you be doing for Yakuto @ Miniclip?


Your Primary Responsibilities Will Include


  • Conducting analyses on all aspects of the game’s lifecycle to support decision making.
  • Building and maintain dashboards with the key indicators of the game’s health and performance.
  • Analysing A/B tests and provide recommendations on how to improve performance
  • Gathering insights on player behaviour.

  • Capability to write complex SQL queries.
  • Very good data visualisation skills. Familiarity with a dashboarding tool like Tableau or Domo is a plus.
  • Good statistical knowledge, preferably with hands-on experience in hypothesis testing and time series analysis.
  • Working understanding of ETL processes and how to leverage data from different sources.
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts and analysis to business users across all levels of the organization.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: London - SW1V 2QX, Glasgow -G2 8JX, Durham -DH1 1SL, Lytham St Annes -FY8 4TS

Salary: c£40,500 per annum (Outside London) c£43,750 per annum (London)

Our client is one of the largest savings organisations in the UK with 25 million customers and more than £202 billion invested. They are both a government department and an Executive Agency of the Chancellor of the Exchequer. Our origins can be traced back over 150 years to 1861.

Job Summary

As an expert on the organisation's customer and product data and how it can be analysed and modelled, to produce analysis and reporting which can be used to provide stakeholders with the insight and information they need.

To support the business achieve its objectives through the production and delivery of information, analysis and insight relating to customers and their behaviours and interactions.

Essential Experience, Technical Knowledge And Skills

Substantial experience of business to consumer relational database analysis, report building and data mining
Substantial experience in undertaking analysis and data mining with a tool/language such as R or SAS
In depth knowledge and practical experience of producing dashboards and analysis with Tableau or another data visualisation tool
Ability to interpret data and analysis that has been produced, summarise findings and convert into easily consumable insights for non-data literate stakeholders
A good understanding of predictive modelling, segmentation and other statistical analysis
Advanced knowledge of Excel and good working knowledge of PowerPoint

Behaviours

You'll be assessed against these behaviours during the selection process:

Communicating and Influencing
Delivering at Pace
Managing a Quality Service
Changing and Improving

Technical Skills

You'll be assessed against these behaviours during the selection process:

Communicating and Influencing
Delivering at Pace
Managing a Quality Service
Changing and Improving

Benefits

A small company with a big reach, the organisation offer a range of benefits to include flexible working, great opportunities for development and a generous pension scheme. They care for colleagues, respect one another, invest in their people and manage talent effectively.

Some Of The Benefits Include

Learning and development tailored to your role
An environment with flexible hybrid working options
9 day fortnight scheme
A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
A Civil Service pension with an average employer contribution of 27%
Generous annual leave starting at 25 days, increasing to 30 days
Performance related variable pay bonus
Enhanced Maternity, paternity, adoption and shared parental leave.

To Apply

If you feel you are a suitable candidate and would like to work for this reputable organisation, then please click apply to be redirected to their website where you can complete your application.

Title: Research and Data Analyst - Home (Remote)
Description:
Company Description

Forbes Advisor is a new initiative for consumers under the Forbes Marketplace umbrella that provides journalist- and expert-written insights, news and reviews on all things personal finance.

We’re dedicated to helping turn aspirations into reality. We do this by providing consumers with the knowledge and research they need to make informed financial decisions they can feel confident in, so they can get back to doing the things they care about most.

Job Description

We are seeking a Home Data Analyst to join our team and assist our editorial team in creating top-quality content. In this role, you will provide competitive analysis on the market and ensure the quality and accuracy of data collection and analysis for home improvement products and services. Your research and analysis will be a key component of making trustworthy, relevant assessments of products and services, and will help thousands of homeowners make informed decisions about the products and services they use.

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting opportunity similar to those found at a start-up, with the benefits of a seasoned and successful company, then this may be the role for you.

Responsibilities:

Review editorial data requests for feasibility, usability, and scalability
Leverage a team of freelancers to collect product and service data, with a focus on home products
Perform analysis on collected data to identify top-quality home products and services
Develop and implement processes for quality control
Collaborate with peers to introduce and develop new techniques and processes for efficient data collection
Collaborate with the editorial team to ensure deadlines and goals are met
Review editorial content resulting from work product for accuracy and completeness


About You:

Highly organized, with strong attention to detail and critical thinking abilities
Comfortable working in G-Suite, with an emphasis on Google Sheets
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize projects accordingly
Previous experience in a quality role is preferred
Comfortable managing your own projects and deliverables


Qualifications:

Degree in a relevant field, such as business or computer science, or equivalent training and experience
Proficiency in using Google Sheets for data analysis and manipulation
Proven experience in software testing, as well as proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation are desirable


Benefits:

We competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, unlimited PTO, disability coverage, employee assistance program, and a paid parental leave program.


Additional Information

Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're searching for an exceptional Data Analyst to join a highly successful UK consumer lending business with a state-of-the-art technology platform with embedded modelling and analytic capabilities.




The company




The company launched in 2014 and has booked over 250k UK consumers by leveraging technology and employing a team of the very best engineers, analysts, and commercial leaders in the industry. Our second lending business launched in the summer of 2022 and look to dominate our market segment and expand our banking partners.




Across all companies, the firm represents a combined 100+ team in full scale-up mode and is seeking exceptional engineering and analytic talent to help take our platform and lending capabilities to the next level.




Responsibilities




We are looking for someone who can help us in delivering our core mission to lend at volume, yet responsibly, across our lending companies.

The role would be broad and diverse in scope, with flexibility to tailor it around the right

candidate. This is a unique opportunity, allowing the individual to have exposure to many

other areas of the business including Compliance, Operations and 3 rd party data suppliers.




Responsibilities include:

Help establishing our lending entities as recognised, high-tech responsible lending champions
Exploring innovative solutions and products, including Open Banking/Open Finance
Deriving key responsible lending insights and articulating those insights to key stakeholders, including the Executive Committee and 3 rd party partners
Identifying and executing on regulatory, business, customer and market feedback.
Providing detailed analysis and MI to allow monitoring of key customer profile metrics




Requirements



Top-class degree with a quantitative component
At least 1-2 years as a credit risk analyst (details below) in the UK consumer lending space.
Demonstrable hands-on analyst-level experience in some of the following: Origination credit risk for unsecured consumer fixed term credit, e.g. personal loans, point of sale finance, BNPL
Origination/ongoing credit risk for consumer revolving credit, such as credit cards
UK visa sponsorship can be considered for exceptional international talent




Benefits




An attractive package based on your skills and experience
A stimulating and international working environment with big challenges to be met every day
The opportunity to showcase your skills, to shine, grow and develop
Annual bonus, based on individual and company performance
Contributory pension scheme
Health & dental insurance, employee discounts, cycle-to-work scheme etc.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Description

We are looking to expand our Analytics team with a data analyst to help create data-driven internal solutions for the Illuvium DAO. This involves combining data sources from domains such as blockchain, our games and marketing channels to lead to insights benefitting the DAO.




About Illuvium

Illuvium Labs is an independent game development studio based in Sydney, Australia. We develop blockchain based games for the Illuvium DAO. We have developed a strong culture of independence with our team, preferring candidates who can articulate their own vision and goals. We operate almost entirely remotely so each team member designs their own hours and work schedule. In the end all that matters is the delivered product. We hire based on people’s abilities to adapt and change quickly, valuing underlying core abilities above specific skill sets.




Responsibilities

Proactively assist game designers, marketeers and developers in solving problems with data
Use and monitor our artificial intelligence agents to help tune and improve our games
Create insightful and clean dashboards to help the different compartments within Illuvium do what they do best
Come up with new and creative insights using data and statistics to improve our products
Deal with data-related ad hoc requests from the broader Illuvium team




Skills and Qualifications

Have an intuition for solving problems with data
Have a deep understanding of statistics
High proficiency with Python
The ability to both work independently while proactively engaging with the Analytics team
Experience visualizing and explaining data-driven solutions to internal stakeholders
An interest in applying data analysis to the intersection of blockchain and gaming




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with data analysis on gaming, blockchain or marketing is a big plus
Understanding of both SQL and noSQL-based databases
Experience using AWS




Location

All of our jobs are 100% remote and we are looking to find the best talent globally!

Title: Data Analyst - SQL
Description:
Location : Uxbridge with flexibility to work from home

Our wonderful gaff is located in Uxbridge, in leafy West London. But if commuting to that part of the country isn't warming your cockles - please don't be put off from applying for this role.

The world has changed - particularly when it comes to ways of working. Most of our roles can be on a work from home basis if needed, but we'll ferry you in a few times a year from wherever you are in the UK for team or company days, or our famous giffgaff summer and Christmas celebrations.




About the role




This role will mainly be working with our Commerce team, working on both sales and retention projects. You’ll also be working closely with our Optimisation Team on A/B tests.

As an Analyst, you’ll be looking at media activities and helping our Commerce team understand what’s working well and where we can improve our marketing performance. You’ll also be digging into overall sales data and looking deeper into the trends.




Using SQL Server and Snowflake, you’ll be analysing the data, and then using your communication skills to cut through the jargon and deliver clear and easy to understand insights. You'll have a wide array of projects, and you'll take an active role in business decisions.

This role reports into the Commercial Analytics Manager and is within the Finance directorate.




Key Responsibilities

Use SQL to analyse data from SQL Server and Snowflake, producing actionable insights.
Create reports and dashboards using Excel, PowerPoint, Google Slides and Tableau.
Form relationships with the Commerce team and get to know what they need to do their jobs best.
Deliver guidance for important business decisions relating to both sales and retention.
Present insights back regularly in meetings with stakeholders and senior members of staff.



What We Need from You:

Essential Skills:

Must have at least a basic understanding of SQL (any variety of SQL is fine).
Ability to write queries that contain joins is desirable.
Must have basic knowledge of Excel and common functions like SUM and IF.
Ability to use Pivot Tables desirable.
Great numerical and communication skills

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job details




Work Settings Disability confident Job type Full-time Permanent




Benefits




Pulled from the full job description Company pension Cycle to work scheme Employee discount Gym membership Paid volunteer time




Full Job Description




Overview: Barnett Waddingham is proud to be a leading independent UK consultancy at the forefront of risk, pensions, investment and insurance. Each individual delivers on our shared values and our commitment to ensuring the highest levels of trust, integrity and quality. We aim to continue our growth by recruiting talented and committed individuals that have the desire to learn and develop. We strive to employ staff who share our values and can bring special skills – enhancing the service that we provide to our clients. Our Longevity team undertakes assignments for life and health insurers, both in the UK and internationally, and also for pension schemes. Ongoing clients include the Continuous Mortality Investigation (CMI), part of the Institute and Faculty of Actuaries, and J P Morgan. Our work often involves analysis of individual data portfolios and population data, to help clients understand future longevity experience and its implications. The Longevity team is part of the Insurance and Longevity Consulting (ILC) business area, which collectively provides consultancy services under both long-term support contracts and on standalone projects to a range of insurance and non-insurance clients. The ILC Team is predominantly based in London and has around 45 staff. We pride ourselves on being a friendly and inclusive firm, which maintains its core values of Principled, Quality, Partnership and Respect. We have a supportive structure in place to help you manage your work/life balance. As part of the longevity team you will be working on the following tasks:




Undertaking analyses of data portfolios for both life and health insurers, both in the UK and internationally, as well as for pension schemes, to understand current and recent mortality (or morbidity) experience.
Analysing individual data portfolios and population data, to understand future longevity experience and its implications.
Peforming and summarising calculations, model runs and data analysis.
Developing models and processes under guidance of more senior team members to improve efficiency.
Assisting with drafting client communications and deliverables, including emails, papers and presentations.
Who are we looking for? The individual we are seeking will need a minimum of B in A-Level of Maths and have an interest in developing their skills in Microsoft Excel, R, Tableau and other software, through training in the role, and learning to use and maintain analysis systems What's in it for you?: Core benefits paid for by BW:




Competitive discretionary annual bonus
Life assurance
Group income protection
Private medical cover
25 days holiday per year (up to 30 days with holiday trading)
A generous pension scheme where we contribute 8% of your salary from day one of your employment and you contribute 1% as a minimum
Employee Assistance Programme to support you and your family through any concerns or challenges you may experience
Fresh fruit, hot and cold drinks provided free of charge in all of our offices
Sports Allowance - we pay 50% (up to £50) of your monthly gym membership or sports costs
A comprehensive range of voluntary benefits to suit your life stage and lifestyle including:




Tech scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Dental cover
Healthcare cash plan
Health assessments
Critical illness cover
Extension of private medical cover or life assurance to family members
Discounted gym membership options
Travel insurance
Broad range of discounts at hundreds of retailers including supermarkets, fitness centres, travel and leisure companies
Giving Something Back:




1 paid volunteering day per year as a commitment to our Corporate Social Investment
Support your favourite charity with the "Give as You Earn" option
Match-funding for individuals raising money for a recognised charity
Our corporate social investment programme is an integral part of what we do and is focused on ensuring that our overall impact is a positive one. We recognise that we have an impact that goes beyond our core activities.
Values: our values are PRINCIPLED, RESPECT, QUALITY AND PARTNERSHIP - they are important to us and we want them to be important to you as well. Wellbeing: employee wellbeing has always been important to us and our approach is to create an environment where individuals will be engaged at work, successful in what they do and able to achieve their full potential, benefiting both their self and the business. BW offer a great range of employee benefits as we believe it's important individuals are supported in making choices which are flexible enough to meet their needs and help support their wellness. Diversity: we are committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce where people from all backgrounds, beliefs and perspectives can thrive, feel welcome and develop to their full potential. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all and welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates, regardless of their race, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, disability, religion/belief, age, pregnancy and maternity, and marriage and civil partnerships. Our recruitment processes are designed to be fair and consistent and enable candidates to compete on a level playing field. We recognise that diversity today means more than race and gender. This is why we created an environment where a variety of different voices are encouraged and heard through our employee network groups. The groups work together to build an inclusive and diverse place for us all to work. We have attained the Disability Confident Committed status and are actively working towards the next level, Disability Confident Employer. Your progression: we offer career progression opportunities and a focus on training and professional development to provide you with the tools and skills to thrive. We also offer study support for relevant professional or skills qualifications. Other activities: we have clubs, sporting events, social, cultural and belief groups across our offices if you’d like to join in and meet like-minded people. Accessibility




Please visit AbilityNet should you benefit from advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability. Should you require information in a different format, have other accessibility or reasonable adjustment requirements or if you find any problems not listed on this page, please contact careers@barnett-waddingham.co.uk or call us on 0333 11 11 222.Postal applications should be sent to: Talent Acquisition, Barnett Waddingham, St James's House, St James Square, Cheltenham, Gloucestershire, GL50 3PR Not quite the right opportunity for you this time? Follow Barnett Waddingham on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/barnett-waddingham-llp in order to receive updates and posts about future opportunities, webinars and industry event invites, industry news and insights, exposure to new connections, BW services and new content.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | London (Hybrid) | NPO | upto £55k




Data Analyst required for 12 months to support a non-profit organisation with their ongoing Data Transformation project.




This is a fantastic chance to help shape the way the organisation uses it data to make good decisions, that will help the people they support. This person will be conducting Business Analysis work as well as Data Analytics. This person will need strong communications skills and the desire to interact with the business to understand their data needs.




Role: Data Analyst




Salary: £49,000 - £55,000 - plus a fantastic benefits package




Location: London – once a week into the office




Sector: NPO




The essential skills for this role are:




Strong background in data led projects
Knowledge of; data mining, data migration & data cleansing
Ability to help shape data governance best practice
Requirements gathering exercises
Ability to work collaboratively with Data Engineers
Experience creating technical specifications




The role will work as part of a wider business analysis function, but predominantly work in the Data function whereby projects including; data cleansing, data design, data governance & data migration projects are taking place. This person will work on requirements gathering exercises, running workshops to see how the business currently uses it data.




The interview will take place on MS Teams. If this position is of interest, please apply with a copy of your up-to-date CV for review.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Feeld, we are creating a world where where everyone is more intimately connected to each other and themselves. We are building an inclusive, human-centred product and are looking for a Data Analyst to become part our remote team and our mission to elevate the human experience of sexuality and relationships.

You will be responsible for supporting the growth team in driving user acquisition, retention and revenue growth for our platform.

To be right for this role, you should have experience with data analysis and be able to work with a variety of stakeholders to identify and support growth opportunities.




What you will do:

Support the growth team with experiment design and analysis/uplift modeling.
Track and analyze key metrics such as installs, active users and retention
Identify patterns between metrics (leading /lagging indicators) and assess the impact of input-to-output metrics.
Help the growth team prioritize growth initiatives and optimize overall strategy
Measure user lifetime value and build LTV predictive models
Predict customer churn propensity and support the CRM team in designing effective churn prevention campaigns by analyzing the user pain points
Score users based on their contribution to the growth and sustainability of Feeld’s micro-networks




About you:

Very good theoretical and applied knowledge of statistical methods like linear/logistic regression, hypothesis testing, and decision trees/random forests.
Familiarity with causal inference.
Excellent communication, presentation and storytelling skills.
Strong experience with SQL, Python, Excel and data visualization tools (we use Holistics but if you’ve used Looker, Power BI or similar that’s great!).
2+ years of experience working with data or growth/marketing analytics teams.
Commercially savvy, with an eye for marketing spend optimization opportunities and an understanding of the true ROI of marketing spend in both the short- and long-term.




Bonus points:

Experience in the dating industry is a plus.
Experience in a marketplace consumer app is a plus.




About us:

Feeld is an independent, experimental and fully remote organisation reshaping the dialogue on dating and sexuality. The company was founded in 2014 and has evolved since to become the open, distributed structure it is now. We have a naturally agile and fluid culture. The whole team is fully remote, which means you work where and when helps you perform at your best. We regard autonomy highly and treat our organisation as a product – we iterate, improve and test things internally to see what works best for everyone.




Our culture:

We believe in creating a safe work environment through humanity, fluidity, safety, transparency and progressiveness. When hiring, we look for culture add rather than culture fit.

Because we are a fully remote team, it’s especially important that we create an environment where our colleagues feel included and connected as humans.




Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging at Feeld:

Feeld promotes open-mindedness, inclusion, diversity and kindness, both in the world and among our own workforce.

We encourage and welcome applications from people with a history of marginalisation, whether because of race, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability (seen or unseen) or any confluence of intersectional identities.

Our goal is a barrier-free application process and working environment. If you require further details or assistance or have any questions about this process, please let us know at hr@feeld.co.




Compensation and perks:

We are conscious of how our work and decisions impact other humans and the environment. We design our product and organisation with consideration for the wellbeing and happiness of our members and colleagues. We believe in technology and working environments that enable people to live a meaningful, fulfilled life.

Therefore, we offer our staff:

Flexible working hours
Unlimited paid time off
A fully remote working situation
Annual expense budget
GBP £3k equipment and home office budget
Learning & development budget
On demand therapy sessions and mental health support via Spill
Company retreats




Feeld’s way of working is designed to proactively prevent burnout and an “always on” culture.

One of our Core Values is: Transparent. We strive for complete openness of information within the organisation and for enabling honesty on our platform. Internally, we keep decision-making transparent to keep each other accountable and make sure all voices are heard.




That is why we offer:

Open and transparent salaries
At Feeld we believe all humans deserve to make a competitive wage. That's why we offer a Baseline Freedom Salary of $80,000 or £60,000 per year.
The base salary for this role is determined by Level and Step, as well as geographic location, but we estimate that this role can earn between £70,000, - £90,000 GBP based on the requirements listed in this job description.




Our interview process:

Your first conversation with Feeld will be a screening call with our recruiter, where you’ll be able to ask - and receive answers - regarding any general questions you have and to confirm the role is a fit for what you’re seeking.
Your second conversation will connect you directly with the hiring manager for the role you’re applying to. Here, you’ll have a chance to ask more questions about the work you’ll be doing. This conversation will also focus on your past work experiences.
The next step for most of our roles is a candidate challenge. This is an evaluation of the skills relevant to be successful in this role and generally takes about an hour to complete.
Your third conversation allows you the opportunity to meet the team members you might be working with on a daily basis. Here, you’ll be able to ask questions about team processes, workflow, and the employee experience at Feeld.
We generally make an offer within 2 weeks of our final call, and offer a flexible start date that can begin as early as the next Monday after you sign our offer documentation.
Of note: all of our interviews are conducted remotely, and our interviewers will work with you to find an agreeable interview time based on mutual availability.




We understand we're asking you to invest your time and best efforts in our process, and are appreciative of getting the chance to better know who you are as a person and candidate. In return, we’re committed to offering transparent communication and prompt feedback as you navigate this application with us.

To find out more about Feeld, download our app (available on iOS and Android).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

We’ve grown at an incredibly fast pace since our launch in 2017. We’re the trusted student-recruitment partner to 600 higher ed institutions in 35 countries worldwide. Including the University of Cambridge, Kings College London, Boston University, University of Southern California, NYU Global Services, HEC Paris, and Erasmus.




We’ve raised over $33M from top-tier investors, and we’re on course to achieve our mission of empowering 10 million students to make the right choices in their higher ed journey.




Here’s where you come in

As our very first Data Analyst in the Analytics team, you will be embedded within the product organisation and integrated into all steps of product development. From identifying the next big opportunity, generating and testing hypotheses, to measuring success, and deciding what to do next, based on the learnings we have. This is a highly impactful role where you’ll have the opportunity to share your technical expertise by coaching others in SQL.




What you’ll be doing

Analytics

Conduct quantitative analysis, make recommendations and communicate results in a clear way to stakeholders across the whole business.
Understand user behaviours and long-term trends to inform our business & product strategy.
Unearth insights and identify opportunity areas to move key metrics, turning data into actionable insights.
Run models to help understand the potential impact of changes to the product(s).
Build Dashboards for stakeholders to monitor key metrics.
Identify and own requirements for tracking and reporting within new product features, empowering the team to effortlessly track their releases.




Product Leadership

Use data to make recommendations that define the product roadmap and help product teams decide what to build next.
Be comfortable making recommendations and being a key part of the ideation process!
Define and own KPIs around product success and measure progress on these KPIs.
Helping inform and shape our product and company OKRs to ensure we’re driving the desired outcomes.
Present insights and opportunities to your team in a clear manner to help them design solutions that properly address the user need.
Design and conduct experiments to validate hypotheses.
Foster an experimentation culture across our product teams, helping empower the entire team to improve their data maturity.




This might be for you if

You have advanced capabilities in SQL (essential), and it’s a plus if you have experience in Python and/or R.
You have proficiency with data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau).
You’ve worked as a data or a product analyst/scientist in a tech company collaborating with product managers, designers and engineers.
You have experience gleening insights from data that lives in software products.
Solid understanding of statistics and how that applies to measurements/tests.
Strong analytical skills combined with a great deal of business sense, the ability to translate numbers into actions and communicate this clearly to business stakeholders.
Reasonable product sense and natural user-centric thinking.
You have experience in conducting A/B experiments at scale and establishing product analytics tooling.
Comfortable presenting to a range of audiences including peers and stakeholders.




We know that some people only apply to jobs if they see themselves ticking every box. We believe we’re more than boxes to tick. If you don't meet all the requirements but think you might still be right for the role or others, please apply anyway. We're always keen to speak to people who connect with our mission and values.




About our team

The Analytics team is a critical business partner to the entire organisation. We work across departments to accelerate growth and enable actionable insights from data to drive decisions. We have an insatiable curiosity to get under the skin of the business and drive consistent improvements through the use of data. We execute with efficiency and speed, being ever mindful of the requirements of a scaling global organisation.




Perks and benefits

Salary of £60,000 - £70,000 per annum plus stock options.
Highly flexible work culture. Hybrid, we spend 1-3 days a week in the London office.
25 days of annual leave plus national holiday and 4 additional days for the Christmas break.
Family-friendly policy. Enhanced maternity, paternity and adoption leave.
Latest MacBook or PC. Monitor for your home is also provided.
Private healthcare is provided by Bupa.
Mental health support is provided by Spill.
Life insurance.




We rock! It’s our people that make us successful. We have 100 employees globally and a fantastic culture. But don’t take our word for it - we’re proud to be named by Built In as one of the best mid-sized companies to work for in the US, Mogul awarded us as a top 100 workplaces for benefits, and we won an award with Flexa as one of the most flexible EdTech & Education companies.




Are you ready to become a buddy? Apply now.




Great! Please send a CV and showcase your motivations. We encourage you to send us ​​a link to your GitHub or Stack Overflow, flaunt your skills!




Not quite ready to apply or have some questions? Then you can get in touch with the talent team at becomeabuddy@unibuddy.com

  • Foster an experimentation culture across our product teams, helping empower the entire team to improve their data maturity.


This might be for you if

  • You have advanced capabilities in SQL (essential), and it’s a plus if you have experience in Python and/or R.
  • You have proficiency with data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau).
  • You’ve worked as a data or a product analyst/scientist in a tech company collaborating with product managers, designers and engineers.
  • You have experience gleening insights from data that lives in software products.
  • Solid understanding of statistics and how that applies to measurements/tests.
  • Strong analytical skills combined with a great deal of business sense, the ability to translate numbers into actions and communicate this clearly to business stakeholders.
  • Reasonable product sense and natural user-centric thinking.
  • You have experience in conducting A/B experiments at scale and establishing product analytics tooling.
  • Comfortable presenting to a range of audiences including peers and stakeholders.


We know that some people only apply to jobs if they see themselves ticking every box. We believe we’re more than boxes to tick. If you don't meet all the requirements but think you might still be right for the role or others, please apply anyway. We're always keen to speak to people who connect with our mission and values.


About our team

The Analytics team is a critical business partner to the entire organisation. We work across departments to accelerate growth and enable actionable insights from data to drive decisions. We have an insatiable curiosity to get under the skin of the business and drive consistent improvements through the use of data. We execute with efficiency and speed, being ever mindful of the requirements of a scaling global organisation.


Perks and benefits

  • Salary of £60,000 - £70,000 per annum plus stock options.
  • Highly flexible work culture. Hybrid, we spend 1-3 days a week in the London office.
  • 25 days of annual leave plus national holiday and 4 additional days for the Christmas break.
  • Family-friendly policy. Enhanced maternity, paternity and adoption leave.
  • Latest MacBook or PC. Monitor for your home is also provided.
  • Private healthcare is provided by Bupa.
  • Mental health support is provided by Spill.
  • Life insurance.


We rock! It’s our people that make us successful. We have 100 employees globally and a fantastic culture. But don’t take our word for it - we’re proud to be named by Built In as one of the best mid-sized companies to work for in the US, Mogul awarded us as a top 100 workplaces for benefits, and we won an award with Flexa as one of the most flexible EdTech & Education companies.


Are you ready to become a buddy? Apply now.


Great! Please send a CV and showcase your motivations. We encourage you to send us ​​a link to your GitHub or Stack Overflow, flaunt your skills!


Not quite ready to apply or have some questions? Then you can get in touch with the talent team at becomeabuddy@unibuddy.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst– Analytics/Statistics

Kantar Public, Population Studies Team

London, Westminster




Employing around 700 people globally, Kantar Public delivers insight and strategy to provide better outcomes for citizens and public sector organisations around the world. In the UK, we are one of the top tier social research agencies, and have more than 120 specialist researchers working together to provide knowledge, evidence and insight that helps Government, the private sector and the Third Sector plan and care for society. We undertake a range of work, including the biggest of big public surveys; bespoke quant and qual insight pieces to support Government policy; large-scale deliberative research; attitude tracking and polling; behavioural insight and interventions design; and communications development and evaluation.




Kantar Public’s Population Studies team comprises c.35 researchers working on a range of official and national statistics, longitudinal research, and ad hoc research projects on topics such as crime, civil society, science, energy, transport and culture.




Our team conducts many diverse studies for Government and public sector clients such as the Office for National Statistics, the Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport, Transport for London, and the Department for Education. Our work includes conducting studies which feed into vital national statistics such as the latest crime figures and the Consumer Prices Index. We also work for academic clients such as the Institute of Social and Economic Research at Essex University and the Centre for Longitudinal Studies at UCL, running large-scale longitudinal studies, including Understanding Society, the largest longitudinal household panel of its kind in the world.




As a Data Analyst in Data Analytics/Statistics, you will work across several different project teams to understand and scope the potential for linking survey data to other data sources, such as open-source data and government administrative datasets, to add value and context to the survey data.




You will help to move our data offer forward through innovation by making better use of data analytics, advanced statistical analysis and data visualisation. The role also involves identifying opportunities for automation around data processing, quality assurance and analytics and collaborating with other statistics and data experts within Kantar Public. You will be a recognised point of expertise within the team when it comes to data analytics.




The Role




Although focused on data you will be an integral part of the project team and so having a sound understanding of the survey research process and a genuine interest in social and public policy is important.

The role is varied and so no two days are likely to be the same, but responsibilities will include:




Contributing to the development of our statistical analysis, data analytics and data visualisation offer and identify opportunities for this.
Collaborating with the other data teams within Kantar Public to help the development of the data analytics capability and offer.
Identifying opportunities to link and utilise other data sources with survey data to add context and depth to analytical findings.
Explore new ways of visualising data and analysis using visualisation tools such as Power BI.
Have a working knowledge and experience of statistical and analytical methods and techniques.
Have an excellent working knowledge of R and/or Python and a good working knowledge of SPSS, including being able to write SPSS syntax and carry out SPSS analysis. Knowledge and experience of using Power BI and cloud environments such as Microsoft Azure would also be useful.
Assisting in the end-to-end quality assurance of data outputs when needed.
Training, coaching and supervising junior members of the team in data analytics and data visualisation.
Having a good knowledge of current data protection legislation to ensure that all outputs are fully compliant with all GDPR requirements.
Ensuring best practice is followed through maintaining comprehensive documentation and being involved in project reviews to identify and embed learning for future projects.




Who are we looking for?




In addition to possessing the suitable skills and experience to deliver against the above responsibilities, to be successful you’ll also need to:




Have a strong interest in data analytics and data visualisation
Care about quality and getting it right by having a keen eye for detail and taking pride in what you do
Be a great team player who can build effective working relationships while also being happy to work autonomously when required
Have good written and verbal communication skills so you can communicate effectively with a range of stakeholders in a clear, confident and collaborative manner
Be highly organised with the ability to work across multiple projects, prioritise tasks efficiently, and be adaptable in the face of change
Be a positive thinker who is focused on finding solutions and improvements by not being afraid to challenge and question current processes
Be able to work to tight deadlines and work at pace when required while remaining calm under pressure
Take ownership of tasks and work proactively to deliver as promised
Have excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities so you can turn complex requirements into practical delivery plans.




The diversity of our projects will give you a chance to develop both professionally and personally. We appreciate the positive atmosphere of collaboration that we have built, where cooperation, flexibility, and mobility are encouraged, and where you will be asked to follow your interests and the learning opportunities that come with them.




We are committed to flexible working practice.




You will join an international leading company and be surrounded by passionate colleagues in an open and engaging environment, where people feel included, accepted, and are allowed to thrive in a space where their well-being is taken into consideration.




We encourage applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.




We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.




Visit www.kantarpublic.com to find out more about who we are.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role




The primary objective of this role is to support and expand the newly formed Client Intelligence team with analysis, scripting and reporting on a variety of subjects. This includes client/prospect profiling, sales lifecycle, client journey mapping, market/competitor research. This will assist in developing company strategies around growth, client engagement and the wider market landscape.




The role will offer applicants to learn in a fast paced and dynamic environment and to quickly take on more responsibility to further develop skills. The successful applicant will learn the needs of client intelligence team and the wider growth department as well as the procedures, KPIs and models used. With this knowledge and fresh perspective you will be expected to provide insights and process improvements to deliver on the team’s objectives.. Therefore, proactive and ambitious candidates are required.




Successful candidates will have access to a wealth of knowledge from more senior team members and from key stakeholders on other teams in the company. This will include learning about financial markets, modelling techniques, sales/marketing strategies and interaction with senior stakeholders including C-suite and board level.




Responsibilities




Provide insights and intelligence for use across the company to inform direction on business decisions
Create strategies and proposals from the insights generated through data analysis
Ensure accuracy and optimisation of our internal tooling and client intelligence software (including Hubspot and internal databases), particularly with regards to the accuracy of the sales pipeline and customer/prospect information.
Collate, clean and visualise data from several internal tools, and external sources, to produce/present reports for key stakeholders (internal and external)
Build, manage and update new workflows and dashboards to provide insights on clients, prospects, and wider market data
Build statistical tools that analyse TH client/prospect behaviour, trends and requirements
Perform market research on prospective client, competitor and regulatory data to inform new strategies across company




Requirements




Essential Skills/Competencies




1-2 years’ experience in similar role
Proficient in either Python, Excel/VBA, SQL or any object-oriented language
Fast learner and keen for grow opportunities
Outstanding presentation, communication and interpersonal skills
Proactive, resilient and keen to voice suggestions for team/company strategies
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to work under pressure and exercise clear judgement
BSc degree in STEMor another related field (data science would be preferential)
Knowledge of financial markets would be beneficial




Benefits




Why should you apply?




Ambition: Extremely fast-growing company with an uncapped potential, offering every colleague a broad range of experience and plenty of opportunities for internal movement, as well as rapid career progression. Vibrant company culture full of uniquely talented and friendly colleagues with regular social perks to build camaraderie.




Flexibility: 25 days holiday + bank holidays, informal dress code, generous maternity/parental leave policies. We also offer a flexible working policy (up to 2 days a week remote).




Reward: Highly competitive compensation plus annual discretionary bonus and discretionary EMI scheme (company share option scheme).




Support: Annual personal training budget, private healthcare, company pension plan, death in service coverage, cycle to work scheme & tech scheme.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Positions:




1






Band / Grade:




B1






Salary:




£39,000 - £45,690 Per annum






Post Type:




Concurrent






Contract Type:




Permanent






Working Pattern:




Full Time






Leave entitlement:




Starting at 30 days per annum, pro-rata




Pension




Civil Service Pension Scheme






Closing Date:




4th April 2023 at 23:55




Interview Date(s):




Interviews to potentially take place between 12th - 14th April 2023.




House of Commons




The House of Commons is a unique and exciting place to work right at the heart of the UK's thriving democratic system. 




Behind the scenes, the House of Commons Service is made up of more than 3,000 employees who support and facilitate the smooth day-to-day running of the House. They provide professional services to Members of Parliament, their staff, and the wider parliamentary community.




Staff Benefits




In addition to your salary, we offer an attractive range of benefits including:




30 days’ annual leave (increasing to 35 days after first full leave year).
Civil Service pension with an average employer contribution of 27%.
Access to training and development.
Flexible working.
Interest free season ticket loan and bicycle loan.




Introduction




We have an exciting opportunity to join our Business Management Team within the House of Commons. The Business Management Team’s work encompasses a broad set of responsibilities, including the delivery of construction projects, the provision of specialist planning and design support, and the care and development of our internationally significant heritage collections, among others.




Strategic Estates is committed to building a culture in which our people are supported and empowered to give off their best in meeting the needs of the parliamentary community. Our people are our greatest asset and are at the core of our vision.




The Role




As a Data Analyst, you will provide analytical support to Strategic Estates, as well as the Parliamentary Maintenance Services and Customer Experience and Service Delivery teams in delivering a high-class suite of workforce information and performance metrics and analysis, enabling senior leadership to make strategically informed decisions on the performance of teams including the development of leading metrics and organisational service performance.




You will lead and contribute to workforce reporting projects across all teams and will identify opportunities for improvements to business activities and all relevant system processes.




Some of the responsibilities for this role include:




Develop and maintain workforce management information, ad hoc reports and statutory requests to meet the business needs of Managers and facilitate the Business Planning process.
Lead on the production and tracking of key performance indicators as well as identifying and developing new metrics.
Analyse and interpret workforce data to inform and assist senior leadership in their strategy and workforce planning.




Skills And Experience




To be successful in this role you will demonstrate:




Experience of leading on data administration and understanding of data management with proves experience in development expertise of complex reports, combined with advanced Excel skills and a proven ability to handle and analyse large quantities of data.
Proven business analysis experience including process mapping, and requirements definition.
Excellent problem-solving skills in technical and service delivery environments using logic, knowledge and sound processes to analyse information and find solutions.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to quickly gain the confidence of colleagues at all levels and influence a range of stakeholders. The ability to work under pressure and autonomously prioritising work to meet deadlines. Flexible in responding to changing requirements and circumstances. Willing to challenge and persuade where appropriate.
Act as a positive role model and promote the culture of House, maintaining principles of equality, diversity and inclusion at all times.
Experience of project delivery, planning of Workstream tasks/ system improvement projects.




Next Steps




CV & Cover Letter – If you would like to apply for this role, please submit your CV and cover letter with a 500-word limit.




More information on the role and the full criteria can be found in the Job Description.




Interview Stage – You may be asked to complete an Excel Test apart of the interview process.




Please note that most job offers will be made at the minimum of the salary range, other than in exceptional circumstances.




Contact Details




For more information about the role, or for an informal chat, contact Maria Papapaschali (Hiring Manager) - papapaschalim@parliament.uk

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - 12 Month Contract - Outside IR35




Responsibilities




To be involved in the migration of finance and procurement data from client legacy applications to a new d365 solution.
Ensure that target model definitions are document to a sufficient standard.
Ensure that source to target mapping are maintained and agreed with both the system integrator and business data owners.
Ensure that configuration values and any associated mapping tables required are complete and confirmed by the business.
To develop an extract and transform processes against the solution design requirements.
Ensure that all build is formally documented (including job procedures for job execution).
Ensure that data migration trackers are in place to manage both volumes and the overall status of each load cycle.
To work with third party project managers and data loading resources where appropriate.
Complete post load technical data validations prior to the business validation being completed.
Work with and obtain formal business owner sign off both pre and post data load activities




Skills Or Experience




Minimum of two end to end ERP project data migration lifecycles.
Strong technical skills SQL.
Good communication skills.
Data Migration into D365 FSCM.
D365 FSCM data model knowledge.




will.cahill@boss-erp.co.uk

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the job

Overview



Medialab’s proprietary marketing intelligence proposition, Apollo, enables data-driven success through the centralised collection of data, the formation of information as our single source of truth and the exposing of insights for decision making. This is made possible through the capabilities provided by our foundation, Apollo Platform. A dedicated project team is responsible for the population of our platform which entails the strategic designing of data feeds, onboarding of data for our clients and delivery of business intelligence use cases.



 



We are at an exciting stage in our journey and are looking for a proactive self-starter who is passionate about data, detail-oriented and a clear communicator, to join the team and play a significant role in the delivery of our next chapter.



 



Responsibilities



The responsibilities of the role are as follows:



Analysing business requirements through building relationships with stakeholders and communicating effectively and analysing existing systems
Analysing existing and new data sources to understand their purpose, features and limitations
Become an expert in Apollo Platform’s domain model and design high quality data feeds
Onboard data feeds and monitor their success before handing over to our support function
Translate business requirements to technical data transformation requirements for our engineering team - technical contributions welcome
Deliver dashboards on top of our output data model that are fit for purpose
Perform data QA checks and comparisons to ensure data integrity
Communicate with stakeholders to ensure they are aware of progress and have their expectations managed
Ensure that all your work is carried out to a high standard and that your colleagues are aware of the status of tasks

 



Skills & Experience



You will need the following must-have skills:



Data literacy - apt at manipulating data for quick answers. Spreadsheet software (excel/google sheets) is second nature for you
Ability to deliver data visualisations on top of a data model based on a business requirement (e.g. experience with Tableau, PowerBI, Looker or similar)
Ability to extract requirements from stakeholders / analysing existing systems, effectively
Ability to conduct data QA and perform comparisons to ensure data integrity
Ability to pick up new technologies fast
Ability to work at pace in a dynamic environment and manage your time effectively
Ability to work autonomously and be accountable for your commitments
Ability to collaborate effectively with a team

 



The following experience will help you stand out:



Experience with interrogating data via SQL
Experience with the marketing/advertising domain
Experience within a media planning/activation environment
Experience within an agile environment

 



Behaviours



The below behaviours will be important in enabling you to thrive in the role:



Curious - you constantly seek how to do things better - you receive feedback well and look to apply it to your daily work.
Passionate - you care about your craft, you are hungry to learn more and you enjoy a challenge.
Ownership - you take your responsibilities seriously and you make it your mission to deliver - blockers are to be overcome.
Diligence - you know that technology and data are complex and a thorough approach is needed to ensure quality and integrity.

Overview

Medialab’s proprietary marketing intelligence proposition, Apollo, enables data-driven success through the centralised collection of data, the formation of information as our single source of truth and the exposing of insights for decision making. This is made possible through the capabilities provided by our foundation, Apollo Platform. A dedicated project team is responsible for the population of our platform which entails the strategic designing of data feeds, onboarding of data for our clients and delivery of business intelligence use cases.

 

We are at an exciting stage in our journey and are looking for a proactive self-starter who is passionate about data, detail-oriented and a clear communicator, to join the team and play a significant role in the delivery of our next chapter.

 

Responsibilities

The responsibilities of the role are as follows:

  • Analysing business requirements through building relationships with stakeholders and communicating effectively and analysing existing systems
  • Analysing existing and new data sources to understand their purpose, features and limitations
  • Become an expert in Apollo Platform’s domain model and design high quality data feeds
  • Onboard data feeds and monitor their success before handing over to our support function
  • Translate business requirements to technical data transformation requirements for our engineering team - technical contributions welcome
  • Deliver dashboards on top of our output data model that are fit for purpose
  • Perform data QA checks and comparisons to ensure data integrity
  • Communicate with stakeholders to ensure they are aware of progress and have their expectations managed
  • Ensure that all your work is carried out to a high standard and that your colleagues are aware of the status of tasks

 

Skills & Experience

You will need the following must-have skills:

  • Data literacy - apt at manipulating data for quick answers. Spreadsheet software (excel/google sheets) is second nature for you
  • Ability to deliver data visualisations on top of a data model based on a business requirement (e.g. experience with Tableau, PowerBI, Looker or similar)
  • Ability to extract requirements from stakeholders / analysing existing systems, effectively
  • Ability to conduct data QA and perform comparisons to ensure data integrity
  • Ability to pick up new technologies fast
  • Ability to work at pace in a dynamic environment and manage your time effectively
  • Ability to work autonomously and be accountable for your commitments
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with a team

 

The following experience will help you stand out:

  • Experience with interrogating data via SQL
  • Experience with the marketing/advertising domain
  • Experience within a media planning/activation environment
  • Experience within an agile environment

 

Behaviours

The below behaviours will be important in enabling you to thrive in the role:

  • Curious - you constantly seek how to do things better - you receive feedback well and look to apply it to your daily work.
  • Passionate - you care about your craft, you are hungry to learn more and you enjoy a challenge.
  • Ownership - you take your responsibilities seriously and you make it your mission to deliver - blockers are to be overcome.
  • Diligence - you know that technology and data are complex and a thorough approach is needed to ensure quality and integrity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - SaaS - Remote Working




An award-winning software-as-a-service (SaaS) company is looking to hire an ambitious, forward-thinking Data Analyst to join their energetic, committed and passionate team serving customers and extending an exciting market leadership.




You will be responsible for:

Building strong stakeholder relationships to understand business challenges and collaboratively create solutions
Collaborate with product designers and engineers to develop customised client, requirements
Manage, maintain, and create accessible reports to streamline smarter business process
Implement analytics to track insights
Monitor client KPIs via Tableau
Collate client experience, market research, insight, and knowledge and communicate them in a clear, concise and action-orientated manner




Successful candidate requirements:

Experience working in data-focused roles with knowledge of Tableau
Ideally, knowledge of SQL
Resilience and problem-solving skills




Benefits:

Health Cash Plan provided through Health Shield.
Workplace pension

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Supporting the IT team - Please note that candidates will only be considered if they have knowledge/experience of IT security.




To provide administrative support to the Information Security team and, on occasion, to the Technology Services team. You will take the lead role in responding to client information security requests and be the first point of contact for requests into the Information Security team.




Work in partnership with the Information Security Manager to ensure all requests for service are fulfilled in a timely, professional, and coordinated fashion.
Comply with, and promote, company information security policies and procedures through the group.
Set up and maintain systems for the collection and recording of service/project data as required.
Gain a thorough knowledge and understanding of all company systems and share skills and good practice with staff.
Support the Information Security Manager (ISM) in planning, monitoring and reviewing the development of the service in line with the identified priorities, targets and outcomes. Track, collate and create comprehensive and stimulating reports for performance monitoring reviews.
Assist the ISM to monitor expenditure against budgets, and with quarterly and annual returns/audit reports. Oversee regular reviews and submit returns to relevant departments.
Process incoming requests to the Information Security team in consultation with the ISM
Support with the recruitment of staff by liaising with ISM and HR department and providing relevant documents and administrative support to recruiting managers.
Monitor licencing and security controls as required and where necessary place orders etc. Ensure that security controls and other resources are maintained at appropriate levels. Process incoming and outgoing email.
Attend and actively participate in team meetings and other meetings as required by the ISM, ensuring accurate minutes are taken and any requested reports are provided. Carry out electronic filing as required.

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Department overview:

In Game Analytics, we work with some of the best game studios in the world -- responsible for developing some of the most recognisable and ambitious console games and franchises on PlayStation, including Uncharted, The Last of Us, Horizon, God of War, and Gran Turismo.

We provide end-to-end analytics services for PlayStation Studios and use data to help them make their amazing games even better. We seek dedicated people to join us in pushing the boundaries of game analytics for PlayStation.

What you’ll be doing:

Working in our cross-disciplinary team to help game studios use data efficiently to improve games. You’ll work with decision-makers to understand their goals, find opportunities, and guide decisions about features and games across the company. Join us, and help define and build the future of analytics for PlayStation games.

What we are looking for:

Adept at working with people and customer behaviour data to make decisions and improve products.
Fluent in SQL on analytics data warehouses – We use Redshift, but experience with similar ones like Vertica, Netezza, or Postgres are fine.
A validated background in Looker or a similar analytics visualisation tool like Tableau or MicroStrategy.
You can apply data-backed analyses to produce insights that help improve game design.
Superb communication and can get your point across to game designers, producers, programmers, and executives.
A strong interest in a variety of new console games.
Strategic and business-savvy. You know that people don’t always know what they want, or ask for the right. things. You can help them resolve they need, and then make it happen.
A pro with statistics, probability, and quantitative analysis methods.
You’re committed to quality as a top priority.
Experience within AAA games.
A track record of trying and learning new things.
Bonus points for experience in Python, iPython notebooks, R, or machine learning.


Benefits:

Discretionary bonus opportunity
Private Medical Insurance
Dental Scheme
25 days holiday per year
On Site Gym
Subsidised Café
Free soft drinks
On site bar
Access to cycle garage


Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst, London
Description:
Data Analyst, Utility or Telco experience required and consultancy knowledge preferred. Salary in the range of £ 55000 - 60000 + benefits. 3 days a week in the office, 2 days at home. London based (Holborn)

To be considered for this role you will have domain knowledge in Utilities (Water, Energy, etc) or Telco (Credit Risk, VBM, Revenue Assurance, cleansing etc).

Expanding data solutions consultancy, with a strong presence in the Utilities and Telecoms sectors is looking for a client facing Data Analyst to join their team. Working with external clients and senior colleagues you will address core problems and will extract maximum value for the client by looking at and analysing data. You must have domain knowledge in Utilities or Telecoms and will know what a good customer experience and customer journey looks like.

Having previously worked in a Data Analyst role you responsibilities will include -

Analyse data and understand how data analysis can benefit clients.
Draw value from the data and provide feedback.
Presenting to your clients what a good customer experience/ journey looks like and how data can help deliver this.
Work with the team to create dashboards and metrics.

To be considered you will have the following experience -

Data analysis skills.
Good and broad technical skills in relation to data (Excel and SQL)
A proven ability of analysing data and using it to create a business benefit.
Excellent and detailed knowledge of Telecoms or Utilities.
A degree in a numerical subject (Maths, Physics, Economics, etc).

This is an excellent opportunity for an expanding consultancy. You will work on a range of exciting projects and your work will be recognised and rewarded.

The company is based in London with a hybrid working environment (it is likely you will be in the office 3 days a week though at first). Salary is in the range of £ 55000 - 60000 + benefits. If you would like to find out more please send your CV for a full brief or call 07796 177494.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Qlik Data Analyst – London - £40,000-£50,000

Qlik, Qlik Sense, SQL, Consulting, SaaS, Strategy




Opus is thrilled to be working with an exciting major property management company; and they're looking for a Qlik Data Analyst to join their team.




The ideal candidate has:

A strong understanding of Qlik and Qlik Sense
Experience in data analytics.
Great client-facing/stakeholder communication ability.
Eligibility for SC clearance.




The key responsibilities of this role are to deliver analytics, dashboards and visualisations through the use of Qlik Sense to their clients. Understanding stakeholder needs and providing suitable Qlik Sense solutions.
All-round delivery of Qlik Sense applications, especially around data modelling and visualisation.




They are interviewing currently, so if you're interested please apply here with your most up to date CV and I will be in touch.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST



UP TO £40,000



LONDON (HYBRID)



THE COMPANY



I have partnered with a global organisation within the arts sector to support in their efforts to improve revenue, customer satisfaction, retention and acquisition. This role has huge scope to add real impact to a large-scale business, utlising your analytical capabilities to drive growth.



THE ROLE



The successful Data Analyst responsibilities will include:



Utilise their new Customer Data Platform which recently went live
Deliver value from the investment of their new CDP and enhance their customer bases loyalty
Perform ad-hoc requests to support the Data Science team
Gaining a greater understanding of the typical customer profile your analysis

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE



The successful Data Analyst will have the following skills and experience:



High level of numeracy and strong analytical skills
Experienced utilising SQL
Knowledge of Python/R would be a bonus
A good understanding of a visualisation e.g. Looker, Power BI or Tableau
The ability to tell story with data and provide actionable recommendations

THE BENEFITS



The successful Data Analyst will receive a salary of up to £40,000, plus an array of additional benefits.



HOW TO APPLY:



Please register your interest by sending your CV to Harry Mincer via the apply link below.

Description:
Data Analyst



Central London



Up to £50,000



I am currently working with one of the UK's leading financial services group which are a major global investor. They are looking to hire an experienced Data Analyst to join their established data team.







The Role:



The role will involve being responsible for regular reporting and more ad-hoc analytics, including creating interactive dashboards and automating them to keep them running. You will also be responsible for migrating one of their data centers from one server to another.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are working closely alongside a Local Authority in Tower Hamlets to assist with the appointment of a Data Analyst, on a 1 Year contract, likely to be extended at clients discretion.




Please apply with your CV for immediate consideration. This is a brilliant opportunity to start working for public sector.




Summary




We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our transformation work aligning to our key improvement strategy - Improving Care Together. This is our vision to support adults to meet their goals, be connected to others and as independent as possible. This role will support our key workstreams linked to the ASC Transformation Board, enabling our projects to develop robust data insights that evidence the impact of key activity.




Role & Responsibilities




Research, collation, capture, store and publish evidence and datasets to support planning and decision making across the programme workstreams.
The post-holder will be required to research and identify external and internal datasets that could support the objectives of the programme workstreams.
The post-holder will be responsible for ensuring that these datasets are captured within Council systems and are accessible to colleagues on demand.
Work with other analysts to ensure that evidence and data is joined up and shared to support better planning and decision making. This will mean liaison with stakeholders across the council and with partner organisations as well as working to ensure that systems and processes enable effective sharing and joining-up of data, subject to considerations of data protection.
Work with the programme leads to design key performance indicators to reflect priority outcomes and build the necessary systems and processes to capture and report against these. This will include defining and documenting new performance indicators, ensuring that responsibilities for data generation and collation are clearly understood.
Develop systems and processes to efficiently capture, record, validate, analyse and report data against key performance indicators for the programme.
The post holder will also be responsible for ensuring that the relevant systems and processes are in place for efficient and secure data capture, storage and reporting.
Prepare cyclical and ad-hoc performance reports for the programme board, workstreams and projects. This will include development and drafting of performance dashboards using all available tools to ensure efficient and accurate reporting.
Provide support, guidance, advice and challenge to the programme in improving data quality and to ensure that programme performance is maximised.





Essential Criteria




Experience working within Adult Social Care data and transformation.
Good understanding of the Adult Social Care operating context.
Good working knowledge of data extraction tools, including Business Objects, SRSS and SQL.
Experience and working knowledge of R-Studio and Power BI.
Intermediate or advanced Microsoft Excel skills.





Please note:




You should be available to work immediately or at a short notice.
You should have right to work in U.K





Disclaimer: Brackenberry Ltd is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy. We are committed to equality in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. Unless otherwise stated all of our roles are temporary, though assignments can be and often are, extended by clients on a longer term basis and can sometimes become permanent. Important: We will interpret your application as being permission to submit your CV to this role (with the right to represent you) unless you advise us to the contrary. Your DBS must be either through us or be accompanied by a subscription to the DBS updating service.
