I am currently working with one of the UK's leading financial services group which are a major global investor. They are looking to hire an experienced Data Analyst to join their established data team.



The Role:

The role will involve being responsible for regular reporting and more ad-hoc analytics, including creating interactive dashboards and automating them to keep them running. You will also be responsible for migrating one of their data centers from one server to another.



Skills & Experience

To qualify for this Data Analyst role, you will require:

· Strong understanding of Power BI, DAX, Tableau, Python

· Skills across data wrangling with SQL

· Stakeholder management experience



Perks & Benefits:

· Base salary of up to £50,000

· Hybrid working

· Other Benefits



HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest in this role by applying via this website. For more information on this role or other roles in Business Intelligence, reach out to Cameron Anderson at Harnham.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Citywire is currently looking for a Data Analyst to join our experienced and growing Technology team. You will be working closely with business stakeholders to understand their data requirements and helping them with the data they need to achieve their goals. We’re looking for someone with strong communication and interpersonal skills to join our team.




A little about us... Citywire helps people make better investments. We publish news, analysis and unique fund manager performance information to help professional investors make the best decisions about where to place their clients' money. Sustainability is at the heart of what we do. We employ around 300 staff and look for motivated, passionate and dynamic people from all walks of life and backgrounds. Professional development is paramount to us to keep innovated and we encourage training throughout your career. We have offices in London, Brighton, New York, Munich, Milan, Singapore, Sydney, and Paris. We have fully embraced a hybrid model of working.




Main Responsibilities:




As Data Analyst you will be involved in:




Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data requirements and help provide them with the data they need to achieve their goals.
Extracting data from underlying datasets and producing appropriate reporting solutions
Analysing and gaining insight from data to understand what it shows and how it can help drive business decisions
Working closely with the Data Engineering team to make sure data is in the correct structure for analysing and reporting, and with the Development teams to ensure the right data is captured at source
Empowering users within the business to become data champions in their own departments
Helping drive engineering projects based on business data needs




Job Specific Skills / Technical Skills / Requirements




Clear communication skills and ability to collaborate with colleagues of all levels
A strong analytical approach to data with the ability to analyse complex datasets, comfortable using raw data to build reports.
Proficient in data visualisation – expressing data in easy-to-understand formats




Experience using/working with:




Manipulating data using SQL.
Google Big Query
Visulatisation tools such as Looker Studio or equivalent
NoSQL Databases
AWS, GCP or similar cloud platforms
Excel, Googlesheets
Power Query




Who We Are




Honesty, integrity, fairness and respect are four core values. We can and should disagree with one another, in the interests of getting the right answer. Arguments for truth, not ego. We should always focus on sustainability at every level of the company.




Excelling at your job will contribute to high performance at Citywire. You should have a continuous and constructive spoken dialogue with your manager about your performance, with reference to these behaviours: A positive approach; collaborating with colleagues; a make it happen attitude.




We offer a competitive salary and additional company benefits:




25 days holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after three years’ service followed by 30 days after five years’ service) plus bank holidays
Flexible working options
£480 allowance on any wellbeing activity and/or gym options. We will help with your monthly or annual costs
We have a personal trainer who runs virtual workout sessions during lunchtime weekly
Eye-test and glasses allowance
Competitive private pension scheme
Critical illness cover and group life assurance from day 1
Well-being: access to an independent Employee Assistance Programme available 24/7
Cycle to work scheme and annual ticket travel card loans
Techscheme, which lets staff buy the latest tech through their employer. Employees can spread the cost with payments from their salary across 12 months and make a National Insurance saving too




After two years continuous service you will also have access to group income protection and private medical and dental insurance




Check out our Youtube channel to find out more about us: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPMOUK4uLN7yZU8j79l4zcg




Additional Notes




Pre-selected applicants will undertake 2 psychometrics tests.




Interviews will take place via Zoom/Teams.




Citywire is an equal opportunities employer.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
HTML:
Data Analyst / Insight Analyst / SQL Data Analyst / Analytics Executive


Office based in central London, 4 days on site/1 day working from home. Initially 12 months full time contract and possible to become permanent afterwards, contract is inside IR35, £250 to £325 per day which works out around £3500 per month to £4300 per month AFTER TAX.


Our client is a leading US mobile advertising software vendor:

-Over 6500 employees across Europe, US, Asia and Middle East;

-Growing rapidly with revenue of $1 billion;

-Developed some of the most popular mobile apps on the market with over 200M daily active users


They are looking for a SQL Data Analyst to join their London business team where you will work closely with sales, account managers and clients to provide in-depth insight analysis and drive advertising performance, business revenue and growth:


-Build dashboards, reports and insight analysis using SQL, Big Query, Tableau, Looker and Google Data Studio to optimize advertiser performance, product development and SME business growth;

-Create data tools;

-Build and automate processes that can be scaled out for stakeholders and cross functional teams;

-Carry out quantitative data research


Requirements:

-Must have strong SQL experience;

-Experience in creating data tool and automation that can be scaled out;

-Experience in R or Python is a big plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a graduate searching for an opportunity in Data Management or somebody in Data Management looking for your next challenge? Our team is looking for their next team member.




If the opportunity to learn along with support and development in a flexible working environment are high on your list of priorities, then this could be just the position for you!




Job Purpose:




Working within Data Management Team who are responsible for :




Translating, onboarding and validating client data and ensuring storage in consistent format.




First point of contact for all data issues in the branch




Supporting various functions within the business on specialist data and reporting needs.




Producing data analysis and reports for internal and external clients




General Duties & Tasks:




Develop and manage data transformation scripts used for various client data.
Data cleansing, profiling, mapping and mining.
Develop and support various ad-hoc reporting needs for both external and internal clients.
Support business requirement gathering activities especially on their data and reporting needs.
Ensure data stored in consistent format and in line with treaty arrangements
Support and improve where possible tools used in the team.
Determining, monitoring and reporting the quality of client data.
Liaison with internal and external clients to fully understand data content to maximise the benefits to the business, uncovering possible weaknesses and working for their correction.
Gather, understand and document detailed business requirements for data using appropriate tools and techniques, and ensure these are agreed at all levels throughout the business.


Key Skills and Experience Essential




Data analysis and data management skills
VBA, SQL Server and MS Excel and Access
High level of numerical and analytical skills
Ability to investigate data issues and apply cost benefit analysis
Remote working set-up


Desirable




Understanding of insurance /reinsurance business
Technical / commercial knowledge of Longevity business
R, Python and/or other Data Science syntax and knowledge
Power BI or other Business Intelligence software knowledge.
Experience of performing data audits
Demonstrable experience of working with relational databases e.g. Oracle and/or SQL


Qualifications and Educational Requirements:




Degree in Mathematics or related subject or relevant equivalent




Personal Attributes:




Good attention to detail




Excellent problem solving skills




Ability to work independently and take ownership for delivery of client requirements




Well organised, with ability to multi-task and prioritise work efficiently




Effective communicator




Benefits




You will be rewarded with a competitive salary, 25 days annual leave (pro rata) along with private medical insurance and employers contributory pension of 10%. We offer a hybrid working policy with a mix of working from home at our London office.




About Us




Here at Munich Re we seek to offer our staff the opportunity to grow in an exciting, results-oriented and diverse working environment. We believe that your dedication to apply your outstanding knowledge crafts the future; the future of our clients, of Munich Re and of course your own.




Munich Re is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our employees.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – London/ Remote




(Tech stack: SQL, Python, Power BI, Excel)




Insurance focused Data Analyst (Python, SQL, Power BI, Excel) sought for a well known London Financial specialising in Risk. Established for over 100 years now, 350 locations, over 10,000 employees worldwide.




We are recruiting for this role as part of a large ongoing project to bring onshore an offshore IT team.




As a Data Analyst in the binding authority division your role will be highly autonomous with responsibilities that are wide and varied including things like working closely with clients to analyse & actively drive performance to building ; data models and dashboards, data analysis for new projects, data validation & cleansing, manage written premiums, paid premiums and claim stats as well as owning the production of earned to incurred triangulation figures for all clients and insurers.




Given the acquisitions of other organisations into the group you will be also in time be introduced to other parts of the group as part of a larger data community so this is pivotal role offering a fantastic opportunity for career development.




The successful candidates with be proficient in Python and SQL with experience of insurance risk & claims (non marine) , portfolio management and possess an analytical mind set, with the ability to solve problems and work on their own and as part of a team in varying situations. Any Power BI experience would be a bonus.




Unfortunately, my client is unable to provide sponsorship and the candidate needs to be a resident of the UK.




Location: London, UK / Remote Working




We would prefer for candidates to work on a Hybrid basis in London(extremely flexible), however, as we are more concerned with getting the right individuals for these roles we would be happy to consider remote workers also.




My client is happy to pay for expenses related to coming into the office.




Fantastic career development opportunity.




Upto 65K + Bens + flexible working




NOIRUKTECHREC

NOIRUKREC

Title: Data Analytics and Business Intelligence | Analyst | London
Description:
Job Description

MORE ABOUT THIS SKILLSET

Embedded in everything we do, risk management is key to effectively identifying, monitoring and anticipating the diverse array of risks the firm faces in serving clients and operating its global businesses, including credit risk, market risk, liquidity risk operational risk and model risk.

Divisions And Job Functions

Risk aims to effectively identify, monitor, evaluate and manage the firm’s financial and operational risks - including reputational risk - in support of the firm’s strategic plan. Operating in a fast-changing environment and utilizing the best in class risk framework, Risk teams are analytically curious, have an aptitude for challenges and an unwavering commitment to excellence.

Internal Audit assesses the firm’s internal control structure, advises management on developing control solutions, and monitors the implementation of these measures. Audit teams work alongside the Finance and Technology divisions and make sure the firm is operating in a way that is safe and functional.

Basic Qualifications

Graduated from a Bachelors or Masters degree between 2019 – June 2022
0-3 years of prior work experience in a relevant field.
Proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Strong ability to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines
Team player with positive attitude and strong work ethic
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to adapt quickly to a variety of industries and businesses
Ability to self-direct, analyze and evaluate and form independent judgments
Ability to effectively interact and build relationships with senior management and global stakeholders
Commercially savvy with ability to exercise discretion with respect to highly confidential/sensitive information
Integrity, ethical standards and sound judgment

About Goldman Sachs

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved.

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST
UP TO £38,000
LONDON (HYBRID)







Overview:



We are working with a market research company that is seeking a talented and experienced Data Analyst to join their team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for data analysis, exceptional SQL skills, and a strong ability to provide insights based on data.







Responsibilities:



You will:



Develop, maintain, and optimize complex SQL queries to extract data from multiple data sources
Analyze large, complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Build interactive dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data-driven opportunities for improving business performance.
Continuously monitor data quality, accuracy, and completeness
Participate in data governance and data management processes to ensure data integrity and security
Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data analytics and data visualization





Requirements:



We would love to hear from you if you tick any of the following boxes:



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis, with a strong focus on SQL
Strong ability to write complex SQL queries and optimize query performance
Proficient in data visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Qlikview
Excellent analytical skills with a proven track record of delivering insights from data
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate complex insights to non-technical stakeholders
Experience in market research or a related field is a plus





The benefits:



You will receive a competitive salary and benefits package, a dynamic and collaborative work environment, and opportunities for professional growth and development.



If you are a self-starter with a passion for data analysis, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.







How to apply:



Please apply by submitting your CV to Emma Johnson at Harnham.




Desired Skills and Experience

We are working with a market research company that is seeking a talented and experienced Data Analyst to join their team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for data analysis, exceptional SQL skills, and a strong ability to provide insights based on data.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

LONDON, FARRINGDON - HYBRID

£45,000 - £50,000




If you are a data analyst with a passion for architecture and an interest in working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, this may be the perfect opportunity for you to help shape the future of their data function. In this stand-alone role, you will drive an award-winning company's data strategy.




THE COMPANY

An award-winning architecture firm with international offices that designs structures, museums, and cultural buildings.




THE ROLE

In this Data Analyst position, you will:

Maintaining the database and structures in SQL
Building Power BI dashboards and automating them for the whole company
Using Python or R to process and analyze data




THE REQUIREMENTS

To qualify for this Data Analyst position, you will require:

Proficiency using Power BI and SQL
Experience with Python or R is a plus
Excellent communication skills to liaise with stakeholders of all levels




BENEFITS

A successful Data Analyst in this role will receive:

Hybrid working
A salary of up to £50,000 within your first year
Other benefits




HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Carlota via the Apply link on this page.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Red Sky Personnel has an opportunity for Data Analysts on a short-term contract role in the Middle East, you will be gathering and scrutinizing data using specialist tools to generate management information reporting. This is working within an airport environment so previous experience within airports is preferable.




You will be accessing data and compiling performance reports on a daily and weekly basis. You must be able to manage raw data, compile/build a database and then produce professional and accurate reporting output for Senior Leadership presentations.




Experience:




Familiar with SITA data systems.
MS Suite including Azure/Access skills.
The ability to analyse, model, and interpret data.
Problem-solving skills.
A methodical and logical approach.
The ability to plan work and meet deadlines.
Accuracy and attention to detail.
Interpersonal skills.
Teamworking skills.
Written and verbal communication skills.
An understanding of the ethics of gathering and working with data.
Proven previous airport data analytics experience.




Whilst the main reporting is templated and will be at regular times, a large aspect of this role will require out-of-normal business hours delivery. The reporting will need to cover 7 days of operations.




This is a short-term contract position in the Middle East and visa requirements will have to be met, you will have to be available to travel end of May and be in country for 3 months, with 6 months plus on your passport.




Accommodation and flights are provided.




Please apply with an updated CV and one of the team will be in touch.

Red Sky Personnel has an opportunity for Data Analysts on a short-term contract role in the Middle East, you will be gathering and scrutinizing data using specialist tools to generate management information reporting. This is working within an airport environment so previous experience within airports is preferable.


You will be accessing data and compiling performance reports on a daily and weekly basis. You must be able to manage raw data, compile/build a database and then produce professional and accurate reporting output for Senior Leadership presentations.


Experience:


  • Familiar with SITA data systems.
  • MS Suite including Azure/Access skills.
  • The ability to analyse, model, and interpret data.
  • Problem-solving skills.
  • A methodical and logical approach.
  • The ability to plan work and meet deadlines.
  • Accuracy and attention to detail.
  • Interpersonal skills.
  • Teamworking skills.
  • Written and verbal communication skills.
  • An understanding of the ethics of gathering and working with data.
  • Proven previous airport data analytics experience.


Whilst the main reporting is templated and will be at regular times, a large aspect of this role will require out-of-normal business hours delivery. The reporting will need to cover 7 days of operations.


This is a short-term contract position in the Middle East and visa requirements will have to be met, you will have to be available to travel end of May and be in country for 3 months, with 6 months plus on your passport.


Accommodation and flights are provided.


Please apply with an updated CV and one of the team will be in touch.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Incident.io

Global technology companies use incident.io to empower teams to run incidents from start to finish, by getting the right people involved in real-time on Slack.

Our platform integrates with tools you already use, with intuitive workflows and guiding actions to support your team through tough situations. Auto-generated timelines and post-mortems eliminate busy work and focuses effort on high impact work.

Rapidly fix and learn from incidents, so you can build more resilient products.

The Team

At incident.io data is involved in everything we do: from product launches and core dashboards we run the company with, to dashboards embedded in our product that have become hugely valuable for our customers to gain insights from their incident data.

We collect a variety of data both internally (product usage) and externally (social media, Google Analytics, Stripe, Finance & Sales tools), and we're really proud of the data stack we've built so far (and updated). Our data stack consists of Google BigQuery, Fivetran, dbt, and Metabase.

We're a 2 person Data team, covering everything across Product, Go to Market (Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success), Finance, and Talent. This role will focus on supporting our Go to Market (GTM) function as it triples in size this year.

Think of this role as being a hybrid of a Data Analyst and an Analytics Engineer. You'll be involved in everything from data pipelines to creating dashboards and presenting analysis. This is expected of everyone in the team until we start to specialise more as we grow.

What you'll be doing:

Supporting our GTM projects: such as tracking customer health, improving revenue generation, and analysing our signup funnel. The scope of this will increase a lot as the GTM function expands and it's an exciting time to join!
Contributing to our dbt codebase: owning GTM data models such as pipeline forecasting and the feed of Product data into our Sales tools, as well as contributing to our core data models
Communicating data across the business: we use Metabase dashboards, analysis write-ups, insights sharing in our weekly all-hands, and Smiirls!
Performing deep dive analysis: it's important to us as a team that we have the time to dive into topics we think might have a big impact on the business
Understanding our product: even though this role won't involve working directly with our Product function, it will be very hands on with our Product data


This role could be ideal for you if you:

Have worked in data analytics, science, or engineering for 2-4 years, ideally in a fast growing start-up or scale-up environment
Have a strong grasp of SQL, including window functions and creating gapless date tables
Have hands on experience with dbt - particularly building robust data pipelines that are well documented and tested
Can present analysis in a clear, convincing way that gets across the "so what?" to someone non-technical
Prioritise by whatever is going to have the most impact for the business, and understand when to hack something together vs. when to spend time on the detail


Our commitment to diversity

We embrace diversity at incident.io, and believe in creating supportive and inclusive environments where all of our employees can succeed. To build a product that's loved by everyone, we need a team with all kinds of different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. That's why we're committed to hiring people regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, neurodiversity status, disability status, or otherwise.

Got a question?

If you have any questions before applying to the role, please email the team at jobs@incident.io

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Working for a large international private education business this role will see you working with the global analytics and insights team.




Your role would be the development and provision of insightful, accurate and timely pricing, income, and forecasting analysis.




They offer ongoing training and development, flexible working and a professional and supportive environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Deliver data driven forecasting models for the sales function at a global, regional, level, focussing on historic & current pipeline data to generate predictive modelling
Manage the yearly planning of our pricing process, ensuring that insights are delivered on time to drive optimum performance across the group
Work with data experts across the organization to ensure that data is best structure - supporting and working with our data lake team to ensure we deploy best practice modelling and processe
Provide performance reports and insights for sales which drive improvements in our core conversion pathways

About You:

3+ years’ experience working as a data analyst supporting sales/commercial teams and/or as a pricing analyst within a commercial environment
Strong ability in delivering visualising data and insights with experience in data science and/or actuarial training (Would be an advantage)
Proficient experience with SQL and data visualisation tools (PowerBI, Snowflake, Databricks, Supermetrics, Python)
Advanced experience in Excel




This role is paying £50,000 depending on experience + bonus and benefits.

This role is paying £50,000 depending on experience + bonus and benefits.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Thisrole can be offered on a very flexible, hyrbrid basis (i.e no set or specific number of days in the office) but would like someone who is within commutable distance of the office

Have you worked with companies from the water, energy, telecoms and insurance sectors.

And also a consultancy?

For their Data Analyst role people from a telecoms or utilities background would be the best fit, but will consider those from outside these too

Candidates with Credit Risk Analysis experience would also be of most interest for the Data Analyst role, as they will likely have many of the skills that Sagacity are looking for.

Their office is based in London (Holborn) but this role can be offered on a very flexible, hyrbrid basis (i.e no set or specific number of days in the office) but would like someone who is within commutable distance of the office.

They are seeking someone with strong applied technical and analytical skills using SQL and Excel as well as experience in Python.

They are also seeking someone who is comfortable with being client-facing as part of the job will involve liaising with their clients directly to understand the scope of projects and feedback to them.

They can offer the role on a hybrid basis. There will be no set number or specific days per week that youll be required to be in the office, but there will be times when youll need to visit for meetings etc. Their office is based in Holborn, central London.

It also comes with a wide and undefined scope for progression.

As a business they were already expanding but have also acquired another data business who are also expanding.

So effectively they can offer a bespoke pathway of progression, dependent on what you want to do.

Must Haves

3 years experience worked in a water, energy, telecoms and insurance sectors or in a consultancy firm

Interested, intrigued, or want to find out more? Apply today so that we can start a conversation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CoinTracker makes cryptocurrency portfolio tracking and tax compliance simple. Our mission is to increase the financial freedom and prosperity of the world.




Some things we’re proud of:

📈 3% of all global cryptocurrency assets are tracked on CoinTracker ($50B daily)

💲 Profitable

🤝 Partnered with Coinbase, TurboTax, OpenSea, and other industry leaders

💼 Venture-backed by Accel, Y Combinator, and other top investors

🗺️ Founders: Jon previously built TextNow (200M downloads), Chandan was previously a product manager at Google




Learn more about our mission, culture, and hiring process: https://cointracker.notion.site/CoinTracker-is-hiring-7308c712493940a3b6e62257d283dad8




Your opportunity:

CoinTracker’s mission is to enable everyone in the world to use crypto with peace of mind. As a data analyst, your goal is to take our wide variety of data (blockchains, transactions, usage, mobile/web, etc.) and make it accessible and impact-driven. You’ll be building visualizations, running queries, and helping product, growth, marketing, partnerships, business, and support teams make important decisions and build the best products for the future of crypto.




1-year outcomes:

Comprehensive dashboards of the user lifecycle (signup, engagement, churn) across our web and mobile platforms.
Team-specific dashboards launched with KPIs and metrics relevant to the team i.e. Growth, Consumer, Finance, Support, etc.
Intake process created with a prioritized backlog of data requests for future tools/dashboards.
Completed pricing analysis to develop new pricing model/experiments for CoinTracker




You will:

Analyze our ads and marketing data to develop user models and compute LTV and effectiveness of different channels.
Work with our engagement/churn/retention data alongside product teams to improve product features, measure usage, and manage user cohorts.
Help develop finance/long-term models and understand tax/portfolio plan purchase and retention behaviors.
Partner with support to super-charge analytics for support tickets, queues, wait times, and help support be a highly-efficient organization.




Some of the skills we're excited about:

SQL Programming knowledge/ability to write queries comfortably
Experience with Tableau/Mixpanel/etc. for visualization and dashboards
Curious mindset to dig into datasets and find issues/concerns
Statistical knowledge to understand p-values, confidence intervals, and impact of experiments
XFN Collaboration skills to work with PM, Eng, Design, Finance, Support, etc. to gather requirements and provide solutions




What's it like working at CoinTracker?

We are a fully internationally distributed, tight-knit team. We have minimal process, and the majority of our time is spent working and collaborating asynchronously through tools like Figma, Github, Google Meet, Linear, Notion, Slack, Zendesk. We also stay aligned and bonded through weekly sprints, standups, all hands, and socials. We aim to empower every individual on the team with full transparency, ownership, autonomy, and clear objectives.




If this sounds exciting, we'd love to hear from you! Not sure you’re a perfect fit? Reach out anyway. We’re looking for awesome individuals, not folks who perfectly match a job posting.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: UK – London / Remote

Reporting to: Head of Data & Analytics




Who are we

At Monica Vinader, we’re on a mission to prove that buying better, wearing longer and doing better don’t have to be mutually exclusive. From our commitment to making the most sustainable jewellery we can using precious materials, to the timeless style and endless versatility of our pieces, we are driven to making everyday fine jewellery accessible and affordable.

And don’t just take our word for it, we are proud to be recognised in the industry through three recent awards, proving we are leading the way in sustainable jewellery:

● Ethical Jewellery Business of the Year 2021, Retail Jeweller

● Queen's Award for Enterprise: Sustainable Development 2022

● Responsible Luxury Business of the Year 2022, Positive Luxury

● Best Sustainable Luxury Jewellery Brand 2022, Marie Claire UK

We are digital first, customer obsessed, female led and inclusive, focused on creating meaningful relationships with our community, who we owe our success to. We are looking for someone special to join our team to help us make luxury something we can all enjoy everyday.







Where we need your help

The Monica Vinader Data & Analytics team plays an important role in supporting decision making, strategy development and process automation across the business. The team owns, maintains and improves all reporting data systems working in close collaboration with retail, inventory, operations, digital and technology teams.




A key contributing factor for ensuring the continued growth of the business is establishing a holistic view of our customer and how they flow through the experience. The team works to ensure optimal selection, configuration and governance of the analytics stack to achieve a true understanding of each and every touch point along the customer journey.




As a Data Analyst, you will deliver compelling, coherent and meticulously distilled insights to stakeholders across the business. We will look to you to source, maintain and interpret numerous streams of data to provoke conversations and provide direction appropriately for your stakeholders' needs. Your work will influence and drive decision-making anywhere from the user experience to the strategic direction of the business more generally.







What you’ll be doing

● Support decision making by providing detailed, action orientated insights, continuously highlighting potential opportunities and risks.

● Owning the end-to-end delivery of meticulous insights right across the Monica Vinader business including ecommerce, retail, operations, supply chain, customer care, logistics, finance

● Develop relationships with your stakeholders and an understanding of their business areas, enabling your insights and recommendations to be relevant

● Partner with the Product Team and Developers to ensure we have the right data collection and tracking processes in place to feed our models

● Configure and govern automated reporting in our cloud based data stack. Including the building and development of SQL data models in DBT

● Champion a culture of self service by ensuring your stakeholders are suitably skilled in how use our analytics tools

● Building out customer segments based on behaviours including value, recency, products purchased and other factors in order to enable targeted communications and promotions

● Analysing customer churn and building models to identify key characteristics or behaviours that flag that customers have a higher propensity to churn and therefore are at risk

● Prioritise & resolve issues and requests raised via the internal Data Support desk solution

● Maintain strict QA processes and standards in order to deliver high data integrity and uptime. Proactively monitor the integrity of our data connections and metrics, taking the lead on troubleshooting

● Maintain a strong focus on good governance and documentation for our data systems, ensuring our approach is compliant and continues to be best in class

● Play a central role in ensuring the security of our customers’ data while also ensuring our compliance with international data compliance regulation (such as GDPR, PECR,CCPA)







What you’ll bring

● Experience in the data and analytics domain with a demonstrable track record in influencing business decisions using data

● Strong technical and data modelling skills including advanced SQL and preferably one other programming language

● Familiarity of working with a spectrum of cloud-based technologies which sit within the modern data stack (e.g. BigQuery/GCP/Snowflake/DBT/Snowplow)

● Experience of using Agile frameworks, methodologies, and best practices within analytics

● Analytics experience in customer behaviour, lifetime value, segmentation, experimentation, cohort analysis, etc., ideally in a DTC omni-channel business

● Strong attention to details to highlight and address data quality issues

● Self-motivated, responsible and technology-driven individual who performs well both independently and as a team member

● Team player, able to work with multiple business functions to achieve objectives

● Exceptional communication skills, written and verbal, you’re known for your visual organisation plus clear and concise style

● Experience with Google Analytics, GA4, and BI tools such as PowerBi, Tableau etc

● Aptitude for test and learn mindset - and feeding that into day to day operations

● Experience working at a high-growth start-up or scale-up environment where you’ve had to be a scrappy self-starter with a focus on iteration and pragmatism

● Self-motivated and enthusiastic approach to work who excels in challenging environments

● A growth mindset, comfortable surfacing your own failures to drive learnings, knowing when to pivot, knowing when to persevere







To be successful at Monica Vinader...

● You are a doer.

● You’re a team player.

● You’re humble.

● You are honest, straightforward and transparent.

● You are a good teacher/mentor (approachable and accessible).

● You want to get your hands dirty.

● You solve problems.

● You are resilient.

● You are flexible.

● You are entrepreneurial, smart, and passionate.

● If you don't know something, you say so. Then go figure it out quickly.

● You love working in a creative environment.

● You have a sense of humor.

● You are an insatiable learner







Additional Requirements

Ability to document your authorization to work in the United Kingdom







Our Aims and Values

Our mission is to be the leading accessible luxury brand, by delivering outstanding quality, design and customer service. We are:




Customer Obsessed

Our customers are at the core of everything we do. We will always deliver an outstanding and personal experience to them every time they interact with us, to ensure their ongoing support and loyalty.




Caring

We treat people with respect, as we would want to be treated. We are apolitical and assume good intentions in others. We are open and honest with each other while ensuring we take an empathetic and supportive approach.




Fast Paced

We are passionate about what we do, and we want to reach as many customers as fast as we can. We combine focus with pragmatism and flexibility so that we can move at pace in whichever direction we need to take.




Exceptional

We have a relentless desire to continually learn and improve to ensure our products and approach are exceptional. Our tenacity, high standards and attention to detail give us a competitive advantage.




Commercial

We focus hard on facts and approach things in a logical, rational and analytical way. We challenge each other to make sure we make decisions and take actions that create value for our business and our customers.




Monica Vinader as a global business makes the following inclusive culture pledge:

Our jewellery is for everyone and so is our community. Together, we will continue to implement sustainable changes to ensure that career opportunities and progression are open to all. We commit to celebrating the diverse voices of our employees, partners, and the customers we serve.




This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of duties to be performed by the employee. This job description may be altered to reflect the business needs of the company.

Show more Show less

● You are honest, straightforward and transparent.

● You are a good teacher/mentor (approachable and accessible).

● You want to get your hands dirty.

● You solve problems.

● You are resilient.

● You are flexible.

● You are entrepreneurial, smart, and passionate.

● If you don't know something, you say so. Then go figure it out quickly.

● You love working in a creative environment.

● You have a sense of humor.

● You are an insatiable learner



Additional Requirements

Ability to document your authorization to work in the United Kingdom



Our Aims and Values

Our mission is to be the leading accessible luxury brand, by delivering outstanding quality, design and customer service. We are:


Customer Obsessed

Our customers are at the core of everything we do. We will always deliver an outstanding and personal experience to them every time they interact with us, to ensure their ongoing support and loyalty.


Caring

We treat people with respect, as we would want to be treated. We are apolitical and assume good intentions in others. We are open and honest with each other while ensuring we take an empathetic and supportive approach.


Fast Paced

We are passionate about what we do, and we want to reach as many customers as fast as we can. We combine focus with pragmatism and flexibility so that we can move at pace in whichever direction we need to take.


Exceptional

We have a relentless desire to continually learn and improve to ensure our products and approach are exceptional. Our tenacity, high standards and attention to detail give us a competitive advantage.


Commercial

We focus hard on facts and approach things in a logical, rational and analytical way. We challenge each other to make sure we make decisions and take actions that create value for our business and our customers.


Monica Vinader as a global business makes the following inclusive culture pledge:

Our jewellery is for everyone and so is our community. Together, we will continue to implement sustainable changes to ensure that career opportunities and progression are open to all. We commit to celebrating the diverse voices of our employees, partners, and the customers we serve.


This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of duties to be performed by the employee. This job description may be altered to reflect the business needs of the company.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST



UP TO £55,000 + BENEFITS



LONDON







THE COMPANY



Our client is a leading FMCG business with a strong presence in the industry. Please note that they are unable to offer sponsorship at this time. The company owns a huge range of brands in the consumer goods space and they're currently going through a huge data transformation.







THE ROLE



The successful Data Analyst will be responsible for using SQL to analyse data across operations, sales, and customer, whilst also creating dashboards for the wider business. This is a key role that will report into the Head of Data and will provide the successful candidate with excellent career progression opportunities.



More specifically, you can expect to be doing the following:



Use SQL to analyse data across operations, sales and customer segments
Create dashboards to visualise data for the wider business
Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis
Work closely with the Head of Data to ensure the accuracy of data
Working with stakeholders across the business to improve the companies data-culture





YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE



The successful Data Analyst will have the following skills and experience:



Strong experience in data analysis, particularly using SQL
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis
Strong communication and presentation skills
Experience with methodologies such as segmentations
Experience with a visualisation tool such as Power BI, or similar with proven experience in creating dashboards





THE BENEFITS



The successful Data Analyst will receive a salary up to £55,000 with benefits on top.







HOW TO APPLY:



Please register your interest by sending your CV to Dylan Butcher via the Apply link on this page.




Desired Skills and Experience

Strong experience in data analysis, particularly using SQL
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis
Strong communication and presentation skills
Experience with methodologies such as segmentations
Experience with a visualisation tool such as Power BI, or similar with proven experience in creating dashboards, SQL, Python, R, Communication, channel, segmentations, Senior, KPI, predictive modelling, LTV, Analysis, Analytics, segmentation, commercial, tableau, looker

Title: Junior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a Professional Services firm, are looking for an entry level Marketing Data Analyst to support the marketing team. You will be extracting and manipulating marketing data to evaluate efficiency of different marketing channels.

Please note, this role can be based in London or Milton Keynes.

Main Responsibilities As a Marketing Data Analyst

Collect and analyse data to support sector plans and answer marketing briefs
Be able to perform valid and reliable market research
Support the marketing team with designing market research surveys and compiling / analysing results into a report
Interpret data intelligently and formulate reports
Provide analysis on market trends, competitor analysis, and catalogue findings for reports, proposals and marketing activity requirements
Analyse quantitative data to turn it into insights so the firm can improve performance marketing and customer experience metrics
Evaluating and improving business processes and products using accuracy and statistical methods
Identify and deliver opportunities to support the strategic direction through the better use of data and make recommendations

Qualifications and Skills needed to be a Marketing Data Analyst

A creative and inquisitive mindset with the ability to offer practical solutions to work situations, always questioning and considering more efficient/effective alternatives
Experience in manipulating data in Excel

Description:

Mapping of data extracted from outgoing royalty system

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: HR & Payroll Data Analyst

Location: UK - Remote

Salary: £60,000

Contract: 6 month FTC to Perm

Job Summary

We are looking for an experienced HR & Payroll Data Analyst to join an established Accountancy firm, based in the UK. The primary purpose of the role is to provide accurate and effective analysis, reports, and data solutions to the companys HR and payroll teams.

Job Description

The HR & Payroll Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analysing, and interpreting data, and providing reports and data solutions to the HR and payroll teams. The HR & Payroll Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting data audits, monitoring and benchmarking data trends, and creating data dashboards and reports. The role requires a technical understanding of HR and payroll processes, as well as an in-depth knowledge of data analysis.

Responsibilities

Collect, analyse, and interpret data from the HR and payroll departments.

Conduct data audits and perform data validations.

Monitor and benchmark data trends and make recommendations for improvements.

Develop data solutions, dashboards, and reports for HR and payroll teams.

Identify and resolve data discrepancies.

Assist with the preparation of management reports.

Work with HR and payroll teams to develop data solutions.

Keep up to date with industry trends and best practices.

Requirements

Bachelors degree in a relevant field.

Minimum Of 5 Years Experience In a Similar Role.

In-depth knowledge of HR and payroll processes.

Proven experience in data analysis.

Excellent problem-solving skills.

Strong organisational and communication skills.

Proficient in Microsoft Office.

Knowledge of SQL and Tableau is desirable.

If you are interested in this role, please apply for immediate consideration and interview, and to receive further details about the role.

JGA Recruitment Group Ltd("We") are committed to equality of opportunity for all applications regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

We are also committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. We are a specialist Payroll and HR recruitment agency and recruitment business as defined in the Employment Agencies and Employment Businesses Regulations 2003 (our business).

These statements together with our privacy notices set out the basis on which any personal data we collect from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bouygues UK may not be a name you know; we have a long heritage in the world wide construction operating in over 80 countries. Bouygues UK delivers work with passion, flair and innovation, given us the edge. No construction sector experience is required. We have a newly created role for a Data Analyst and this opportunity is seen as a pivotable position for our future in terms of data management. You could help to shape the direction and growth of this role. Based at our King’s Cross site, the former St Pancras Hospital. Job Purpose and Scope: You will be involved in collecting, processing and analysing data relating to various business functions, the role will focus on data in various construction projects particularly around design and production information. You need to demonstrate a strong desire to develop your career in analytics and will get the opportunity to develop your skills whilst taking ownership of projects. You will work with a wide range of stakeholders, gathering requirements and providing key insights which will be used to make key decisions and implement changes. Essential Microsoft Office 365; particularly Excel and Power Query Microsoft SharePoint SQL Microsoft Power BI and DAX Microsoft Power Automate Degree in a related field like maths, statistics or computer engineering/Or equivalent Accountabilities and key tasks: In general, the day-to-day activities of a data analyst may include but not limited to the following:-Communicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements (liaising with non-technical team members)
Using data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns
Performing statistical analysis of data
Using tools and techniques to visualise data in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphs Why Bouygues UK: Day in day out our teams deliver some of the most technically innovative and challenging projects across the UK and the world. With a strong corporate culture our values reflect how we operate with Respect, Excellence, Courage, Integrity and Passion.




We offer competitive basic salaries coupled with generous company benefits including: 26 days annual leave, increasing to 30 days 2 paid volunteering days a year pension scheme life insurance private medical insurance Bouygues Construction UK was awarded the Top Employers United Kingdom and Top Employers Europe certification. Together with our partners and clients, Bouygues UK delivers award-winning construction, development and regeneration projects to the most exacting standards across public and commercial private sectors. Be Yourself! Here at Bouygues we value the creativity and innovation that our diverse workforce brings, encouraging people from all backgrounds, particularly those from underrepresented communities to apply. By joining us, you will be inspired to bring your full self to the workplace, speak up and share your unique ideas. You will also have an opportunity to join our employee led diversity & inclusion communities such as WeLink (women network), Encompass (LGBTQ+), Kaleidoscope (BAME), Disability and Wellness peer support network, Parents and Carers network. We are an equal opportunities employer and encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of gender, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity

Title: Data Analyst - £45,000 - Central London
Company: Centrum pro výzkum energetického vužití litosféry
Description:
A highly successful, reputable brand with offices in Central London (Mayfair) are looking for a commercially minded Data Analyst to join their team. Reporting to the Head of Operations you will partner Sales, Marketing, Finance and Commercial teams to provide data reports across the business. This is a newly created role for an established business with aggressive growth plans.

As the Data Analyst you will take responsibility of revenue management and business reporting across operations, marketing and sales. You will use data reporting to assess pricing, revenue growth and performance; creating weekly / monthly performance reports that enable trend analysis and management decision making. This role will require you to use your analytical skillset to translate complex data sets into actionable insights and recommendations. In addition, you will assess marketing data, including impressions, website visits and enquiries providing analysis on conversion metrics and insights that can support conversion optimisation.

The ideal candidate for this Data Analyst role will have strong data visualization skills using Excel, VBA, SQL or Power BI. Any exposure to Tableau would be beneficial but not essential. Strong communication skills are required as you partner with a number of stakeholders across the business.

The salary on offer for this role is £45,000 plus benefits. This role is predominantly office based but offers flexibility to work from home one day per week.

Title: Flight Data Analyst
Description:
This is a key time to be joining British Airways as we Build a Better BA. We take huge pride in our past – but we’re looking to the future as an airline that loves embracing the best of modern Britain. Our country’s creativity, diversity, style, wit and warmth are the same special qualities that make us who we are. If you’re made of the same qualities as us, you could soon be part of the next chapter of our story. Together as one team, we’re connecting Britain with the world and the world to Britain like no one else

The Flight Data Analyst leads the flight data analysis and evaluation capabilities of the British Airways Group Safety & Security Management System; maximising the use of data derived from the flight data monitoring programme to provide expert examination, study, insight and intelligence to support the effective management of aviation safety risks. Enables world class safety and security risk management and cultural development.

About The Role

Performs quantitative and qualitative flight data analysis and evaluation activities, including trend/pattern identification, risk visualisations and control performance monitoring and measurement to support the effective management of aviation safety risks.
Provides regular and ad-hoc analysis, insight reports and extracts for the Aviation Safety Action Group, Corporate Safety Board and other governance meetings and groups, as required.
Preforms other quantitative and qualitative data analysis activities to support the effective management of risk across other safety and security domains, as required.
Assists with the development of the flight data monitoring system and performance monitoring and measurement visualisations, control models and metrics.
Leads internal engagement activities with Corporate Safety & Security, Flight Operations, Legal and the Engineering Flight Data Recording Team; ensuring the provision of data and analysis requests, as required.
Represents BA and IAG at internal/external forums, regulatory engagement activities and supports BA’s contribution to industry data and analytics programmes.

Our Corporate and Support roles come with big potential to make your mark on our business. The airline industry changes so fast that we’re constantly evolving and finding new ways to impress customers and get ahead of our competitors. If you’re an innovator and brave and bold thinker, you will be in your element at British Airways.

Your impact on British Airways will be rewarded with a competitive rewards package plus the opportunity to develop and progress your career in many directions.

Not only will you have the chance to further your career development within BA, you’ll have access to our competitive reward and benefits package. This includes core company paid benefits such as a Defined Contribution pension scheme, generous Life Assurance cover and a whole host of options to support your physical, mental and financial wellbeing. You can also sign up for a range of voluntary benefits such as Private Medical cover, Dental and Critical Illness cover, Technology Scheme, Cycle to Work and Electric Car Scheme. And of course, you’ll be able to enjoy the benefit of staff travel as soon as you join us

We are an equal opportunities employer and value diversity at British Airways. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and the general nature and level of work performed by job holders within this job. However, this job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position.

N.B. We reserve the right to close a vacancy before the closing date in the event of an overwhelming response or a change in business priorities.

  • Assists with the development of the flight data monitoring system and performance monitoring and measurement visualisations, control models and metrics.
  • Leads internal engagement activities with Corporate Safety & Security, Flight Operations, Legal and the Engineering Flight Data Recording Team; ensuring the provision of data and analysis requests, as required.
  • Represents BA and IAG at internal/external forums, regulatory engagement activities and supports BA’s contribution to industry data and analytics programmes.
Our Corporate and Support roles come with big potential to make your mark on our business. The airline industry changes so fast that we’re constantly evolving and finding new ways to impress customers and get ahead of our competitors. If you’re an innovator and brave and bold thinker, you will be in your element at British Airways.

Your impact on British Airways will be rewarded with a competitive rewards package plus the opportunity to develop and progress your career in many directions.

Not only will you have the chance to further your career development within BA, you’ll have access to our competitive reward and benefits package. This includes core company paid benefits such as a Defined Contribution pension scheme, generous Life Assurance cover and a whole host of options to support your physical, mental and financial wellbeing. You can also sign up for a range of voluntary benefits such as Private Medical cover, Dental and Critical Illness cover, Technology Scheme, Cycle to Work and Electric Car Scheme. And of course, you’ll be able to enjoy the benefit of staff travel as soon as you join us

We are an equal opportunities employer and value diversity at British Airways. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and the general nature and level of work performed by job holders within this job. However, this job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position.

N.B. We reserve the right to close a vacancy before the closing date in the event of an overwhelming response or a change in business priorities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: London - SW1V 2QX, Glasgow -G2 8JX, Durham -DH1 1SL, Lytham St Annes -FY8 4TS




Salary: c£40,500 per annum (Outside London) c£43,750 per annum (London)




Our client is one of the largest savings organisations in the UK with 25 million customers and more than £202 billion invested. They are both a government department and an Executive Agency of the Chancellor of the Exchequer. Our origins can be traced back over 150 years to 1861.




Job Summary




As an expert on the organisation's customer and product data and how it can be analysed and modelled, to produce analysis and reporting which can be used to provide stakeholders with the insight and information they need.




To support the business achieve its objectives through the production and delivery of information, analysis and insight relating to customers and their behaviours and interactions.




Essential Experience, Technical Knowledge And Skills




Substantial experience of business to consumer relational database analysis, report building and data mining
Substantial experience in undertaking analysis and data mining with a tool/language such as R or SAS
In depth knowledge and practical experience of producing dashboards and analysis with Tableau or another data visualisation tool
Ability to interpret data and analysis that has been produced, summarise findings and convert into easily consumable insights for non-data literate stakeholders
A good understanding of predictive modelling, segmentation and other statistical analysis
Advanced knowledge of Excel and good working knowledge of PowerPoint




Behaviours




You'll be assessed against these behaviours during the selection process:




Communicating and Influencing
Delivering at Pace
Managing a Quality Service
Changing and Improving




Technical Skills




You'll be assessed against these behaviours during the selection process:




Communicating and Influencing
Delivering at Pace
Managing a Quality Service
Changing and Improving




Benefits




A small company with a big reach, the organisation offer a range of benefits to include flexible working, great opportunities for development and a generous pension scheme. They care for colleagues, respect one another, invest in their people and manage talent effectively.




Some Of The Benefits Include




Learning and development tailored to your role
An environment with flexible hybrid working options
9 day fortnight scheme
A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
A Civil Service pension with an average employer contribution of 27%
Generous annual leave – starting at 25 days, increasing to 30 days
Performance related variable pay bonus
Enhanced Maternity, paternity, adoption and shared parental leave.




To Apply

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A brand new role has become available for a Data Analyst to work for a global Publishing business based in Central London on a 12 month fixed term contract to start ASAP




What you’ll be doing:-




Mapping of data extracted from outgoing royalty system
Reviewing author contracts to extract supplemental royalties information.
Preparation of data for loading to host royalty system.
Perform parallel royalty run.
Preparation of author and other details for loading to accounting system.




If you feel the below role working as a Data Analyst to work for a global Publishing business based in Central London is of interest to you then please do get in touch by applying for this role and also sending me your CV directly to Jamie.Hall@WaltersPeople.co.uk.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Centrum pro výzkum energetického vužití litosféry
Description:
Data Analyst - London, Hybrid - £55,000

A leader in transport innovation is looking for a Data Analyst to join their Business Performance team. The role will be responsible for analysing data produced across the business, deriving insights and providing recommendations to the board and leaders across the business. The company are keen to find someone with a passion for data and bring a structured approach to the position.

The successful candidate will play a key part in the company's strategic journey in implementing a data visualisation programme. The Data Analyst will collaborate with key stakeholders across the business to establish and build a suite of reports and visualisations.

The office is based in London, Farringdon or Milton Keynes with 2 days a week required on-site.

Further requirements include; working closely with data owners across the business to assure data collection processes and ensuring high quality and timely data collection is achieved.

Analysing data and producing reports, dashboards, and visualisations and working with colleagues to turn analysis into outcome-based insights on business performance.

Skills Needed

A track record of working with Microsoft Power BI to develop and interpret reports, dashboards and produce visualisations.
Previous experience within a similar role.
Ability to use data to communicate outcomes.
Strong analytical, problem solving and technical skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst Salary circa £38,000Hybrid Working - Remote / LondonFull Time (35 hpw) The Royal College of Anaesthetists is the professional body responsible for the specialty throughout the UK. We are the third largest medical royal college in the UK by membership. With a combined membership of more than 24,000 Fellows and Members, we ensure the quality of patient care by safeguarding standards in the three specialties of anaesthesia, intensive care and pain medicine. We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our Education, Training and Examinations department. This is a key role within the examinations team, providing expertise on all matters relating to examination data transfer and analysis, examination standard setting methods, and psychometric input to results data.




Reporting to the Psychometrics and Standard Setting Manager, you will support the data management and production of results for all FRCA and faculty examination deliveries and create regular reports for each exam delivery. In addition to this, you will also have the opportunity to attend meetings and contribute to the decision-making process on the handling and processing of examination data. The successful candidate will have: A degree in Statistics /Psychology/Science/Maths (OR degree with strong quantitative research methods element) A background in data analysis and experience in producing reports and creating graphical representations of data




Proficiency in IT packages such as Microsoft (Excel in particular) Ability to quickly gain a firm understanding of new software packages and databases Ability to deal with sensitive information and maintain confidentiality with tact and discretion Excellent report writing skills Excellent interpersonal and communication skills A commitment to maintaining high customer care standards and organisational values Ability to work flexible hours Ideally your experience will be based within the higher or further education sector and you will have previously used other statistical software. At RCoA diversity, equality and inclusion is an integral part of our culture so it is important to us that this is reflected in everything that we do. We welcome applications from all individuals irrespective of age, race, gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, marital status or parental responsibilities to ensure we actively embrace an inclusive and representative culture that encourages, supports and celebrates our differences. Unfortunately, due to the volume of applications, we are unable to provide detailed feedback to candidates on their application. Only short-listed applicants will be contacted after the closing date

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for a data analyst to join us here at GWI. Not just any data analyst though. Someone ambitious and genuine, who works best in the midst of a collaborative and forward-thinking team. That’s because as a GWIer you’ll be immersed in the fast-moving world of data tech. We think big to make an impact, we’re not afraid to ask why, and we always show respect. Those values are what got us where we are today, and they’re a big part of what we’re looking for in you.

About The Job

Our newly formed Business Data & Analytics department is on a journey to empower every area of the business with quality data, insights, automated efficiencies and analytics. Our goal is to enhance business performance and to give every GWIer the opportunity to make the best, timely decisions to move at the pace that makes GWI special. GWI is a data company where we power insights for some of the biggest global businesses, but the BD&A team is all about looking inwards and unlocking huge opportunities to work cross-functionally across departments to power up our internal teams with internal data.

We are hiring an experienced data analyst to support the build of our new data and analytics platform as well as varied projects and initiatives across the business. You should be able to extract, integrate and blend data and look for trends and patterns for both system needs and business analysis needs. You will have experience in setting up data management processes, establishing standards and building data models, through to profiling and analysing data in any system, internal or 3rd party, including data lakes and data warehouses. You will be comfortable working with metadata, data lineage and master data and confidently be able to advise the business on these areas.

What You’ll Be Doing

Learn and understand how the data works and be ready to answer questions of the data
Take ownership of data management, data dictionaries and setting standards on data
Document data, data flows, processes and data models
Analyse and document system data for integration into Data Lake and Data Warehouse
Collaborate with Enterprise Data Architect, business experts, and analysts to integrate systems and automate data collection processes
Work with data ingestion pipelines built by Data Engineers and be hands on to support data issues or questions raised on data
Problem solve issues through deep-dive data investigation and present back your findings
Be an advocate for data quality
Setup proactive monitoring of data to support either data quality or timely insights for departmental action
Produce MI and dashboards which help users understand key pressure points in data or processes
Support data testing activities across business and technical areas
Ensure data is available in a fit-for-purpose and timely manner for business and analytics consumption


About You

First things first, as a disruptor in the global market research industry, we haven’t come this far without entrepreneurial spirit and a get-up-and-go attitude. You are joining a small team at the early stages of our greenfield journey. We are looking for someone who is ready and willing to roll sleeves up and get stuck into setting up our data management capabilities. You will have experience with the journey to build up a modern data framework and with your drive and innovation you are ready to deliver data management and data quality for the business. So if you think we’ll see that in you, then you’re already halfway there. Here’s the rest of what we’d like you to bring to the table.

Technical

Highly proficient in SQL and able to write complex queries utilising CTEs and Window functions
Data manipulation and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise and analyse large amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience in data reconciliation against any systems, data platform or BI reporting sources
Experience in designing and implementing workflows for management of data to support business areas as well as the BD&A team
Highly proficient in Excel and/or Google Sheets
Experience with Tableau highly desirable
Experience with Python highly desirable
Preferable experience with GCP and the GCP data components
Experience with DBT, Stitch or similar highly desirable
Experience supporting QA and User Acceptance Testing processes
Knowledgeable on modern data architecture such as Data Lake, Data Warehouse, Lakehouse, Data Mesh etc.
Delivering incremental value through Scrum and Kanban methodologies


Competencies

Ability to find solutions when faced with challenges and be articulate when offering viable recommendations
Ability to interpret impact of changes to business rules on the data and data integration pipelines
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and able to write up and present findings
Self-driven and constantly striving to improve data
Analytical and agile mindset and ability to see the big picture alongside the value of incremental delivery
Natural problem solver who can make recommendations at pace
Ability to scope, estimate and deliver committed work on time, on own and as part of Agile team
Understand, if not live and breathe the mantra, that good quality data is the backbone of every business


Our Benefits

Great benefits make a big difference. Not just to employees, but to the whole vibe of a business. That’s why when you work for us, you’ll enjoy a full spectrum of generous perks, rewards and office benefits.

Competitive salary and performance-based bonus
Generous training budget
25 days holiday and Christmas office closure days on top
Allocated shares according to GWI’s share scheme
A range of discounts and freebies
A genuine commitment to mental and physical health, with a range of content, tools and perks to help you look after your wellbeing
Accredited learning and development programs
Enhanced primary caregiver and co-caregiver’s benefits
Flexitime and a great work-life balance
Health Cash plan
Referral bonus scheme
Mobile phone contract
Early finishes on Fridays
A well-stocked fridge and plenty of snacks (some healthy, some not so healthy)
Commit a working day to charity each year
Social activities and team outings


Who We Are

GWI was founded with the knowledge that understanding your audience is really important for business. When you know who you’re speaking to and why, you can create content and campaigns that stand out to the people that matter.

Through our global online survey, we gather data on the behaviour and perceptions of consumers across the world. This provides businesses with deep, actionable insights on their audience, revealed from data they trust.

It’s been going well, too. Since launching in 2009, we’ve become one of the UK’s fastest growing target audience companies. We’re not about to stop growing any time soon. As a business, we’re on a mission to re-engineer data-driven marketing, and we’re on the lookout for talented people to join us.

Diversity & Inclusion

Imagine if our data came from just one kind of person. We’d get a very nuanced view of the world. And we definitely wouldn’t have got off the ground as a business.

Although things certainly aren’t perfect, we live in a society where differences are increasingly celebrated – so we’d expect nothing else from our teams. In fact, the GWI office is as diverse as our global data, it’s really important to us that it stays that way. This is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely and make your mark.


Show more Show less
