  • Highly proficient in Excel and/or Google Sheets
  • Experience with Tableau highly desirable
  • Experience with Python highly desirable
  • Preferable experience with GCP and the GCP data components
  • Experience with DBT, Stitch or similar highly desirable
  • Experience supporting QA and User Acceptance Testing processes
  • Knowledgeable on modern data architecture such as Data Lake, Data Warehouse, Lakehouse, Data Mesh etc.
  • Delivering incremental value through Scrum and Kanban methodologies

Competencies
  • Ability to find solutions when faced with challenges and be articulate when offering viable recommendations
  • Ability to interpret impact of changes to business rules on the data and data integration pipelines
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and able to write up and present findings
  • Self-driven and constantly striving to improve data
  • Analytical and agile mindset and ability to see the big picture alongside the value of incremental delivery
  • Natural problem solver who can make recommendations at pace
  • Ability to scope, estimate and deliver committed work on time, on own and as part of Agile team
  • Understand, if not live and breathe the mantra, that good quality data is the backbone of every business

Our Benefits

Great benefits make a big difference. Not just to employees, but to the whole vibe of a business. That’s why when you work for us, you’ll enjoy a full spectrum of generous perks, rewards and office benefits.
  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonus
  • Generous training budget
  • 25 days holiday and Christmas office closure days on top
  • Allocated shares according to GWI’s share scheme
  • A range of discounts and freebies
  • A genuine commitment to mental and physical health, with a range of content, tools and perks to help you look after your wellbeing
  • Accredited learning and development programs
  • Enhanced primary caregiver and co-caregiver’s benefits
  • Flexitime and a great work-life balance
  • Health Cash plan
  • Referral bonus scheme
  • Mobile phone contract
  • Early finishes on Fridays
  • A well-stocked fridge and plenty of snacks (some healthy, some not so healthy)
  • Commit a working day to charity each year
  • Social activities and team outings

Who We Are

GWI was founded with the knowledge that understanding your audience is really important for business. When you know who you’re speaking to and why, you can create content and campaigns that stand out to the people that matter.

Through our global online survey, we gather data on the behaviour and perceptions of consumers across the world. This provides businesses with deep, actionable insights on their audience, revealed from data they trust.

It’s been going well, too. Since launching in 2009, we’ve become one of the UK’s fastest growing target audience companies. We’re not about to stop growing any time soon. As a business, we’re on a mission to re-engineer data-driven marketing, and we’re on the lookout for talented people to join us.

Diversity & Inclusion

Imagine if our data came from just one kind of person. We’d get a very nuanced view of the world. And we definitely wouldn’t have got off the ground as a business.

Although things certainly aren’t perfect, we live in a society where differences are increasingly celebrated – so we’d expect nothing else from our teams. In fact, the GWI office is as diverse as our global data, it’s really important to us that it stays that way. This is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely and make your mark.

Title: Data Analyst- MODARI
Description:
Salary: £31,931

Contract Type: Fixed Term, 12 months

Hours: Full Time/Part Time – Job Share

Location: London




Closing date: 1st March 2023




About the role

The UK Collaborative on Development Research (UKCDR) Secretariat works with funders of research relevant to international development to bring people together, share information and promote opportunities. We exist to amplify the value and impact of research for global development by promoting coherence, collaboration, and joint action among UK research funders.

The MODARI (Mapping ODA Research and Innovation) project aims to map the ODA Research and Innovation investment across His Majesty’s Government (HMG) to deliver timely. The jobholder will implement and enhance the (MODARI) project, under the leadership of the UKCDR Head of Operations and Strategic Projects, and the MODARI Senior Data Analyst (an FCDO secondee).




Responsibilities include:

Working with the Senior Data Analyst to access data and government systems, the postholder will be responsible for routine MODARI data management and will review operation of tools, design and implement enhancements to MODARI.
With colleagues, liaison with UKCDR Officials Group and others on the potential uses of the data for planning and communicating UK ODA R&D.
Undertake specific repeat analyses (using established methodology) to contribute to the updates of MODARI data and publications.
Under the guidance of experienced staff, develop new analyses and insights for regular mapping updates or for further stakeholder needs.
Proactive member of a team working under supervision of senior personnel. Able to identify key stakeholders, and develop & maintain relationships with current partners, funders, collaborators, governance groups and other relevant external bodies.
Support the UKCDR Executive Director and other Secretariat staff to provide research and policy advice to UKCDR member organisations and key stakeholders.
Provide verbal/written briefing on policy, research, funding and delivery issues concerning research which may impact on international development outcomes.

You'll need to be able to demonstrate the following:

A first or upper second-class Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a subject relevant to the work of UKCDR.
Quantitative analytical expertise, including experience working with statistical and visualisation software.
Experience working on large data sets and mapping activities, including: collating, cleaning and validating data, as well as record keeping/ data analysis.
Competency in MS Excel, familiarity with manipulating spreadsheets and quantitative analysis techniques.
Strong qualitative and quantitative skills including experience of coding, management information and systems.
Working knowledge of MS Office programmes
Strong analytical skills and the ability to analyze complex information and summarize key conclusions or recommendations

Why chose UKRI?

We recognise and value our employees as individuals and aim to provide a pay and rewards package that motivates staff to perform to the best of their ability.




We are committed to supporting employees’ development and promote a culture of continuous learning.




At UKRI, we believe that everyone has a right to be treated with dignity and respect, and to be provided with equal opportunities to thrive and succeed in an environment that enables them to do so. We also value diversity of thought and experience within inclusive groups, organisations and the wider community.




How to Apply

Applicants are required to provide a CV and a cover letter outlining their suitability for the role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salary circa £38,000




Hybrid Working – Remote / London




Full Time (35 hpw)




Our client is the professional body responsible for the specialty throughout the UK. They are the third largest medical royal college in the UK by membership. With a combined membership of more than 24,000 Fellows and Members, they ensure the quality of patient care by safeguarding standards in the three specialties of anaesthesia, intensive care and pain medicine.




They have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join their Education, Training and Examinations department.




This is a key role within the examinations team, providing expertise on all matters relating to examination data transfer and analysis, examination standard setting methods, and psychometric input to results data. Reporting to the Psychometrics and Standard Setting Manager, you will support the data management and production of results for all FRCA and faculty examination deliveries and create regular reports for each exam delivery.




In addition to this, you will also have the opportunity to attend meetings and contribute to the decision-making process on the handling and processing of examination data.




The Successful Candidate Will Have




A degree in Statistics/Psychology/Science/Maths (OR degree with strong quantitative research methods element)
A background in data analysis and experience in producing reports and creating graphical representations of data
Proficiency in IT packages such as Microsoft (Excel in particular)
Ability to quickly gain a firm understanding of new software packages and databases
Ability to deal with sensitive information and maintain confidentiality with tact and discretion
Excellent report writing skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
A commitment to maintaining high customer care standards and organisational values
Ability to work flexible hours




Ideally your experience will be based within the higher or further education sector and you will have previously used other statistical software.




Diversity, equality and inclusion is an integral part of our client's culture so it is important to them that this is reflected in everything that they do. They welcome applications from all individuals irrespective of age, race, gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, marital status or parental responsibilities to ensure they actively embrace an inclusive and representative culture that encourages, supports and celebrates our differences.




Unfortunately, due to the volume of applications, our client are unable to provide detailed feedback to candidates on their application. Only short-listed applicants will be contacted after the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to work with an international children’s charity working with children, their communities, and with supporters and partners, in almost 100 countries.




Position: Data Analyst




Salary: £30,000 - £35,000 per annum, depending on experience + good range of benefits




Contract: Permanent – 36.5 hours per week – part time or flexible working considered




Location: Homebased / flexible with occasional travel to Milton Keynes




About The Role




As Data Analyst you would be using your amazing data skills to help unlock new opportunities found within the charity’s data and equip teams with the data and insight needed to transform their individual giving programme.




You would be partnering closely with marketing teams to deliver real actionable insights that fuels growth in both acquisition and retention activities with the end goal of improving the overall value of the supporter base. And by working alongside different teams they will look to your unique talents to help guide them to make the best possible decisions.




About You




You will using your unique talent of proven data analytics to solve problems that are evenly matched by your ability to manage powerful collaborations with your business partners. We need you to get people fired up around the insights you uncover!




Your experience in managing relationships at different levels along with the ability to influence decision making will be paramount in ensuring this role is successful. You’ll work closely with marketing teams to help them write sharp data briefs and to be clear on what the problem is that they need to solve.




Key Skills And Experience Include




Proven experience in Data Analytics, Data mining and the use of trend analysis techniques/models
Ability to use SQL, statistical programs (e.g. R) and other programming languages (e.g.Python)
Working knowledge of large databases in order to select, extract and transform relevant information
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Advanced Excel skills
Strong understanding of what makes a marketing campaign successful (knowledge of fundraising would be an advantage but not essential)
Strong Influencing skills with the ability to present complex problems in a simple & straightforward way.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as PowerBI would be beneficial




If you feel you have the necessary skills and would like to put these to use working for an amazing charity that really makes a difference to the lives of children, then apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Research and Insights




Employment Type: Full Time




Location: London, UK




Description




You'll be working to put users at the centre of our design process, helping to deliver digital experiences that sports fans can't live without. Acting as an ambassador for data within Pulselive, you'll be championing the value and benefits the practice can bring to our clients and our products. In collaboration with other teams, you'll be defining analytics requirements, compiling actionable findings and recommendations, uncovering user insights, building dashboards, optimising digital performance, and delivering increased ROI.




As part of our rapidly growing Research & Audience Insights chapter, you'll need to thrive in a fast paced environment. With a few years of experience under your belt, you're ready to come in quickly and get stuck into client and internal workstreams. You'll embrace the opportunity to lead from the front, helping your colleagues understand the importance of data in design and development. In turn, you'll get to work with some of the biggest names in sports on products that bring enjoyment to millions of people worldwide.




Key Responsibilities
Developed analytics frameworks across multiple clients. You've worked to level up clients' analytics programs, informing them on best practices and empowering them to do more with their data. Understanding that maturity varies, you've provided support in defining OKRs, capturing analytics requirements, and designing/developing analytics implementations. Most importantly, you've interpreted and distilled clients needs into data they can easily understand and act upon. From automated dashboards to regular health checks, you've found ways to tell a compelling story.
Driven forward data as a key pillar of Pulselive's offering. You developed clear business cases, synthesized quantitative research findings, and demonstrated value across the board. Within Pulselive, you've challenged the business to consider new investment opportunities when it comes to fan data — you might even be working on a new proprietary software through our Research & Development program.
Helped drive forward our testing culture. You helped mentor cross-functional teams on the value of analytics and experimentation, encouraging and empowering individuals to start thinking about data in new ways. Whether for an entirely new product or a simple feature release, you've worked collaboratively to find ways to measure the impact of what we built and demonstrate ROI.
Demonstrated the power of data in design. You identified and acted upon opportunities to integrate data into the creative process and development cycle 一 shaping the way that we build products and educating other members of the team. By identifying actionable patterns and trends, you've consistently impacted the way we design digital products.
Informed overarching analytics strategy. As part of the Research & Audience Insights chapter, you've helped develop a company wide analytics strategy, advancing the way we track and monitor user behaviour across digital platforms. Your work has ingrained analytics as a core part of every project, ensuring enough time and budget is dedicated to do things right.
Implemented best practices and streamlined our processes. You've optimised data collection systems, enabling more efficient data analysis and enhanced digital performance. Across clients, you've provided developers with clear instructions for analytics implementation, supported QA pre-release, and monitored post-launch to ensure everything is coming in smoothly.
Illustrated the possibilities of data visualisation. You've found innovative ways to capture, manipulate, and display data, uncovering new insights and driving innovative product development. In addition, you've helped the creative team to showcase data to fans in new ways, enhancing player profiles, match centres, and statistics across client products.




Skills Knowledge And Expertise
In the past, you have...
Worked with Google Analytics, Firebase, Google Tag Manager, Data Studio, and BigQuery (and/or similar digital analytics tools)
Have experience with quantitative UX research methods, like survey analysis, A/B testing, and Multivariate testing
Applied your knowledge of Python and SQL to analyse large data sets, run custom queries and set-up personalised, automated reporting dashboards
Leveraged the power of statistical computing (through R or some other tool) to produce tangible insights and actionable product recommendations
Worked in collaborative, cross-functional teams. You know how to work with designers, developers, and product managers to turn data into recommendations and requirements that feed directly into product development
Helped stakeholders translate objectives and questions into analytics requirements, ensuring that meaningful data are captured
Managed relationships with clients and stakeholders, telling compelling stories through data
Been exposed to the interplay between business requirements, product strategy, technical constraints, and user experience




It would be great if you...




Have experience with other analytics tools like Adobe Analytics, Segment, Data Studio, HotJar, Tableau, Conviva, Qualtrics, etc.
Have Google Analytics certifications
Have a good understanding of data layers and app/web data collection
Love sports and have a strong understanding of the different stakeholders in the space




Benefits




At Pulselive we truly value our team and have developed our approach to ensure you are not only rewarded for your contribution but have access to unique benefits along with a positive approach to wellness. We want to ensure that your career, health and well-being are of the utmost importance at all times.




Benefits & Wellness
Flexible & Remote Working
Buy and Sell Annual Leave
Pension Scheme
Sporting Events and Tickets
Health & Wellness Activities
Complimentary Headspace Access
Annual Wellness Contribution
Mobile Phone Contribution
Sony Discounts ﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
With over 70 years of experience, our focus is on helping the most vulnerable children overcome poverty and experience fullness of life. We help children of all backgrounds, even in the most dangerous places, inspired by our Christian faith.

Come join our 34,000+ staff working in nearly 100 countries and share the joy of transforming vulnerable children’s life stories!

Key Responsibilities

Data Analyst Business Partner

Salary: £30,000 - £35,000 per annum, depending on experience + good range of benefits

Contract: Permanent – 36.5 hours per week – part time or flexible working considered

Based: Flexible- minimum travel to MK once per month

World Vision is an international children’s charity working with children, their communities, and with supporters and partners, in almost 100 countries.

Through long-term development projects, emergency responses and advocacy we’ve helped bring lasting change to millions of children, over more than 60 years. And as a Christian organisation, everything we do is motivated by our faith as we strive to reflect God’s unconditional love.

Work for World Vision UK and you will be part of a truly global Partnership, building brighter futures for vulnerable children.

Job Purpose

Like solving puzzles? What if you could help solve some of our biggest puzzles that meant you were ultimately helping thousands of our most vulnerable children, how would that feel?

You would be using your amazing data skills to help World Vision unlock new opportunities found within our data and equip teams with the data and insight needed to transform our individual giving programme. We would point you at our key strategic initiatives such as Childhood Rescue and Single Giving and watch you do your thing.

You would be partnering closely with marketing teams to deliver real actionable insights that fuels growth in both our acquisition and retention activities with the end goal of improving the overall value of our supporter base. And by working alongside different teams they will look to your unique talents to help guide them to make the best possible decisions. Sound good?

The Candidate

You will using your unique talent of proven data analytics to solve problems that are evenly matched by your ability to manage powerful collaborations with your business partners. We need you to get people fired up around the insights you uncover!

Your experience in managing relationships at different levels along with the ability to influence decision making will be paramount in ensuring this role is successful. You’ll work closely with marketing teams to help them write sharp data briefs and to be clear on what the problem is that they need to solve.

Using various data tools such as SQL, Python and others you’ll need to be good at taking your data insights and turning them into a story or a narrative that your colleagues can quickly understand and provide recommendations that they can act upon. Working on your own initiative is a key feature of this role but don’t worry you will have the close support of your management team behind you.

In addition to the salary offered, we offer good benefits including pension, generous holiday entitlement and free parking (MK only).

Please upload your CV of full employment history explaining any gaps of employment and reasons for leaving your previous employer. This must be accompanied with a covering letter stating how you meet the essential criteria given in the advert.

Closing Date for applications: 17th March 2023

Please note, we reserve the right to interview and appoint before the advertised closing date.

Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere is at the heart of our Christian organisation. We promote diversity of thought, culture and background, which connects the entire World Vision family. As such, World Vision is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and aspire to reflect this in our workforce. We particularly welcome applications from under-represented sections of the community. World Vision UK also operates flexible working policies and practices.

As a child-focused organisation, World Vision UK is committed to the safeguarding of children, therefore any offer of employment is conditional upon the successful completion of applicable background checks, including a criminal records check.

For More Information See

World Vision UK is a registered organisation operating the Misconduct Disclosure Scheme (MDS) and we shall check with your previous employers about your behaviour and conduct. We will be requesting they complete a form known as a Statement of Conduct.

https://misconduct-disclosure-scheme.org/

By submitting your application, you understand and accept that World Vision UK will process the data you provide for the purposes of your application and in accordance with the World Vision UK - Job Applicant Privacy Notice.

Applicant Types Accepted

Local Applicants Only

Data Analyst Business Partner

Salary: £30,000 - £35,000 per annum, depending on experience + good range of benefits

Contract: Permanent – 36.5 hours per week – part time or flexible working considered

Based: Flexible- minimum travel to MK once per month

World Vision is an international children’s charity working with children, their communities, and with supporters and partners, in almost 100 countries.

Through long-term development projects, emergency responses and advocacy we’ve helped bring lasting change to millions of children, over more than 60 years. And as a Christian organisation, everything we do is motivated by our faith as we strive to reflect God’s unconditional love.

Work for World Vision UK and you will be part of a truly global Partnership, building brighter futures for vulnerable children.

Job Purpose

Like solving puzzles? What if you could help solve some of our biggest puzzles that meant you were ultimately helping thousands of our most vulnerable children, how would that feel?

You would be using your amazing data skills to help World Vision unlock new opportunities found within our data and equip teams with the data and insight needed to transform our individual giving programme. We would point you at our key strategic initiatives such as Childhood Rescue and Single Giving and watch you do your thing.

You would be partnering closely with marketing teams to deliver real actionable insights that fuels growth in both our acquisition and retention activities with the end goal of improving the overall value of our supporter base. And by working alongside different teams they will look to your unique talents to help guide them to make the best possible decisions. Sound good?

The Candidate

You will using your unique talent of proven data analytics to solve problems that are evenly matched by your ability to manage powerful collaborations with your business partners. We need you to get people fired up around the insights you uncover!

Your experience in managing relationships at different levels along with the ability to influence decision making will be paramount in ensuring this role is successful. You’ll work closely with marketing teams to help them write sharp data briefs and to be clear on what the problem is that they need to solve.

Using various data tools such as SQL, Python and others you’ll need to be good at taking your data insights and turning them into a story or a narrative that your colleagues can quickly understand and provide recommendations that they can act upon. Working on your own initiative is a key feature of this role but don’t worry you will have the close support of your management team behind you.

In addition to the salary offered, we offer good benefits including pension, generous holiday entitlement and free parking (MK only).

Please upload your CV of full employment history explaining any gaps of employment and reasons for leaving your previous employer. This must be accompanied with a covering letter stating how you meet the essential criteria given in the advert.

Closing Date for applications: 17th March 2023

Please note, we reserve the right to interview and appoint before the advertised closing date.

Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere is at the heart of our Christian organisation. We promote diversity of thought, culture and background, which connects the entire World Vision family. As such, World Vision is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and aspire to reflect this in our workforce. We particularly welcome applications from under-represented sections of the community. World Vision UK also operates flexible working policies and practices.

As a child-focused organisation, World Vision UK is committed to the safeguarding of children, therefore any offer of employment is conditional upon the successful completion of applicable background checks, including a criminal records check.

For More Information See

World Vision UK is a registered organisation operating the Misconduct Disclosure Scheme (MDS) and we shall check with your previous employers about your behaviour and conduct. We will be requesting they complete a form known as a Statement of Conduct.

https://misconduct-disclosure-scheme.org/

By submitting your application, you understand and accept that World Vision UK will process the data you provide for the purposes of your application and in accordance with the World Vision UK - Job Applicant Privacy Notice.

Applicant Types Accepted

Local Applicants Only

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




We are looking to recruit a Data Analyst within our Market Data group. The primary focus of this role will be related to the management of inbound and outbound data used to support Tradeweb's electronic trading platform and its data products. In this role, the Data Analyst will be involved with the onboarding and review process related to new and existing reference data used to populate Tradeweb's Security Master Data. The Analyst will also be responsible in documenting and maintaining quality checks on data products. The data will cover a broad array of financial markets and securities.




Job Responsibilities:




Update and document current data processes.
Develop tests, reports, and procedures around data quality improvements.
Perform operational checks for data quality validation.
Implement data requests to fulfill business requirements.
Track and communicate entitlement changes related to use of third party data.
Analyze and test new and existing data sets.
Write specifications around data extraction, transformation, and mapping.
Day-to-day operational work; quality checks, daily tests, internal client queries.




Required Qualifications:




Strong academic record, including a relevant degree (Finance/computer science/technology).
Passion for data analysis with emphasis on financial markets reference data.
Knowledge of Fixed Income and Equity securities across a broad array of markets is a plus.
Strong data analysis skills with an emphasis on data quality.
Familiarity with data mapping, data modeling, and relational database design.
Ability to write basic to intermediate SQL queries.
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, VBA, database connections, etc.) .
Experience with Python
Strong communication skills and the ability to coordinate projects with multiple parties.
Ability to work on multiple projects with shifting priorities in a fast paced environment.




About Tradeweb:




Tradeweb Markets Inc. (NASDAQ: TW) is a leading, global operator of electronic marketplaces for rates, credit, equities and money markets. Founded in 1996, Tradeweb provides access to markets, data and analytics, electronic trading, straight-through-processing and reporting for clients in the institutional, wholesale and retail markets. Advanced technologies developed by Tradeweb enhance price discovery, order execution and trade workflows while allowing for greater scale and helping to reduce risks in client trading operations. For more information, please go to www.tradeweb.com .




Tradeweb values diversity of culture and thought and seeks talented, qualified employees in all its operations around the world regardless of race, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other protected classification under country or local law.




Private Policy Statement Link:




https://www2.tradeweb.com/l/105492/2021-05-05/h7v2kl/105492/1620231674fqv9j2ci/Tradeweb_EU_Applicant_Privacy_Policy.pdf

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hybrid role - 2 days a week in the office, 3 days a week at home.

Overall Job Purpose

To play a vital role in the VitalityLife reinsurance team by taking on the responsibility to provide VitalityLife’s reinsurers with accurate and timely monthly reinsurance accounts required to meet all treaty deadlines. This includes working on a big project to migrate the current system to new software.

Working with actuaries and actuarial analysts in the UK, systems analysts in South Africa and UK based reinsurers.

Accountabilities

Responsible for the production of the monthly reinsurance accounts. This includes working with the reinsurance systems development team to ensure the reinsurance premium calculations in the system are correct, this requires writing the reinsurance premium calculation specifications for the systems developers. Responsible for ensuring the data in the monthly accounts is correct and consistent
Perform checks on the monthly accounts using Excel/R. Identify areas where the systems are not built according to the specification and rectify them with the support of the system developers
Assist in the testing and sign-off of policy & reinsurance system releases from a reinsurance perspective
Assist in improving and automating the production of the monthly reinsurance accounts as much as possible
Contribute to the design, build, testing and documentation of newly developed data processes and analysis in response to new product launches and reinsurance treaty changes, as well as the maintenance and enhancement of existing processes
Work with the product development team on product changes from a reinsurance perspective
Working on the project to migrate to a new reinsurance system. This will involve working with new software and an external team of experts to build this system. This role includes working on the actual migration (e.g. coding the reinsurance premium calculations into the system) as well as overseeing this project
Build good relationships with reinsurers and interact with them on a regular basis
Prepare relevant documentation for regular review meetings with reinsurers
Communicate relevant project progress to management and project stakeholders


Skills Required

Essential

Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (e.g. actuarial, mathematics, economics, engineering, computer science)
At least three years experience in a data analyst role.
Advanced skills working in Microsoft Excel
Experience of coding in R
Experience of data analysis
Ability to grasp concepts of a technical nature quickly
Excellent relationship building – with both internal colleagues and external partners
Excellent communication skills, both formal and informal


Desirable

Experience of working with reinsurance accounts
Experience of working in an actuarial team
Experience of working with systems developers


About Us

Vitality is an award-winning, dynamic and vibrant financial services provider, with a ground-breaking vision for the future, where individuals are enabled to succeed and are rewarded and recognised for their contribution to our business. We’re the UK insurer and investment provider that rewards people for positive lifestyle choices – a key element of our Shared-value model. With 1.4m UK members and more than 25m globally, we’re out to make the world a healthier, happier place. This applies as much to our people as it does to our members.

Working for Vitality, you'll experience an exciting mix of creativity and innovation, within a framework of challenging objectives and a passion for delivering the best. We think work should be fun and sociable, and we want our people to get the most out of every day. Our people are chosen for their skills, knowledge, enthusiasm and attitude but above all, their belief that anything can be achieved. Wherever possible, we will consider a variety of working options to suit your lifestyle, whether that be hybrid home/office working, flexible working and part or full time employment. It’s what we call offering shared values, because a healthy happy team is good for us, good for our members and good for you.

If you have any questions, please contact: recruitment@vitality.co.uk .

Our Perks

As well as a highly competitive pay package, you’ll enjoy: Free places to Vitality sponsored run events, online fitness classes and wellbeing workshops, competitions to win tickets to top-flight sporting events, health checks and access to our full range of partners and rewards.

Flexible Working

Vitality Health Insurance

Bonus Scheme

Health & Wellbeing Incentives

Training & Development Opportunities

Reward & Recognition Schemes

At Vitality, we are committed to diversity and inclusion because it’s good for our employees, for our business, and for society. This means we treat all job applicants fairly and welcome applications from all communities and affinity groups.

If you want to find out more about our values, our people and our commitments visit our careers site here below:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Keeping millions of global customers engaged through entertainment 24 hours a day, seven days a week takes the insight, intelligence, and ingenuity of a global team of switched-on media professionals. We are QVC, the world’s biggest broadcast-retailer always on - and on a mission to change the way the world shops.

JOB PURPOSE

Perform strategic analysis, business modelling, and reporting to Business, Corporate & Global Executive level concerning the Commercial state of the business on all platforms, current trends, and future directions. Develop decision-making processes and tools that will drive the organization to be more effective and efficient. Ensure integrity, availability, and relevance of all Commerce BP&A reporting platforms, tools, and data. Partner closely with Commercial & Finance teams to understand business needs and provide informed support. Conduct training and consultation to ensure tools and information are used appropriately. Collaborate with Global BP&A, Commerce & IT teams to develop global standards and deliver new reporting technology & insight.

Analytics

Partner with the Commerce & Finance teams to understand business needs and pro-actively provide analytical support & recommendations to support those needs.
Interrogate data and reporting to provide action-oriented, contextual analysis & recommendations to the Commerce teams & Executive (up to CEO level).
Ensure availability, consistency, accuracy and relevance of all Commercial Analytics output.

Developments

Support & propose business initiatives and develop aligned modelling, analysis, reporting, and processes.
Design & implement new reporting & tools. Enable UK transition to new global data sources and technology.
Lead training for Commerce & Finance teams on new technology platforms to ensure continuity of capability and ensure the business leverages new functionality.
Work closely with the Commerce BP&A team, Finance & Strategy, Commerce, Management and all levels of the Business to understand their analytics needs and data integrity issues
Act as an evangelist to sure ensure maximum adoption of Commerce BP&A methods, tools and processes
Present & persuade using relevant contextual analysis to communicate business trends, risks & opportunities – to CEO level
Commerce Analyst should reach out to the Business and identify work that they can support.
Plan and prioritise own workload with minimal supervision.
Decide where and how to source and present data and the analytical methods to use.
Determine how best to interpret requirements to ensure information is most relevant.
Provide active business support by contextually analysing and providing recommendations.
Manage multiple projects at any one time.
The post holder is responsible for ensuring that agreed milestones are adhered to in relations to projects assigned to them.
Work is dictated by reporting requirements from the Business.
Ad hoc reports and projects will be assigned by the Senior Commerce Analyst and Commerce BP&A lead.

Knowledge, Skills & Experience

High level of analytical skills is essential to deal with large volumes of data available.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required
A high level of attention to detail and accuracy.
Knowledge & proven experience in the use statistical techniques.
Expert in the use of Microsoft office, with reference to MS PowerPoint, Visio and Word.
Advanced MS Access & Excel skills (Inc. VBA programming).
Strong technical understanding of database design including data manipulation through SQL
Experience of using reporting tools to collate MI.
Experience of data warehouse structure & access from use of Hyperion or similar i.e.) Business objects.
Strong Communications & Influencing skills to present complex analysis in a concise and effective manner.

We Offer

Being a part of our Finance Team. Exposure to our global business, Leadership Team and how we work across a variety of markets including, the US, UK, Germany, and Italy.
Open and trusted teamwork in which we value fun along the way.
Competitive benefits that include private medical care, life insurance, benefit cafeteria.
Casual atmosphere and all of that you will experience in our modern office.

INDCORP

At QVC we see it like this, you spend a third of your life in work, so work happy* Live better.

Join us as we enrich life’s everyday moments – including yours. Apply today!

If you enjoy being a part of a team, creating experiences and delighting customers, it’s so you. If you’re excited about retail, fashion, media, social, live streaming, technology, customer service, design and more, you’ll find amazing projects to work on. If you want to grow professionally and learn every day, you’ll thrive with us. If you appreciate flexible working options, our Qurated community, where intentional connections matter and a company committed to diversity, equity and inclusion, you’ll be amazed at what’s available for our team members! We offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package including competitive compensation and great benefits, employee assistance/wellbeing programmes, and much more. With friendly teams, ambitious projects and fast-moving careers, working with us - it’s so you!

For Qurate Retail Group, our focus on diversity, equity and inclusion is deeply rooted in Our Principles. They call on us to Drive Progress, Act With Empathy, Be Brave, Embrace the Future, and Do What’s Right so that everyone can thrive. We are committed to ensuring that our workplace provides equal employment opportunities for all team members and candidates and complies with all applicable laws and regulations. As an equal opportunity employer, Qurate Retail Group is committed to a barrier-free employment process. If you need reasonable accommodations/support throughout, please contact us at CareersQI@qvc.com for assistance. QVC UK is a Disability Confident employer and operates a Guaranteed Interview Scheme. For any UK based roles - if you’d like to be considered under this scheme, please indicate this on the application form.

Click Apply and log in with your existing account or create an account. This will allow you to check the status of your application at any time and receive the most up to date communications from our Talent Acquisition team.
